[Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns came [home]306-home in a silent mood , and [we]542-we durst not ask [her]86-miss jenkyns many questions . [She]86-miss jenkyns told [us]542-we that [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie had fainted , and that [she]85-miss jessie and [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had had some difficulty in bringing [her]85-miss jessie round ; but that , as soon as [she]85-miss jessie recovered , [she]85-miss jessie begged [one of [them]545-them]544-one of them to go and sit with [[her]85-miss jessie sister]394-her sister . “ [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins says [she]85-miss jessie can not live many days , and [she]85-miss jessie shall be spared this shock , ”[85-miss jessie] said [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie , shivering with feelings to which [she]85-miss jessie dared not give way . “ But how can [you]86-miss jenkyns manage , [[my]86-miss jenkyns dear]2063-my dear ? ”[86-miss jenkyns] asked [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns ; “ [you]86-miss jenkyns can not bear up , [she]85-miss jessie must see [your]86-miss jenkyns tears . ”[86-miss jenkyns] “ [God]103-god will help [me]86-miss jenkyns — [I]86-miss jenkyns will not give way — [she]85-miss jessie was asleep when the news came ; [she]85-miss jessie may be asleep yet . [She]85-miss jessie would be so utterly miserable , not merely at [[my]86-miss jenkyns father]2082-my father ’s death , but to think of what would become of [me]86-miss jenkyns ; [she]85-miss jessie is so good to [me]86-miss jenkyns . ”[86-miss jenkyns] [She]86-miss jenkyns looked up earnestly in [their]547-their faces with [her]86-miss jenkyns soft true eyes , and [Miss Pole]89-miss pole told [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns afterwards [she]86-miss jenkyns could hardly bear it , knowing , as [she]86-miss jenkyns did , how [Miss Brown]85-miss jessie treated [[her]85-miss jessie sister]394-her sister . However , it was settled according to [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie ’s wish . [Miss Brown]85-miss jessie was to be told [[her]85-miss jessie father]397-her father had been summoned to take a short journey on [railway business]550-railway business . [They]547-their had managed it in some way — [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns could not exactly say how . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole was to stop with [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie . [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson had sent to inquire . And this was all [we]551-we heard that night ; and a sorrowful night it was . The next day a full account of the fatal accident was in the county paper which [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns took in . [Her]86-miss jenkyns eyes were very weak , [she]86-miss jenkyns said , and [she]86-miss jenkyns asked [me]0-i to read it . When [I]0-i came to the “ [gallant gentleman]2145-gallant gentleman was deeply engaged in the perusal of a number of ‘ [Pickwick]90-the pickwick papers , ’ which [he]2145-gallant gentleman had just received , ”[86-miss jenkyns] [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns shook [her]86-miss jenkyns head long and solemnly , and then sighed out , “ Poor , [dear , infatuated man]2146-dear , infatuated man ! ”[86-miss jenkyns] The corpse was to be taken from [the station]552-the station to [the parish church]553-the parish church , there to be interred . [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie had set [her]85-miss jessie heart on following it to the grave ; and no dissuasives could alter [her]85-miss jessie resolve . [Her]85-miss jessie restraint upon [herself]85-miss jessie made [her]85-miss jessie almost obstinate ; [she]85-miss jessie resisted all [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s entreaties and [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns ’ advice . At last [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns gave up the point ; and after a silence , which [I]0-i feared portended some deep displeasure against [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie , [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns said [she]86-miss jenkyns should accompany [the latter]554-the latter to the funeral . “ It is not fit for [you]85-miss jessie to go alone . It would be against both propriety and humanity were [I]86-miss jenkyns to allow it . ”[86-miss jenkyns] [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie seemed as if [she]85-miss jessie did not half like this arrangement ; but [her]85-miss jessie obstinacy , if [she]85-miss jessie had any , had been exhausted in [her]85-miss jessie determination to go to the interment . [She]85-miss jessie longed , poor thing , [I]0-i have no doubt , to cry alone over the grave of [the dear father to whom [she]85-miss jessie had been all in all , and to give way , for one little half - hour , uninterrupted by sympathy and unobserved by friendship]555-the dear father to whom she had been all in all , and to give way , for one little half - hour , uninterrupted by sympathy and unobserved by friendship . But it was not to be . That afternoon [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns sent out for [a yard of black crape]556-a yard of black crape , and employed [herself]86-miss jenkyns busily in trimming the little black silk bonnet [I]0-i have spoken about . When it was finished [she]85-miss jessie put it on , and looked at [us]557-we for approbation — admiration [she]85-miss jessie despised . [I]0-i was full of sorrow , but , by one of those whimsical thoughts which come unbidden into [our]557-we heads , in times of deepest grief , [I]0-i no sooner saw the bonnet than [I]0-i was reminded of a helmet ; and in that hybrid bonnet , half helmet , half jockey - cap , did [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns attend [Captain Brown]80-captain brown ’s funeral , and , [I]0-i believe , supported [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie with a tender , indulgent firmness which was invaluable , allowing [her]86-miss jenkyns to weep [her]86-miss jenkyns passionate fill before [they]558-they left . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , and [I]0-i , meanwhile attended to [Miss Brown]85-miss jessie : and hard work [we]557-we found it to relieve [her]85-miss jessie querulous and never - ending complaints . But if [we]557-we were so weary and dispirited , what must [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie have been ! Yet [she]85-miss jessie came back almost calm as if [she]85-miss jessie had gained a new strength . [She]85-miss jessie put off [her]85-miss jessie mourning dress , and came in , looking pale and gentle , thanking [us]557-we each with a soft long pressure of the hand . [She]85-miss jessie could even smile — a faint , sweet , wintry smile — as if to reassure [us]557-we of [her]85-miss jessie power to endure ; but [her]85-miss jessie look made [our]557-we eyes fill suddenly with tears , more than if [she]85-miss jessie had cried outright . It was settled that [Miss Pole]89-miss pole was to remain with [her]85-miss jessie all the watching livelong night ; and that [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [I]0-i were to return in the morning to relieve [them]559-them , and give [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie the opportunity for a few hours of sleep . But when the morning came , [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty appeared at the breakfast - table , equipped in [her]98-miss matty helmet - bonnet , and ordered [Miss Matty]98-miss matty to stay at [home]306-home , as [she]98-miss matty meant to go and help to nurse . [She]98-miss matty was evidently in a state of great friendly excitement , which [she]98-miss matty showed by eating [her]98-miss matty breakfast standing , and scolding [the household]561-the household all round . No nursing — [no energetic strong - minded woman]562-no energetic strong - minded woman could help [Miss Brown]85-miss jessie now . There was that in [the room]370-the room as [we]557-we entered which was stronger than [us]557-we all , and made [us]557-we shrink into solemn awestruck helplessness . [Miss Brown]85-miss jessie was dying . [We]557-we hardly knew [her]85-miss jessie voice , it was so devoid of the complaining tone [we]557-we had always associated with it . [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie told [me]0-i afterwards that it , and [her]85-miss jessie face too , were just what [they]564-they had been formerly , when [[her]85-miss jessie mother]439-her mother ’s death left [her]85-miss jessie [the young anxious head of [the family]567-the family]566-the young anxious head of the family , of whom only [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie survived . [She]85-miss jessie was conscious of [[her]85-miss jessie sister]394-her sister ’s presence , though not , [I]0-i think , of [ours]557-we . [We]557-we stood a little behind the curtain : [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie knelt with [her]85-miss jessie face near [[her]85-miss jessie sister]394-her sister ’s , in order to catch the last soft awful whispers . “ Oh , [Jessie]85-miss jessie ! [Jessie]85-miss jessie ! How selfish [I]85-miss jessie have been ! [God]103-god forgive [me]85-miss jessie for letting [you]85-miss jessie sacrifice [yourself]85-miss jessie for [me]85-miss jessie as [you]85-miss jessie did ! [I]85-miss jessie have so loved [you]85-miss jessie — and yet [I]85-miss jessie have thought only of [myself]85-miss jessie . [God]103-god forgive [me]85-miss jessie ! ”[85-miss jessie] “ Hush , love ! hush ! ”[85-miss jessie] said [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie , sobbing . “ And [[my]85-miss jessie father]2082-my father , [[my]85-miss jessie dear]2063-my dear , [dear father]2149-dear father ! [I]85-miss jessie will not complain now , if [God]103-god will give [me]85-miss jessie strength to be patient . But , oh , [Jessie]85-miss jessie ! tell [[my]85-miss jessie father]2082-my father how [I]85-miss jessie longed and yearned to see [him]2082-my father at last , and to ask [his]2082-my father forgiveness . [He]2082-my father can never know now how [I]85-miss jessie loved [him]2082-my father — oh ! if [I]85-miss jessie might but tell [him]2082-my father , before [I]85-miss jessie die ! What a life of sorrow [his]2082-my father has been , and [I]85-miss jessie have done so little to cheer [him]2082-my father ! ”[85-miss jessie] A light came into [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie ’s face . “ Would it comfort [you]85-miss jessie , [dearest]2151-dearest , to think that [he]2082-my father does know?—would it comfort [you]85-miss jessie , love , to know that [his]2082-my father cares , [his]2082-my father sorrows”—Her[85-miss jessie] voice quivered , but [she]85-miss jessie steadied it into calmness—“Mary ! [he]2082-my father has gone before [you]85-miss jessie to the place where [the weary are at rest]2152-the weary are at rest . [He]2082-my father knows now how [you]85-miss jessie loved [him]2082-my father . ”[85-miss jessie] A strange look , which was not distress , came over [Miss Brown]85-miss jessie ’s face . [She]85-miss jessie did not speak for some time , but then [we]570-we saw [her]85-miss jessie lips form the words , rather than heard the sound—“Father , [mother]2153-mother , [Harry]106-harry , [Archy;”—then]107-archy;”—then[85-miss jessie] , as if it were a new idea throwing a filmy shadow over [her]85-miss jessie darkened mind—“But [you]85-miss jessie will be alone , [Jessie]85-miss jessie ! ”[85-miss jessie] [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie had been feeling this all during the silence , [I]0-i think ; for the tears rolled down [her]85-miss jessie cheeks like rain , at these words , and [she]85-miss jessie could not answer at first . Then [she]85-miss jessie put [her]85-miss jessie hands together tight , and lifted them up , and said — but not to us—“Though [He]2154-he slay [me]85-miss jessie , yet will [I]85-miss jessie trust in [Him]2154-he . ”[85-miss jessie] In a few moments more [Miss Brown]85-miss jessie lay calm and still — never to sorrow or murmur more . After this second funeral , [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty insisted that [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie should come to stay with [her]98-miss matty rather than go back to [the desolate house]571-the desolate house , which , in fact , [we]572-we learned from [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie , must now be given up , as [she]85-miss jessie had not wherewithal to maintain it . [She]85-miss jessie had something above twenty pounds a year , besides the interest of the money for which the furniture would sell ; but [she]85-miss jessie could not live upon that : and so [we]572-we talked over [her]85-miss jessie qualifications for earning money . “ [I]85-miss jessie can sew neatly , ”[85-miss jessie] said [she]85-miss jessie , “ and [I]85-miss jessie like nursing . [I]85-miss jessie think , too , [I]85-miss jessie could manage [a house]2155-a house , if [any one]2107-any one would try [me]85-miss jessie as [housekeeper]337-housekeeper ; or [I]85-miss jessie would go into [a shop]2158-a shop as [saleswoman]2159-saleswoman , if [they]2107-any one would have patience with [me]85-miss jessie at first . ”[85-miss jessie] [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty declared , in an angry voice , that [she]98-miss matty should do no such thing ; and talked to [herself]98-miss matty about “ [some people]2160-some people having no idea of [their]2160-some people rank as [[a captain]2161-a captain ’s daughter]2162-a captain ’s daughter , ”[98-miss matty] nearly an hour afterwards , when [she]98-miss matty brought [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie up a basin of delicately - made arrowroot , and stood over [her]85-miss jessie like a dragoon until the last spoonful was finished : then [she]98-miss matty disappeared . [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie began to tell [me]0-i some more of the plans which had suggested themselves to [her]85-miss jessie , and insensibly fell into talking of the days that were past and gone , and interested [me]0-i so much [I]0-i neither knew nor heeded how time passed . [We]573-us were both startled when [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty reappeared , and caught [us]573-us crying . [I]0-i was afraid lest [she]98-miss matty would be displeased , as [she]98-miss matty often said that crying hindered digestion , and [I]0-i knew [she]98-miss matty wanted [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie to get strong ; but , instead , [she]98-miss matty looked queer and excited , and fidgeted round [us]573-us without saying anything . At last [she]98-miss matty spoke . “ [I]98-miss matty have been so much startled — no , [I]98-miss matty ’ve not been at all startled — don’t mind [me]98-miss matty , [[my]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie — [I’ve]98-miss matty been very much surprised — in fact , [I]98-miss matty ’ve had [a caller]2164-a caller , whom [you]85-miss jessie knew once , [[my]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie ”[98-miss matty] — [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie went very white , then flushed scarlet , and looked eagerly at [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty . “ [A gentleman]321-a gentleman , [[my]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear , who wants to know if [you]85-miss jessie would see [him]321-a gentleman . ”[98-miss matty] “ Is it?—it is not”—stammered[98-miss matty] out [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie — and got no farther . “ This is [his]321-a gentleman card , ”[98-miss matty] said [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty , giving it to [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie ; and while [her]85-miss jessie head was bent over it , [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty went through a series of winks and odd faces to [me]0-i , and formed [her]98-miss matty lips into a long sentence , of which , of course , [I]0-i could not understand a word . “ May [he]321-a gentleman come up ? ”[98-miss matty] asked [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty at last . “ Oh , yes ! certainly ! ”[85-miss jessie] said [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie , as much as to say , this is [[your]574-you house]575-your house , [you]574-you may show [any visitor where [you]574-you like]576-any visitor where you like . [She]85-miss jessie took up some knitting of [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s and began to be very busy , though [I]0-i could see how [she]85-miss jessie trembled all over . [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty rang the bell , and told [the servant who answered it to show [Major Gordon]108-major gordon [upstairs]340-upstairs]577-the servant who answered it to show major gordon upstairs ; and , presently , in walked [a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards . [He]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards shook hands with [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie ; but [he]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards could not see [her]85-miss jessie eyes , [she]85-miss jessie kept them so fixed on the ground . [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty asked [me]0-i if [I]0-i would come and help [her]85-miss jessie to tie up the preserves in [the store - room]420-the store - room ; and though [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie plucked at [my]0-i gown , and even looked up at [me]0-i with begging eye , [I]0-i durst not refuse to go where [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty asked . Instead of tying up preserves in [the store - room]420-the store - room , however , [we]582-we went to talk in [the dining - room]583-the dining - room ; and there [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty told [me]0-i what [Major Gordon]108-major gordon had told [her]98-miss matty ; how [he]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards had served in the same regiment with [Captain Brown]80-captain brown , and had become acquainted with [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie , then [a sweet - looking , blooming girl of eighteen]584-a sweet - looking , blooming girl of eighteen ; how [the acquaintance]585-the acquaintance had grown into love on [his]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards part , though it had been some years before [he]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards had spoken ; how , on becoming possessed , through the will of [an uncle]438-an uncle , of [a good estate in [Scotland]12-scotland]587-a good estate in scotland , [he]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards had offered and been refused , though with so much agitation and evident distress that [he]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards was sure [she]85-miss jessie was not indifferent to [him]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards ; and how [he]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards had discovered that the obstacle was the fell disease which was , even then , too surely threatening [[her]85-miss jessie sister]394-her sister . [She]98-miss matty had mentioned that [the surgeons]589-the surgeons foretold intense suffering ; and there was [no one]477-no one but [herself]98-miss matty to nurse [her]98-miss matty poor [Mary]109-mary , or cheer and comfort [[her]98-miss matty father]397-her father during the time of illness . [They]592-they had had long discussions ; and on [her]98-miss matty refusal to pledge [herself]98-miss matty to [him]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards as [[his]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards wife]593-his wife when all should be over , [he]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards had grown angry , and broken off entirely , and gone abroad , believing that [she]98-miss matty was [a cold - hearted person whom [he]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards would do well to forget]594-a cold - hearted person whom he would do well to forget . [He]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards had been travelling in [the East]13-the east , and was on [his]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards return [home]306-home when , at [Rome]14-rome , [he]579-a tall , fine , frank - looking man of forty or upwards saw the account of [Captain Brown]80-captain brown ’s death in _ Galignani _ . Just then [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , who had been out all the morning , and had only lately returned to [the house]2059-the house , burst in with a face of dismay and outraged propriety . “ Oh , goodness [me]98-miss matty ! ”[98-miss matty] [she]98-miss matty said . “ [Deborah]99-deborah , there ’s [a gentleman sitting in [the drawing - room]503-the drawing - room with [his]2168-a gentleman sitting in the drawing - room with his arm round miss jessie ’s waist arm round [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie ’s waist]2168-a gentleman sitting in the drawing - room with his arm round miss jessie ’s waist ! ”[98-miss matty] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s eyes looked large with terror . [ Picture : “ With [his]2168-a gentleman sitting in the drawing - room with his arm round miss jessie ’s waist arm around [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie ’s waist ! ”[98-miss matty] ] [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty snubbed [her]98-miss matty down in an instant . “ [The most proper place in [the world]333-the world]2170-the most proper place in the world for [his]2168-a gentleman sitting in the drawing - room with his arm round miss jessie ’s waist arm to be in . Go away , [Matilda]86-miss jenkyns , and mind [your]86-miss jenkyns own business . ”[98-miss matty] This from [[her]98-miss matty sister]394-her sister , who had hitherto been [a model of feminine decorum]598-a model of feminine decorum , was a blow for [poor Miss Matty]98-miss matty , and with a double shock [she]98-miss matty left [the room]370-the room . The last time [I]0-i ever saw poor [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty was many years after this . [Mrs Gordon]110-mrs gordon had kept up a warm and affectionate intercourse with all at [Cranford]1-cranford . [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , and [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had all been to visit [her]98-miss matty , and returned with wonderful accounts of [[her]98-miss matty house]600-her house , [[her]98-miss matty husband]601-her husband , [her]98-miss matty dress , and [her]98-miss matty looks . For , with happiness , something of [her]98-miss matty early bloom returned ; [she]98-miss matty had been a year or two younger than [we]602-we had taken [her]98-miss matty for . [Her]98-miss matty eyes were always lovely , and , as [Mrs Gordon]110-mrs gordon , [her]98-miss matty dimples were not out of place . At the time to which [I]0-i have referred , when [I]0-i last saw [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty , [that lady]603-that lady was old and feeble , and had lost something of [her]98-miss matty strong mind . [Little Flora Gordon]111-flora was staying with [the Misses Jenkyns]112-the misses jenkyns , and when [I]0-i came in [she]111-flora was reading aloud to [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty , who lay feeble and changed on the sofa . [Flora]111-flora put down [the _ Rambler _]604-the _ rambler _ when [I]0-i came in . “ Ah ! ”[98-miss matty] said [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty , “ [you]0-i find [me]98-miss matty changed , [[my]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear . [I]98-miss matty ca n’t see as [I]98-miss matty used to do . If [Flora]111-flora were not here to read to [me]98-miss matty , [I]98-miss matty hardly know how [I]98-miss matty should get through the day . Did [you]0-i ever read [the _ Rambler _]604-the _ rambler _ ? It ’s a wonderful book — wonderful ! and the most improving reading for [Flora]111-flora ”[98-miss matty] ( which [I]0-i daresay it would have been , if [she]111-flora could have read half the words without spelling , and could have understood the meaning of a third ) , “ better than that strange old book , with the queer name , [poor Captain Brown]80-captain brown was killed for reading — that book by [Mr Boz]94-mr boz , [you]0-i know—‘Old Poz ’ ; when [I]111-flora was [a girl]2174-a girl — but that ’s a long time ago — [I]111-flora acted [Lucy]113-lucy in ‘ Old Poz . ’ ”[111-flora] [She]111-flora babbled on long enough for [Flora]111-flora to get a good long spell at the “ Christmas Carol , ”[111-flora] which [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had left on the table . CHAPTER III . A LOVE AFFAIR OF LONG AGO [I]0-i THOUGHT that probably [my]0-i connection with [Cranford]96-signor brunoni would cease after [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty ’s death ; at least , that it would have to be kept up by correspondence , which bears much the same relation to personal intercourse that the books of dried plants [I]0-i sometimes see ( “ Hortus Siccus , ”[605-they] [I]0-i think [they]605-they call the thing ) do to the living and fresh flowers in [the lanes]606-the lanes and [meadows]607-meadows . [I]0-i was pleasantly surprised , therefore , by receiving a letter from [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ( who had always come in for a supplementary week after [my]0-i annual visit to [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty ) proposing that [I]0-i should go and stay with [her]89-miss pole ; and then , in a couple of days after [my]0-i acceptance , came a note from [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , in which , in a rather circuitous and very humble manner , [she]98-miss matty told [me]0-i how much pleasure [I]0-i should confer if [I]0-i could spend a week or two with [her]89-miss pole , either before or after [I]0-i had been at [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s ; “ for , ”[98-miss matty] [she]98-miss matty said , “ since [[my]98-miss matty dear sister]2175-my dear sister ’s death [I]98-miss matty am well aware [I]98-miss matty have no attractions to offer ; it is only to the kindness of [[my]98-miss matty friends]2176-my friends that [I]98-miss matty can owe [their]2176-my friends company . ”[98-miss matty] Of course [I]0-i promised to come to [dear Miss Matty]98-miss matty as soon as [I]0-i had ended [my]0-i visit to [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ; and the day after [my]0-i arrival at [Cranford]1-cranford [I]0-i went to see [her]89-miss pole , much wondering what [the house]2059-the house would be like without [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty , and rather dreading the changed aspect of things . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty began to cry as soon as [she]98-miss matty saw [me]0-i . [She]98-miss matty was evidently nervous from having anticipated [my]0-i call . [I]0-i comforted [her]98-miss matty as well as [I]0-i could ; and [I]0-i found the best consolation [I]0-i could give was the honest praise that came from [my]0-i heart as [I]0-i spoke of [the deceased]609-the deceased . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty slowly shook [her]98-miss matty head over each virtue as it was named and attributed to [[her]98-miss matty sister]394-her sister ; and at last [she]98-miss matty could not restrain the tears which had long been silently flowing , but hid [her]98-miss matty face behind [her]98-miss matty handkerchief and sobbed aloud . “ Dear [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , taking [her]98-miss matty hand — for indeed [I]0-i did not know in what way to tell [her]98-miss matty how sorry [I]0-i was for [her]98-miss matty , left deserted in [the world]333-the world . [She]98-miss matty put down [her]98-miss matty handkerchief and said — “ [[My]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear , [I]98-miss matty ’d rather [you]2063-my dear did not call [me]98-miss matty [Matty]98-miss matty . [She]98-miss matty did not like it ; but [I]98-miss matty did many a thing [she]98-miss matty did not like , [I]98-miss matty ’m afraid — and now [she]98-miss matty ’s gone ! If [you]2063-my dear please , [[my]98-miss matty love]2178-my love , will [you]2063-my dear call [me]98-miss matty [Matilda]86-miss jenkyns ? ”[98-miss matty] [I]0-i promised faithfully , and began to practise the new name with [Miss Pole]89-miss pole that very day ; and , by degrees , [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns ’s feeling on the subject was known through [Cranford]1-cranford , and [we]612-we all tried to drop the more familiar name , but with so little success that by - and - by [we]612-we gave up the attempt . [My]0-i visit to [Miss Pole]89-miss pole was very quiet . [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns had so long taken the lead in [Cranford]1-cranford that now [she]86-miss jenkyns was gone , [they]613-they hardly knew how to give a party . [The Honourable Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson , to whom [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns [herself]86-miss jenkyns had always yielded the post of honour , was fat and inert , and very much at the mercy of [[her]86-miss jenkyns old servants]614-her old servants . If [they]613-they chose that [she]86-miss jenkyns should give a party , [they]613-they reminded [her]86-miss jenkyns of the necessity for so doing : if not , [she]86-miss jenkyns let it alone . There was all the more time for [me]0-i to hear old - world stories from [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , while [she]86-miss jenkyns sat knitting , and [I]0-i making [[my]0-i father]2082-my father ’s shirts . [I]0-i always took a quantity of plain sewing to [Cranford]1-cranford ; for , as [we]616-we did not read much , or walk much , [I]0-i found it a capital time to get through [my]0-i work . One of [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s stories related to a shadow of a love affair that was dimly perceived or suspected long years before . Presently , the time arrived when [I]0-i was to remove to [[Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns ’s house]617-miss matilda ’s house . [I]0-i found [her]86-miss jenkyns timid and anxious about the arrangements for [my]0-i comfort . Many a time , while [I]0-i was unpacking , did [she]86-miss jenkyns come backwards and forwards to stir the fire which burned all the worse for being so frequently poked . “ Have [you]0-i drawers enough , [dear]2179-dear ? ”[86-miss jenkyns] asked [she]86-miss jenkyns . “ [I]86-miss jenkyns do n’t know exactly how [[my]86-miss jenkyns sister]2108-my sister used to arrange them . [She]2108-my sister had capital methods . [I]86-miss jenkyns am sure [she]2108-my sister would have trained [a servant]2181-a servant in a week to make a better fire than this , and [Fanny]114-fanny has been with [me]86-miss jenkyns four months . ”[86-miss jenkyns] This subject of [servants]336-servants was a standing grievance , and [I]0-i could not wonder much at it ; for if [gentlemen]619-gentlemen were scarce , and almost unheard of in [the “ genteel society ”[623-the lower classes] of [Cranford]1-cranford]620-the “ genteel society ” of cranford , [they]619-gentlemen or [[their]619-gentlemen counterparts]621-their counterparts — [handsome young men]622-handsome young men — abounded in [the lower classes]623-the lower classes . [The pretty neat servant - maids]624-the pretty neat servant - maids had [their]624-the pretty neat servant - maids choice of desirable “ [followers ”]2182-followers ”[624-the pretty neat servant - maids] ; and [[their]624-the pretty neat servant - maids mistresses]625-their mistresses , without having the sort of mysterious dread of [men]491-men and matrimony that [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns had , might well feel a little anxious lest the heads of [[their]624-the pretty neat servant - maids comely maids]627-their comely maids should be turned by [the joiner]628-the joiner , or [the butcher]629-the butcher , or [the gardener]630-the gardener , who were obliged , by [their]624-the pretty neat servant - maids callings , to come to [the house]2059-the house , and who , as ill - luck would have it , were generally handsome and unmarried . [[Fanny]114-fanny ’s lovers]632-fanny ’s lovers , if [she]114-fanny had any — and [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns suspected [her]114-fanny of so many flirtations that , if [she]114-fanny had not been very pretty , [I]0-i should have doubted [her]114-fanny having one — were a constant anxiety to [[her]114-fanny mistress]341-her mistress . [She]114-fanny was forbidden , by the articles of [her]114-fanny engagement , to have “ [followers ”]2182-followers ”[114-fanny] ; and though [she]114-fanny had answered , innocently enough , doubling up the hem of [her]114-fanny apron as [she]114-fanny spoke , “ Please , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , [I]114-fanny never had more than one at a time , ”[114-fanny] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty prohibited that one . But a vision of [a man]2058-a man seemed to haunt [the kitchen]635-the kitchen . [Fanny]114-fanny assured [me]0-i that it was all fancy , or else [I]0-i should have said [myself]0-i that [I]0-i had seen [a man]2058-a man ’s coat - tails whisk into [the scullery]637-the scullery once , when [I]0-i went on an errand into [the store - room]420-the store - room at night ; and another evening , when , [our]639-our watches having stopped , [I]0-i went to look at the clock , there was a very odd appearance , singularly like [a young man squeezed up between the clock and the back of the open kitchen]640-a young man squeezed up between the clock and the back of the open kitchen door : and [I]0-i thought [Fanny]114-fanny snatched up the candle very hastily , so as to throw the shadow on the clock face , while [she]114-fanny very positively told [me]0-i the time half - an - hour too early , as [we]639-our found out afterwards by the church clock . But [I]0-i did not add to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s anxieties by naming [my]0-i suspicions , especially as [Fanny]114-fanny said to [me]0-i , the next day , that it was such [a queer kitchen]641-a queer kitchen for having odd shadows about [it]641-a queer kitchen , [she]114-fanny really was almost afraid to stay ; “ for [you]0-i know , [miss]2185-miss , ”[114-fanny] [she]114-fanny added , “ [I]114-fanny do n’t see a creature from six o’clock tea , till [Missus]2186-missus rings the bell for prayers at ten . ”[114-fanny] However , it so fell out that [Fanny]114-fanny had to leave and [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns begged [me]0-i to stay and “ settle [her]114-fanny ”[86-miss jenkyns] with [the new maid]642-the new maid ; to which [I]0-i consented , after [I]0-i had heard from [[my]0-i father]2082-my father that [he]2082-my father did not want [me]0-i at [home]306-home . [The new servant]645-the new servant was [a rough , honest - looking , country girl , who had only lived in [a farm place]647-a farm place before]646-a rough , honest - looking , country girl , who had only lived in a farm place before ; but [I]0-i liked [her]645-the new servant looks when [she]645-the new servant came to be hired ; and [I]0-i promised [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns to put [her]645-the new servant in the ways of [the house]2059-the house . The said ways were religiously such as [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns thought [[her]86-miss jenkyns sister]394-her sister would approve . Many a domestic rule and regulation had been a subject of plaintive whispered murmur to [me]0-i during [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns ’s life ; but now that [she]86-miss jenkyns was gone , [I]0-i do not think that even [I]0-i , who was [a favourite , durst]650-a favourite , durst have suggested an alteration . To give an instance : [we]651-we constantly adhered to the forms which were observed , at meal - times , in “ [[my]650-a favourite , durst father]2082-my father , [[the rector]2120-the rector ’s house]2189-the rector ’s house . ”[650-a favourite , durst] Accordingly , [we]651-we had always wine and dessert ; but the decanters were only filled when there was a party , and what remained was seldom touched , though [we]651-we had two wine - glasses apiece every day after dinner , until the next festive occasion arrived , when the state of the remainder wine was examined into in a family council . The dregs were often given to [the poor]299-the poor : but occasionally , when a good deal had been left at the last party ( five months ago , it might be ) , it was added to some of a fresh bottle , brought up from [the cellar]653-the cellar . [I]0-i fancy poor [Captain Brown]80-captain brown did not much like wine , for [I]0-i noticed [he]80-captain brown never finished [his]80-captain brown first glass , and [most military men]654-most military men take several . Then , as to [our]651-we dessert , [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns used to gather currants and gooseberries for it [herself]86-miss jenkyns , which [I]0-i sometimes thought would have tasted better fresh from the trees ; but then , as [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns observed , there would have been nothing for dessert in summer - time . As it was , [we]651-we felt very genteel with [our]651-we two glasses apiece , and a dish of gooseberries at the top , of currants and biscuits at the sides , and two decanters at the bottom . When oranges came in , a curious proceeding was gone through . [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns did not like to cut the fruit ; for , as [she]86-miss jenkyns observed , the juice all ran out [nobody]2061-nobody knew where ; sucking ( only [I]0-i think [she]86-miss jenkyns used some more recondite word ) was in fact the only way of enjoying oranges ; but then there was the unpleasant association with a ceremony frequently gone through by [little babies]656-little babies ; and so , after dessert , in orange season , [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty used to rise up , possess [themselves]657-themselves each of an orange in silence , and withdraw to the privacy of [[their]657-themselves own rooms]658-their own rooms to indulge in sucking oranges . [I]0-i had once or twice tried , on such occasions , to prevail on [Miss Matty]98-miss matty to stay , and had succeeded in [[her]98-miss matty sister]394-her sister ’s lifetime . [I]0-i held up a screen , and did not look , and , as [she]86-miss jenkyns said , [she]86-miss jenkyns tried not to make the noise very offensive ; but now that [she]86-miss jenkyns was left alone , [she]86-miss jenkyns seemed quite horrified when [I]0-i begged [her]86-miss jenkyns to remain with [me]0-i in [the warm dining - parlour]660-the warm dining - parlour , and enjoy [her]86-miss jenkyns orange as [she]86-miss jenkyns liked best . And so it was in everything . [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty ’s rules were made more stringent than ever , because the framer of them was gone where there could be no appeal . In all things else [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns was meek and undecided to a fault . [I]0-i have heard [Fanny]114-fanny turn [her]86-miss jenkyns round twenty times in a morning about dinner , just as [the little hussy]661-the little hussy chose ; and [I]0-i sometimes fancied [she]86-miss jenkyns worked on [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns ’s weakness in order to bewilder [her]86-miss jenkyns , and to make [her]86-miss jenkyns feel more in the power of [[her]86-miss jenkyns clever servant]662-her clever servant . [I]0-i determined that [I]0-i would not leave [her]86-miss jenkyns till [I]0-i had seen what sort of a person [Martha]98-miss matty was ; and , if [I]0-i found [her]98-miss matty trustworthy , [I]0-i would tell [her]98-miss matty not to trouble [[her]98-miss matty mistress]341-her mistress with every little decision . [Martha]98-miss matty was blunt and plain - spoken to a fault ; otherwise [she]98-miss matty was [a brisk , well - meaning , but very ignorant girl]664-a brisk , well - meaning , but very ignorant girl . [She]98-miss matty had not been with [us]665-us a week before [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns and [I]0-i were astounded one morning by the receipt of a letter from [a cousin of [hers]86-miss jenkyns , who had been twenty or thirty years in [India]15-india , and who had lately , as [we]665-us had seen by the “ Army List]2190-a cousin of hers , who had been twenty or thirty years in india , and who had lately , as we had seen by the “ army list , ”[2190-a cousin of hers , who had been twenty or thirty years in india , and who had lately , as we had seen by the “ army list] returned to [England]3-england , bringing with [him]666-him [an invalid wife who had never been introduced to [her]667-an invalid wife who had never been introduced to her english relations English relations]667-an invalid wife who had never been introduced to her english relations . [Major Jenkyns]115-major jenkyns wrote to propose that [he]115-major jenkyns and [[his]115-major jenkyns wife]593-his wife should spend a night at [Cranford]1-cranford , on [his]115-major jenkyns way to [Scotland]12-scotland — at [the inn]669-the inn , if it did not suit [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns to receive [them]670-them into [[her]86-miss jenkyns house]600-her house ; in which case [they]670-them should hope to be with [her]86-miss jenkyns as much as possible during the day . Of course it _ must _ suit [her]86-miss jenkyns , as [she]86-miss jenkyns said ; for all [Cranford]96-signor brunoni knew that [she]86-miss jenkyns had [[[her]86-miss jenkyns sister]394-her sister ’s bedroom]673-her sister ’s bedroom at liberty ; but [I]0-i am sure [she]86-miss jenkyns wished [the Major]674-the major had stopped in [India]15-india and forgotten [[his]674-the major cousins]675-his cousins out and out . “ Oh ! how must [I]86-miss jenkyns manage ? ”[86-miss jenkyns] asked [she]86-miss jenkyns helplessly . “ If [Deborah]99-deborah had been alive [she]99-deborah would have known what to do with [a gentleman - visitor]2191-a gentleman - visitor . And slippers , and coat - brushes ? ”[86-miss jenkyns] [I]0-i suggested that probably [he]674-the major would bring all these things with [him]674-the major . “ And after dinner , how am [I]0-i to know when to get up and leave [him]674-the major to [his]674-the major wine ? [Deborah]99-deborah would have done it so well ; [she]99-deborah would have been quite in [her]99-deborah element . Will [he]674-the major want coffee , do [you]0-i think ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i undertook the management of the coffee , and told [her]676-her [I]0-i would instruct [Martha]98-miss matty in the art of waiting — in which it must be owned [she]98-miss matty was terribly deficient — and that [I]0-i had no doubt [Major]115-major jenkyns and [Mrs Jenkyns]116-mrs jenkyns would understand the quiet mode in which [a lady]677-a lady lived by [herself]677-a lady in [a country town]678-a country town . But [she]676-her was sadly fluttered . [I]0-i made [her]676-her empty [her]676-her decanters and bring up two fresh bottles of wine . [I]0-i wished [I]0-i could have prevented [her]676-her from being present at [my]0-i instructions to [Martha]98-miss matty , for [she]676-her frequently cut in with some fresh direction , muddling [the poor girl]679-the poor girl ’s mind as [she]676-her stood open - mouthed , listening to [us]680-we both . “ Hand the vegetables round , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i ( foolishly , [I]0-i see now — for it was aiming at more than [we]680-we could accomplish with quietness and simplicity ) ; and then , seeing [her]676-her look bewildered , [I]0-i added , “ take the vegetables round to [people]359-people , and let [them]359-people help [themselves]359-people . ”[0-i] “ And mind [you]0-i go first to [the ladies]417-the ladies , ”[0-i] put in [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns . “ Always go to [the ladies]417-the ladies before [gentlemen]619-gentlemen when [you]0-i are waiting . ”[0-i] “ [I]98-miss matty ’ll do it as [you]0-i tell [me]98-miss matty , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , ”[98-miss matty] said [Martha]98-miss matty ; “ but [I]98-miss matty like [lads]2199-lads best . ”[98-miss matty] [We]680-we felt very uncomfortable and shocked at this speech of [Martha]98-miss matty ’s , yet [I]0-i do n’t think [she]98-miss matty meant any harm ; and , on the whole , [she]98-miss matty attended very well to [our]680-we directions , except that [she]98-miss matty “ nudged ”[98-miss matty] [the Major]674-the major when [he]674-the major did not help [himself]674-the major as soon as [she]98-miss matty expected to the potatoes , while [she]98-miss matty was handing them round . [The major]674-the major and [[his]674-the major wife]593-his wife were [quiet unpretending people]684-quiet unpretending people enough when [they]685-they did come ; languid , as [all East Indians]686-all east indians are , [I]0-i suppose . [We]680-we were rather dismayed at [their]685-they bringing [two servants]687-two servants with [them]685-they , [a Hindoo body - servant for [the Major]674-the major]688-a hindoo body - servant for the major , and [a steady elderly maid for [[his]674-the major wife]593-his wife]690-a steady elderly maid for his wife ; but [they]685-they slept at [the inn]669-the inn , and took off a good deal of the responsibility by attending carefully to [[their]685-they master]693-their master ’s and [mistress]694-mistress ’s comfort . [Martha]98-miss matty , to be sure , had never ended [her]98-miss matty staring at [the East Indian]117-the east indian ’s white turban and brown complexion , and [I]0-i saw that [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns shrunk away from [him]674-the major a little as [he]674-the major waited at dinner . Indeed , [she]86-miss jenkyns asked [me]0-i , when [they]685-they were gone , if [he]674-the major did not remind [me]0-i of [Blue Beard]118-blue beard ? On the whole , the visit was most satisfactory , and is a subject of conversation even now with [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns ; at the time it greatly excited [Cranford]96-signor brunoni , and even stirred up [the apathetic and Honourable Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson to some expression of interest , when [I]0-i went to call and thank [her]78-mrs jamieson for the kind answers [she]78-mrs jamieson had vouchsafed to [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns ’s inquiries as to the arrangement of [[a gentleman]321-a gentleman ’s dressing - room]696-a gentleman ’s dressing - room — answers which [I]0-i must confess [she]86-miss jenkyns had given in the wearied manner of [the Scandinavian prophetess]697-the scandinavian prophetess — “ Leave [me]86-miss jenkyns , leave [me]86-miss jenkyns to repose . ”[86-miss jenkyns] And _ now _ [I]0-i come to the love affair . It seems that [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had [a cousin]698-a cousin , once or twice removed , who had offered to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty long ago . Now [this cousin]699-this cousin lived four or five miles from [Cranford]1-cranford on [[his]699-this cousin own estate]700-his own estate ; but [[his]699-this cousin property]701-his property was not large enough to entitle [him]699-this cousin to rank higher than [a yeoman]702-a yeoman ; or rather , with something of the “ pride which apes humility , ”[699-this cousin] [he]699-this cousin had refused to push [himself]699-this cousin on , as so many of [[his]699-this cousin class]703-his class had done , into the ranks of [the squires]704-the squires . [He]699-this cousin would not allow [himself]699-this cousin to be called [Thomas Holbrook]119-mr holbrook , _ Esq . _ ; [he]699-this cousin even sent back letters with this address , telling [the post - mistress at [Cranford]1-cranford]705-the post - mistress at cranford that [his]699-this cousin name was _ [Mr _ Thomas Holbrook]119-mr holbrook , [yeoman]706-yeoman . [He]699-this cousin rejected all domestic innovations ; [he]699-this cousin would have the house door stand open in summer and shut in winter , without knocker or bell to summon [a servant]2181-a servant . The closed fist or the knob of a stick did [this office]708-this office for [him]699-this cousin if [he]699-this cousin found the door locked . [He]699-this cousin despised every refinement which had not its root deep down in humanity . If [people]359-people were not ill , [he]699-this cousin saw no necessity for moderating [his]699-this cousin voice . [He]699-this cousin spoke the dialect of [the country]710-the country in perfection , and constantly used it in conversation ; although [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ( who gave [me]0-i these particulars ) added , that [he]699-this cousin read aloud more beautifully and with more feeling than any one [she]89-miss pole had ever heard , except [the late rector]711-the late rector . “ And how came [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns not to marry [him]699-this cousin ? ”[0-i] asked [I.]0-i “ Oh , [I]0-i do n’t know . [She]86-miss jenkyns was willing enough , [I]0-i think ; but [you]0-i know [Cousin Thomas]120-cousin thomas would not have been enough of [a gentleman]321-a gentleman for [the rector]2120-the rector and [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns . ”[0-i] “ Well ! but [they]2202-they were not to marry [him]699-this cousin , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , impatiently . “ No ; but [they]2202-they did not like [Miss Matty]98-miss matty to marry below [her]98-miss matty rank . [You]0-i know [she]98-miss matty was [[the rector]2120-the rector ’s daughter]2121-the rector ’s daughter , and somehow [they]2202-they are related to [Sir Peter Arley]121-peter : [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty thought a deal of that . ”[0-i] “ [Poor Miss Matty]98-miss matty ! ”[0-i] said [I.]0-i “ Nay , now , [I]0-i do n’t know anything more than that [he]699-this cousin offered and was refused . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty might not like [him]699-this cousin — and [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty might never have said a word — it is only a guess of [mine]0-i . ”[0-i] “ Has [she]98-miss matty never seen [him]699-this cousin since ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i inquired . “ No , [I]0-i think not . [You]0-i see [Woodley]19-woodley , [[Cousin Thomas]120-cousin thomas ’s house]2205-cousin thomas ’s house , lies half - way between [Cranford]1-cranford and [Misselton]16-misselton ; and [I]0-i know [he]699-this cousin made [Misselton]16-misselton [[his]699-this cousin market - town]2206-his market - town very soon after [he]699-this cousin had offered to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ; and [I]0-i do n’t think [he]699-this cousin has been into [Cranford]1-cranford above once or twice since — once , when [I]0-i was walking with [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , in [High Street]17-high street , and suddenly [she]98-miss matty darted from [me]0-i , and went up [Shire Lane]18-shire lane . A few minutes after [I]0-i was startled by meeting [Cousin Thomas]120-cousin thomas . ”[0-i] “ How old is [he]699-this cousin ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked , after a pause of [castle]712-castle - building . “ [He]699-this cousin must be about seventy , [I]89-miss pole think , [[my]89-miss pole dear]2063-my dear , ”[89-miss pole] said [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , blowing up [[my]0-i castle]713-my castle , as if by gun - powder , into small fragments . Very soon after — at least during [my]0-i long visit to [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns — [I]0-i had the opportunity of seeing [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook ; seeing , too , [his]119-mr holbrook first encounter with [[his]119-mr holbrook former love]714-his former love , after thirty or forty years ’ separation . [I]0-i was helping to decide whether any of the new assortment of coloured silks which [they]715-they had just received at [the shop]716-the shop would do to match a grey and black mousseline - delaine that wanted a new breadth , when [a tall , thin , Don Quixote - looking old man]717-a tall , thin , don quixote - looking old man came into [the shop]716-the shop for some woollen gloves . [I]0-i had never seen [the person ( who was rather striking )]719-the person ( who was rather striking ) before , and [I]0-i watched [him]717-a tall , thin , don quixote - looking old man rather attentively while [Miss Matty]98-miss matty listened to [the shopman]720-the shopman . [The stranger]721-the stranger wore a blue coat with brass buttons , drab breeches , and gaiters , and drummed with [his]721-the stranger fingers on the counter until [he]721-the stranger was attended to . When [he]721-the stranger answered [the shop - boy]722-the shop - boy ’s question , “ What can [I]721-the stranger have the pleasure of showing [you]722-the shop - boy to - day , [sir]2208-sir ? ”[721-the stranger] [I]0-i saw [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns start , and then suddenly sit down ; and instantly [I]0-i guessed who it was . [She]86-miss jenkyns had made some inquiry which had to be carried round to [the other shopman]723-the other shopman . “ [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns wants the black sarsenet two - and - twopence [the yard]2209-the yard ”[86-miss jenkyns] ; and [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook had caught the name , and was across [the shop]716-the shop in two strides . “ [Matty]98-miss matty — [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns — [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns ! God bless [my]119-mr holbrook soul ! [I]119-mr holbrook should not have known [you]86-miss jenkyns . How are [you]86-miss jenkyns ? how are [you]86-miss jenkyns ? ”[119-mr holbrook] [He]119-mr holbrook kept shaking [her]86-miss jenkyns hand in a way which proved the warmth of [his]119-mr holbrook friendship ; but [he]119-mr holbrook repeated so often , as if to [himself]119-mr holbrook , “ [I]119-mr holbrook should not have known [you]86-miss jenkyns ! ”[119-mr holbrook] that any sentimental romance which [I]0-i might be inclined to build was quite done away with by [his]119-mr holbrook manner . However , [he]119-mr holbrook kept talking to [us]725-we all the time [we]725-we were in [the shop]716-the shop ; and then waving [the shopman with the unpurchased gloves on one side]727-the shopman with the unpurchased gloves on one side , with “ Another time , [sir]2208-sir ! another time ! ”[119-mr holbrook] [he]119-mr holbrook walked [home]306-home with [us]725-we . [I]0-i am happy to say [[my]0-i client]729-my client , [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns , also left [the shop]716-the shop in an equally bewildered state , not having purchased either green or red silk . [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook was evidently full with honest loud - spoken joy at meeting [[his]119-mr holbrook old love]731-his old love again ; [he]119-mr holbrook touched on the changes that had taken place ; [he]119-mr holbrook even spoke of [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns as “ [[Your]86-miss jenkyns poor sister]2211-your poor sister ! Well , well ! [we]725-we have all [our]725-we faults ”[119-mr holbrook] ; and bade [us]725-we good - bye with many a hope that [he]119-mr holbrook should soon see [Miss Matty]98-miss matty again . [She]98-miss matty went straight to [[her]98-miss matty room]732-her room , and never came back till [our]725-we early tea - time , when [I]0-i thought [she]98-miss matty looked as if [she]98-miss matty had been crying . [ Picture : [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook ... bade [us]725-we good - bye ] CHAPTER IV . A VISIT TO [AN OLD BACHELOR]733-an old bachelor A FEW days after , a note came from [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook , asking [us]725-we — impartially asking both of [us]725-we — in a formal , old - fashioned style , to spend a day at [[his]119-mr holbrook house]734-his house — a long June day — for it was June now . [He]119-mr holbrook named that [he]119-mr holbrook had also invited [[his]119-mr holbrook cousin]735-his cousin , [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ; so that [we]725-we might join in a fly , which could be put up at [[his]119-mr holbrook house]734-his house . [I]0-i expected [Miss Matty]98-miss matty to jump at this invitation ; but , no ! [Miss Pole]89-miss pole and [I]0-i had the greatest difficulty in persuading [her]98-miss matty to go . [She]98-miss matty thought it was improper ; and was even half annoyed when [we]725-we utterly ignored the idea of any impropriety in [her]98-miss matty going with [two other ladies]737-two other ladies to see [[her]98-miss matty old lover]738-her old lover . Then came a more serious difficulty . [She]98-miss matty did not think [Deborah]99-deborah would have liked [her]98-miss matty to go . This took [us]725-we half a day ’s good hard talking to get over ; but , at the first sentence of relenting , [I]0-i seized the opportunity , and wrote and despatched an acceptance in [her]98-miss matty name — fixing day and hour , that all might be decided and done with . The next morning [she]98-miss matty asked [me]0-i if [I]0-i would go down to [the shop]716-the shop with [her]98-miss matty ; and there , after much hesitation , [we]725-we chose out three caps to be sent [home]306-home and tried on , that the most becoming might be selected to take with [us]725-we on Thursday . [She]98-miss matty was in a state of silent agitation all the way to [Woodley]19-woodley . [She]98-miss matty had evidently never been [there]289-there before ; and , although [she]98-miss matty little dreamt [I]0-i knew anything of [her]98-miss matty early story , [I]0-i could perceive [she]98-miss matty was in a tremor at the thought of seeing the place which might have been [[her]98-miss matty home]742-her home , and round which it is probable that many of [her]98-miss matty innocent girlish imaginations had clustered . It was a long drive there , through [paved jolting lanes]743-paved jolting lanes . [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns sat bolt upright , and looked wistfully out of the windows as [we]725-we drew near the end of [our]725-we journey . [The aspect of [the country]710-the country]744-the aspect of the country was quiet and pastoral . [Woodley]19-woodley stood among [fields]746-fields ; and there was [an old - fashioned garden where roses and currant - bushes touched each other]747-an old - fashioned garden where roses and currant - bushes touched each other , and where the feathery asparagus formed a pretty background to the pinks and gilly - flowers ; there was no drive up to the door . [We]725-we got out at a little gate , and walked up [a straight box - edged path]748-a straight box - edged path . “ [[My]89-miss pole cousin]2212-my cousin might make a drive , [I]89-miss pole think , ”[89-miss pole] said [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , who was afraid of ear - ache , and had only [her]89-miss pole cap on . “ [I]98-miss matty think it is very pretty , ”[98-miss matty] said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , with a soft plaintiveness in [her]98-miss matty voice , and almost in a whisper , for just then [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook appeared at the door , rubbing [his]119-mr holbrook hands in very effervescence of hospitality . [He]119-mr holbrook looked more like [my]0-i idea of [Don Quixote]124-don quixote than ever , and yet the likeness was only external . [[His]119-mr holbrook respectable housekeeper]749-his respectable housekeeper stood modestly at the door to bid [us]725-we welcome ; and , while [she]749-his respectable housekeeper led [the elder ladies]750-the elder ladies [upstairs]340-upstairs to [a bedroom]752-a bedroom , [I]0-i begged to look about [the garden]753-the garden . [My]0-i request evidently pleased [the old gentleman]754-the old gentleman , who took [me]0-i all round [the place]480-the place and showed [me]0-i [his]754-the old gentleman six - and - twenty cows , named after the different letters of the alphabet . As [we]725-we went along , [he]754-the old gentleman surprised [me]0-i occasionally by repeating apt and beautiful quotations from [the poets]756-the poets , ranging easily from [Shakespeare]125-shakespeare and [George Herbert]126-george herbert to those of [our]725-we own day . [He]754-the old gentleman did this as naturally as if [he]754-the old gentleman were thinking aloud , and [their]756-the poets true and beautiful words were the best expression [he]754-the old gentleman could find for what [he]754-the old gentleman was thinking or feeling . To be sure [he]754-the old gentleman called [Byron]127-byron “ [[my]754-the old gentleman Lord]2213-my lord [Byrron]128-byrron , ”[754-the old gentleman] and pronounced the name of [Goethe]129-goethe strictly in accordance with the English sound of the letters—“As [Goethe]129-goethe says , ‘ [Ye]2214-ye ever - verdant palaces , ’ ”[754-the old gentleman] & amp;c . Altogether , [I]0-i never met with [a man , before or since , who had spent so long a life in [a secluded and not impressive country]758-a secluded and not impressive country , with ever - increasing delight in the daily and yearly change of season and beauty]757-a man , before or since , who had spent so long a life in a secluded and not impressive country , with ever - increasing delight in the daily and yearly change of season and beauty . When [he]754-the old gentleman and [I]0-i went in , [we]725-we found that dinner was nearly ready in [the kitchen]635-the kitchen — for so [I]0-i suppose [the room]370-the room ought to be called , as there were oak dressers and cupboards all round , all over by the side of the fireplace , and only a small Turkey carpet in the middle of the flag - floor . [The room]370-the room might have been easily made into [a handsome dark oak dining - parlour]762-a handsome dark oak dining - parlour by removing the oven and a few other appurtenances of [a kitchen]763-a kitchen , which were evidently never used , the real cooking - place being at some distance . [The room in which [we]725-we were expected to sit]764-the room in which we were expected to sit was [a stiffly - furnished , ugly apartment]765-a stiffly - furnished , ugly apartment ; but that in which [we]725-we did sit was what [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook called [the counting - house]766-the counting - house , where [he]119-mr holbrook paid [[his]119-mr holbrook labourers]767-his labourers [their]767-his labourers weekly wages at a great desk near the door . The rest of [the pretty sitting - room]768-the pretty sitting - room — looking into [the orchard]769-the orchard , and all covered over with dancing tree - shadows — was filled with books . They lay on the ground , they covered the walls , [they]770-they strewed the table . [He]119-mr holbrook was evidently half ashamed and half proud of [his]119-mr holbrook extravagance in this respect . [They]771-they were of all kinds — poetry and wild weird tales prevailing . [He]119-mr holbrook evidently chose [his]119-mr holbrook books in accordance with [his]119-mr holbrook own tastes , not because such and such were classical or established favourites . “ Ah ! ”[119-mr holbrook] [he]119-mr holbrook said , “ [we]725-we farmers ought not to have much time for reading ; yet somehow one ca n’t help it . ”[119-mr holbrook] “ What [a pretty room]2215-a pretty room ! ”[98-miss matty] said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , _ sotto voce _ . “ What [a pleasant place]2216-a pleasant place ! ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , aloud , almost simultaneously . “ Nay ! if [you]0-i like it , ”[119-mr holbrook] replied [he]119-mr holbrook ; “ but can [you]0-i sit on these great , black leather , three - cornered chairs ? [I]119-mr holbrook like it better than [the best parlour]2217-the best parlour ; but [I]119-mr holbrook thought [ladies]2218-ladies would take that for [the smarter place]2219-the smarter place . ”[119-mr holbrook] It was [the smarter place]2219-the smarter place , but , like most smart things , not at all pretty , or pleasant , or [home]306-home - like ; so , while [we]774-we were at dinner , [the servant - girl]775-the servant - girl dusted and scrubbed the counting - house chairs , and [we]774-we sat there all the rest of the day . [We]774-we had pudding before meat ; and [I]0-i thought [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook was going to make some apology for [his]119-mr holbrook old - fashioned ways , for [he]119-mr holbrook began — “ [I]119-mr holbrook do n’t know whether [you]0-i like newfangled ways . ”[119-mr holbrook] “ Oh , not at all ! ”[98-miss matty] said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty . “ No more do [I]119-mr holbrook , ”[119-mr holbrook] said [he]119-mr holbrook . “ [[My]119-mr holbrook housekeeper]2220-my housekeeper _ will _ have these in [her]2220-my housekeeper new fashion ; or else [I]119-mr holbrook tell [her]2220-my housekeeper that , when [I]119-mr holbrook was [a young man]2221-a young man , [we]776-we used to keep strictly to [[my]119-mr holbrook father]2082-my father ’s rule , ‘ No broth , no ball ; no ball , no beef ’ ; and always began dinner with broth . Then [we]776-we had suet puddings , boiled in the broth with the beef : and then the meat itself . If [we]776-we did not sup [our]776-we broth , [we]776-we had no ball , which [we]776-we liked a deal better ; and the beef came last of all , and only those had it who had done justice to the broth and the ball . Now [folks]2223-folks begin with sweet things , and turn [their]2223-folks dinners topsy - turvy . ”[119-mr holbrook] When the ducks and green peas came , [we]776-we looked at [each other]302-each other in dismay ; [we]776-we had only two - pronged , black - handled forks . It is true the steel was as bright as silver ; but what were [we]776-we to do ? [Miss Matty]98-miss matty picked up [her]98-miss matty peas , one by one , on the point of the prongs , much as [Aminé]130-aminé ate [her]130-aminé grains of rice after [her]130-aminé previous feast with [the Ghoul]778-the ghoul . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole sighed over [her]98-miss matty delicate young peas as [she]98-miss matty left them on one side of [her]98-miss matty plate untasted , for they _ would _ drop between the prongs . [I]0-i looked at [[my]0-i host]779-my host : the peas were going wholesale into [his]779-my host capacious mouth , shovelled up by [his]779-my host large round - ended knife . [I]0-i saw , [I]0-i imitated , [I]0-i survived ! [[My]0-i friends]2176-my friends , in spite of [my]0-i precedent , could not muster up courage enough to do an ungenteel thing ; and , if [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook had not been so heartily hungry , [he]119-mr holbrook would probably have seen that the good peas went away almost untouched . After dinner , a clay pipe was brought in , and a spittoon ; and , asking [us]781-we to retire to [another room]782-another room , where [he]779-my host would soon join [us]781-we , if [we]781-we disliked tobacco - smoke , [he]779-my host presented [his]779-my host pipe to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , and requested [her]98-miss matty to fill the bowl . This was a compliment to [a lady in [his]779-my host youth]783-a lady in his youth ; but it was rather inappropriate to propose it as an honour to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , who had been trained by [[her]98-miss matty sister]394-her sister to hold smoking of every kind in utter abhorrence . But if it was a shock to [her]98-miss matty refinement , it was also a gratification to [her]98-miss matty feelings to be thus selected ; so [she]98-miss matty daintily stuffed the strong tobacco into the pipe , and then [we]781-we withdrew . “ It is very pleasant dining with [a bachelor]2224-a bachelor , ”[98-miss matty] said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty softly , as [we]781-we settled [ourselves]781-we in [the counting - house]766-the counting - house . “ [I]98-miss matty only hope it is not improper ; so many pleasant things are ! ”[98-miss matty] “ What a number of books [he]2224-a bachelor has ! ”[89-miss pole] said [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , looking round [the room]370-the room . “ And how dusty they are ! ”[89-miss pole] “ [I]98-miss matty think it must be like [one of [the great [Dr Johnson]91-dr johnson ’s rooms]2226-the great dr johnson ’s rooms]2225-one of the great dr johnson ’s rooms , ”[98-miss matty] said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty . “ What [a superior man]2227-a superior man [[your]98-miss matty cousin]2228-your cousin must be ! ”[98-miss matty] “ Yes ! ”[89-miss pole] said [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , “ [he]2228-your cousin ’s [a great reader]2229-a great reader ; but [I]89-miss pole am afraid [he]2228-your cousin has got into very uncouth habits with living alone . ”[89-miss pole] “ Oh ! uncouth is too hard a word . [ Picture : Now , what colour are ash - buds in March ] When [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook returned , [he]119-mr holbrook proposed a walk in [the fields]787-the fields ; but [the two elder ladies]788-the two elder ladies were afraid of damp , and dirt , and had only very unbecoming calashes to put on over [their]788-the two elder ladies caps ; so [they]788-the two elder ladies declined , and [I]0-i was again [[his]119-mr holbrook companion]789-his companion in a turn which [he]119-mr holbrook said [he]119-mr holbrook was obliged to take to see after [[his]119-mr holbrook men]790-his men . [He]119-mr holbrook strode along , either wholly forgetting [my]0-i existence , or soothed into silence by [his]119-mr holbrook pipe — and yet it was not silence exactly . [He]119-mr holbrook walked before [me]0-i with a stooping gait , [his]119-mr holbrook hands clasped behind [him]119-mr holbrook ; and , as some tree or cloud , or glimpse of [distant upland pastures]791-distant upland pastures , struck [him]119-mr holbrook , [he]119-mr holbrook quoted poetry to [himself]119-mr holbrook , saying it out loud in a grand sonorous voice , with just the emphasis that true feeling and appreciation give . [We]792-we came upon an old cedar tree , which stood at one end of [the house]2059-the house — “ The cedar spreads [his]119-mr holbrook dark - green layers of shade . ”[119-mr holbrook] “ Capital term—‘layers ! ’ [Wonderful man]2231-wonderful man ! ”[119-mr holbrook] [I]0-i did not know whether [he]119-mr holbrook was speaking to [me]0-i or not ; but [I]0-i put in an assenting “ wonderful , ”[0-i] although [I]0-i knew nothing about it , just because [I]0-i was tired of being forgotten , and of being consequently silent . [He]119-mr holbrook turned sharp round . “ Ay ! [you]0-i may say ‘ wonderful . ’ Why , when [I]119-mr holbrook saw the review of [his]119-mr holbrook poems in _ Blackwood _ , [I]119-mr holbrook set off within an hour , and walked seven miles to [Misselton]16-misselton ( for the horses were not in the way ) and ordered [them]2232-them . Now , what colour are ash - buds in [March]20-march ? ”[119-mr holbrook] Is [the man]424-the man going mad ? thought I. [He]424-the man is very like [Don Quixote]124-don quixote . “ What colour are they , [I]119-mr holbrook say ? ”[119-mr holbrook] repeated [he]119-mr holbrook vehemently . “ [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i do n’t know , [sir]2208-sir , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , with the meekness of ignorance . “ [I]0-i knew [you]2208-sir did n’t . And [I]0-i ’ve lived all [my]0-i life in [the country]710-the country ; more shame for [me]0-i not to know . [Black]131-black : they are jet - black , [madam]2237-madam . ”[0-i] And [he]119-mr holbrook went off again , swinging along to the music of some rhyme [he]119-mr holbrook had got hold of . When [we]795-we came back , nothing would serve [him]119-mr holbrook but [he]119-mr holbrook must read [us]795-we the poems [he]119-mr holbrook had been speaking of ; and [Miss Pole]89-miss pole encouraged [him]119-mr holbrook in [his]119-mr holbrook proposal , [I]0-i thought , because [she]89-miss pole wished [me]0-i to hear [his]119-mr holbrook beautiful reading , of which [she]89-miss pole had boasted ; but [she]89-miss pole afterwards said it was because [she]89-miss pole had got to a difficult part of [her]89-miss pole crochet , and wanted to count [her]89-miss pole stitches without having to talk . [I]119-mr holbrook must read them . ”[119-mr holbrook] As [we]796-we were getting into the fly to return , [I]0-i heard [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook say [he]119-mr holbrook should call on [the ladies]417-the ladies soon , and inquire how [they]417-the ladies got [home]306-home ; and this evidently pleased and fluttered [Miss Matty]98-miss matty at the time [he]119-mr holbrook said it ; but after [we]796-we had lost sight of [the old house among the trees]799-the old house among the trees [her]98-miss matty sentiments towards [the master of it]800-the master of it were gradually absorbed into a distressing wonder as to whether [Martha]98-miss matty had broken [her]98-miss matty word , and seized on the opportunity of [[her]98-miss matty mistress]341-her mistress ’s absence to have [a “ follower]2242-a “ follower . ”[98-miss matty] [Martha]98-miss matty looked good , and steady , and composed enough , as [she]98-miss matty came to help [us]796-we out ; [she]98-miss matty was always careful of [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , and to - night [she]98-miss matty made use of this unlucky speech — “ Eh ! But [she]98-miss matty never spoke of any former and more intimate acquaintance with [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook . [She]98-miss matty had probably met with so little sympathy in [her]98-miss matty early love , that [she]98-miss matty had shut it up close in [her]98-miss matty heart ; and it was only by a sort of watching , which [I]0-i could hardly avoid since [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s confidence , that [I]0-i saw how faithful [her]98-miss matty poor heart had been in its sorrow and its silence . [She]98-miss matty gave [me]0-i some good reason for wearing [her]98-miss matty best cap every day , and sat near the window , in spite of [her]98-miss matty rheumatism , in order to see , without being seen , down into [the street]467-the street . [He]119-mr holbrook came . [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns looked miserably ill ; and [I]0-i prepared to comfort and cosset [her]86-miss jenkyns . [I]0-i went down to have a private talk with [Martha]98-miss matty . “ How long has [[your]98-miss matty mistress]2256-your mistress been so poorly ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked , as [I]0-i stood by the kitchen fire . “ Well ! [I]0-i think it ’s better than a fortnight ; it is , [I]0-i know ; it was one Tuesday , after [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had been , that [she]2256-your mistress went into this moping way . [I]0-i thought [she]2256-your mistress was tired , and it would go off with a night ’s rest ; but no ! And [I]98-miss matty hope [you]98-miss matty find [[your]98-miss matty place]2259-your place comfortable ? ”[98-miss matty] “ Well , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , [missus]2261-missus is very kind , and there ’s plenty to eat and drink , and no more work but what [I]98-miss matty can do easily — but — ”[98-miss matty] [Martha]98-miss matty hesitated . “ But what , [Martha]98-miss matty ? ”[98-miss matty] “ Why , it seems so hard of missus not to let [me]98-miss matty have [any followers]2262-any followers ; there ’s such lots of [young fellows in [the town]281-the town]2263-young fellows in the town ; and [many a one]2265-many a one has as much as offered to keep company with [me]98-miss matty ; and [I]98-miss matty may never be in such a likely place again , and it ’s like wasting an opportunity . [Many a girl as [I]98-miss matty know]2266-many a girl as i know would have ’em unbeknownst to [missus]2261-missus ; but [I]98-miss matty ’ve given [my]98-miss matty word , and [I]98-miss matty ’ll stick to it ; or else this is just [the house for [missus]2261-missus never to be the wiser if [they]2270-they did come]2268-the house for missus never to be the wiser if they did come : and it ’s such [a capable kitchen]2271-a capable kitchen — there ’s such dark corners in [it]2271-a capable kitchen — [I’d]98-miss matty be bound to hide any one . [I]98-miss matty counted up last Sunday night — for [I]98-miss matty ’ll not deny [I]98-miss matty was crying because [I]98-miss matty had to shut the door in [Jem Hearn]133-jem ’s face , and [he]133-jem ’s [a steady young man]2272-a steady young man , fit for [any girl]2273-any girl ; only [I]98-miss matty had given [missus]2261-missus [my]98-miss matty word . ”[98-miss matty] [Martha]98-miss matty was all but crying again ; and [I]0-i had little comfort to give [her]98-miss matty , for [I]0-i knew , from old experience , of the horror with which both [the Miss Jenkynses]134-the miss jenkynses looked upon “ [followers ”]2182-followers ”[98-miss matty] ; and in [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s present nervous state this dread was not likely to be lessened . [I]0-i went to see [Miss Pole]89-miss pole the next day , and took [her]89-miss pole completely by surprise , for [she]89-miss pole had not been to see [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns for two days . “ And now [I]89-miss pole must go back with [you]98-miss matty , [[my]89-miss pole dear]2063-my dear , for [I]89-miss pole promised to let [her]89-miss pole know how [Thomas Holbrook]119-mr holbrook went on ; and , [I]89-miss pole ’m sorry to say , [[his]119-mr holbrook housekeeper]2277-his housekeeper has sent [me]89-miss pole word to - day that [he]119-mr holbrook has n’t long to live . [Poor Thomas]135-poor thomas ! that journey to [Paris]22-paris was quite too much for [him]119-mr holbrook . [[His]119-mr holbrook housekeeper]2277-his housekeeper says [he]119-mr holbrook has hardly ever been round [[his]119-mr holbrook fields]2279-his fields since , but just sits with [his]119-mr holbrook hands on [his]119-mr holbrook knees in [the counting - house]766-the counting - house , not reading or anything , but only saying what [a wonderful city]2281-a wonderful city [Paris]22-paris was ! [Paris]22-paris has much to answer for if it ’s killed [[my]89-miss pole cousin]2212-my cousin [Thomas]135-poor thomas , for [a better man]2283-a better man never lived . ”[89-miss pole] “ Does [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns know of [his]119-mr holbrook illness ? ”[0-i] asked [I]0-i — a new light as to the cause of [her]809-her indisposition dawning upon [me]0-i . “ [Dear]2179-dear ! to be sure , yes ! Has not [she]86-miss jenkyns told [you]2179-dear ? [I]89-miss pole let [her]86-miss jenkyns know a fortnight ago , or more , when first [I]89-miss pole heard of it . How odd [she]86-miss jenkyns should n’t have told [you]2179-dear ! ”[89-miss pole] Not at all , [I]0-i thought ; but [I]0-i did not say anything . [I]0-i felt almost guilty of having spied too curiously into that tender heart , and [I]0-i was not going to speak of its secrets — hidden , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty believed , from all [the world]333-the world . [I]0-i ushered [Miss Pole]89-miss pole into [[Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns ’s little drawing - room]811-miss matilda ’s little drawing - room , and then left [them]812-them alone . But [I]0-i was not surprised when [Martha]98-miss matty came to [[my]0-i bedroom]813-my bedroom door , to ask [me]0-i to go down to dinner alone , for [that missus]814-that missus had one of [her]98-miss matty bad headaches . [She]98-miss matty came into [the drawing - room]503-the drawing - room at tea - time , but it was evidently an effort to [her]98-miss matty ; and , as if to make up for some reproachful feeling against [[her]98-miss matty late sister]816-her late sister , [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns , which had been troubling [her]98-miss matty all the afternoon , and for which [she]98-miss matty now felt penitent , [she]98-miss matty kept telling [me]0-i how good and how clever [Deborah]99-deborah was in [her]99-deborah youth ; how [she]98-miss matty used to settle what gowns [they]817-they were to wear at all the parties ( faint , ghostly ideas of grim parties , far away in the distance , when [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [Miss Pole]89-miss pole were young ! ) ; and how [Deborah]99-deborah and [[her]99-deborah mother]439-her mother had started [the benefit society for [the poor]299-the poor]819-the benefit society for the poor , and taught [girls]821-girls cooking and plain sewing ; and how [Deborah]99-deborah had once danced with [a lord]822-a lord ; and how [she]98-miss matty used to visit at [[Sir Peter Arley]121-peter ’s]823-sir peter arley ’s , and tried to remodel [the quiet rectory establishment]824-the quiet rectory establishment on the plans of [Arley Hall]23-arley hall , where [they]817-they kept [thirty servants]825-thirty servants ; and how [she]98-miss matty had nursed [Miss Matty]98-miss matty through a long , long illness , of which [I]0-i had never heard before , but which [I]0-i now dated in [my]0-i own mind as following the dismissal of the suit of [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook . So [we]826-we talked softly and quietly of old times through the long November evening . The next day [Miss Pole]89-miss pole brought [us]826-we word that [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook was dead . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty heard the news in silence ; in fact , from the account of the previous day , it was only what [we]826-we had to expect . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole kept calling upon [us]826-we for some expression of regret , by asking if it was not sad that [he]119-mr holbrook was gone , and saying — “ To think of that pleasant day last June , when [he]119-mr holbrook seemed so well ! And [he]119-mr holbrook might have lived this dozen years if [he]119-mr holbrook had not gone to that wicked [Paris]22-paris , where [they]2285-they are always having revolutions . ”[89-miss pole] [She]89-miss pole paused for some demonstration on [our]826-we part . [I]0-i saw [Miss Matty]98-miss matty could not speak , [she]98-miss matty was trembling so nervously ; so [I]0-i said what [I]0-i really felt ; and after a call of some duration — all the time of which [I]0-i have no doubt [Miss Pole]89-miss pole thought [Miss Matty]98-miss matty received the news very calmly — [[our]826-we visitor]827-our visitor took [her]98-miss matty leave .
