[Miss Matty]98-miss matty made a strong effort to conceal [her]98-miss matty feelings — a concealment [she]98-miss matty practised even with [me]0-i , for [she]98-miss matty has never alluded to [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook again , although the book [he]119-mr holbrook gave [her]98-miss matty lies with [her]98-miss matty Bible on the little table by [her]98-miss matty bedside . [She]98-miss matty did not think [I]0-i heard [her]98-miss matty when [she]98-miss matty asked [the little milliner of [Cranford]1-cranford]828-the little milliner of cranford to make [her]98-miss matty caps something like [the Honourable Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s , or that [I]0-i noticed the reply — “ But [she]98-miss matty wears [widows]2286-widows ’ caps , [ma’am]2067-ma’am ? ”[0-i] “ Oh ! [I]98-miss matty only meant something in that style ; not [widows]2286-widows ’ , of course , but rather like [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s . ”[98-miss matty] This effort at concealment was the beginning of the tremulous motion of head and hands which [I]0-i have seen ever since in [Miss Matty]98-miss matty . The evening of the day on which [we]829-we heard of [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook ’s death , [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns was very silent and thoughtful ; after prayers [she]86-miss jenkyns called [Martha]98-miss matty back and then [she]86-miss jenkyns stood uncertain what to say . “ [Martha]98-miss matty ! ”[86-miss jenkyns] [she]86-miss jenkyns said , at last , “ [you]98-miss matty are young”—and[86-miss jenkyns] then [she]86-miss jenkyns made so long a pause that [Martha]98-miss matty , to remind [her]86-miss jenkyns of [her]86-miss jenkyns half - finished sentence , dropped a curtsey , and said — “ Yes , please , [ma’am]2067-ma’am ; two - and - twenty last third of October , please , [ma’am]2067-ma’am . ”[86-miss jenkyns] “ And , perhaps , [Martha]98-miss matty , [you]98-miss matty may some time meet with [a young man [you]98-miss matty like]2291-a young man you like , and who likes [you]98-miss matty . [I]86-miss jenkyns did say [you]98-miss matty were not to have [followers]2292-followers ; but if [you]98-miss matty meet with [such a young man]2293-such a young man , and tell [me]86-miss jenkyns , and [I]86-miss jenkyns find [he]2293-such a young man is respectable , [I]86-miss jenkyns have no objection to [his]2293-such a young man coming to see [you]98-miss matty once a week . God forbid ! ”[86-miss jenkyns] said [she]86-miss jenkyns in a low voice , “ that [I]86-miss jenkyns should grieve [any young hearts]2294-any young hearts . ”[86-miss jenkyns] [She]86-miss jenkyns spoke as if [she]86-miss jenkyns were providing for some distant contingency , and was rather startled when [Martha]98-miss matty made [her]98-miss matty ready eager answer — “ Please , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , there ’s [Jem Hearn]133-jem , and [he]133-jem ’s [a joiner]2296-a joiner making three - and - sixpence a - day , and six foot one in [his]133-jem stocking - feet , please , [ma’am]2067-ma’am ; and if [you]2067-ma’am ’ll ask about [him]133-jem to - morrow morning , [every one]426-every one will give [him]133-jem a character for steadiness ; and [he]133-jem ’ll be glad enough to come to - morrow night , [I]98-miss matty ’ll be bound . ”[98-miss matty] Though [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was startled , [she]86-miss jenkyns submitted to Fate and Love . CHAPTER V. OLD LETTERS [I]0-i HAVE often noticed that [almost every one]830-almost every one has [his]830-almost every one own individual small economies — careful habits of saving fractions of pennies in some one peculiar direction — any disturbance of which annoys [him]830-almost every one more than spending shillings or pounds on some real extravagance . [An old gentleman of [my]0-i acquaintance]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance , who took the intelligence of the failure of [a Joint - Stock Bank]832-a joint - stock bank , in which some of [his]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance money was invested , with stoical mildness , worried [[his]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance family]833-his family all through a long summer ’s day because one of [them]833-his family had torn ( instead of cutting ) out the written leaves of [his]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance now useless bank - book ; of course , the corresponding pages at the other end came out as well , and this little unnecessary waste of paper ( [his]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance private economy ) chafed [him]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance more than all the loss of [his]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance money . Envelopes fretted [his]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance soul terribly when [they]834-they first came in ; the only way in which [he]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance could reconcile [himself]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance to such waste of [his]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance cherished article was by patiently turning inside out all that were sent to [him]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance , and so making them serve again . Even now , though tamed by age , [I]0-i see [him]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance casting wistful glances at [[his]831-an old gentleman of my acquaintance daughters]368-his daughters when [they]368-his daughters send a whole inside of a half - sheet of note paper , with the three lines of acceptance to an invitation , written on only one of the sides . [I]0-i am not above owning that [I]0-i have this human weakness [myself]0-i . String is [my]0-i foible . [My]0-i pockets get full of little hanks of it , picked up and twisted together , ready for uses that never come . [I]0-i am seriously annoyed if [any one]2107-any one cuts the string of a parcel instead of patiently and faithfully undoing it fold by fold . How [people]359-people can bring [themselves]359-people to use india - rubber rings , which are a sort of deification of string , as lightly as [they]359-people do , [I]0-i can not imagine . To [me]0-i an india - rubber ring is a precious treasure . [I]0-i have one which is not new — one that [I]0-i picked up off the floor nearly six years ago . [I]0-i have really tried to use it , but [my]0-i heart failed [me]0-i , and [I]0-i could not commit the extravagance . Small pieces of butter grieve [others]838-others . [They]838-others can not attend to conversation because of the annoyance occasioned by the habit which [some people]2160-some people have of invariably taking more butter than [they]2160-some people want . Have [you]840-you not seen the anxious look ( almost mesmeric ) which [such persons]841-such persons fix on the article ? [They]838-others would feel it a relief if [they]838-others might bury it out of [their]838-others sight by popping it into [their]838-others own mouths and swallowing it down ; and [they]838-others are really made happy if [the person on whose plate it lies unused]842-the person on whose plate it lies unused suddenly breaks off a piece of toast ( which [he]842-the person on whose plate it lies unused does not want at all ) and eats up [his]842-the person on whose plate it lies unused butter . [They]838-others think that this is not waste . Now [Miss Matty Jenkyns]98-miss matty was chary of candles . [We]843-we had many devices to use as few as possible . In the winter afternoons [she]98-miss matty would sit knitting for two or three hours — [she]98-miss matty could do this in the dark , or by firelight — and when [I]0-i asked if [I]0-i might not ring for candles to finish stitching [my]0-i wristbands , [she]98-miss matty told [me]0-i to “ keep [blind man]2299-blind man ’s holiday . ”[98-miss matty] [They]844-they were usually brought in with tea ; but [we]843-we only burnt one at a time . As [we]843-we lived in constant preparation for [a friend who might come in any evening ( but who never did )]845-a friend who might come in any evening ( but who never did ) , it required some contrivance to keep [our]843-we two candles of the same length , ready to be lighted , and to look as if [we]843-we burnt two always . The candles took it in turns ; and , whatever [we]843-we might be talking about or doing , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s eyes were habitually fixed upon the candle , ready to jump up and extinguish it and to light the other before they had become too uneven in length to be restored to equality in the course of the evening . One night , [I]0-i remember this candle economy particularly annoyed [me]0-i . [I]0-i had been very much tired of [my]0-i compulsory “ blind man ’s holiday , ”[0-i] especially as [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had fallen asleep , and [I]0-i did not like to stir the fire and run the risk of awakening [her]98-miss matty ; so [I]0-i could not even sit on the rug , and scorch [myself]0-i with sewing by firelight , according to [my]0-i usual custom . [I]0-i fancied [Miss Matty]98-miss matty must be dreaming of [her]98-miss matty early life ; for [she]98-miss matty spoke one or two words in [her]98-miss matty uneasy sleep bearing reference to [persons who were dead long before]846-persons who were dead long before . When [Martha]98-miss matty brought in the lighted candle and tea , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty started into wakefulness , with a strange , bewildered look around , as if [we]843-we were not [the people [she]98-miss matty expected to see about [her]98-miss matty]847-the people she expected to see about her . There was a little sad expression that shadowed [her]98-miss matty face as [she]98-miss matty recognised [me]0-i ; but immediately afterwards [she]98-miss matty tried to give [me]0-i [her]98-miss matty usual smile . All through tea - time [her]98-miss matty talk ran upon the days of [her]98-miss matty childhood and youth . Perhaps this reminded [her]98-miss matty of the desirableness of looking over all the old family letters , and destroying such as ought not to be allowed to fall into the hands of [strangers]433-strangers ; for [she]98-miss matty had often spoken of the necessity of this task , but had always shrunk from it , with a timid dread of something painful . To - night , however , [she]98-miss matty rose up after tea and went for them — in the dark ; for [she]98-miss matty piqued [herself]98-miss matty on the precise neatness of all [her]98-miss matty chamber arrangements , and used to look uneasily at [me]0-i when [I]0-i lighted a bed - candle to go to [another room]782-another room for anything . When [she]98-miss matty returned there was a faint , pleasant smell of Tonquin beans in [the room]370-the room . [I]0-i had always noticed this scent about any of the things which had belonged to [[her]98-miss matty mother]439-her mother ; and many of the letters were addressed to [her]98-miss matty — yellow bundles of love - letters , sixty or seventy years old . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty undid the packet with a sigh ; but [she]98-miss matty stifled it directly , as if it were hardly right to regret the flight of time , or of life either . [We]852-we agreed to look them over separately , each taking a different letter out of the same bundle and describing its contents to the other before destroying it . [I]0-i never knew what sad work the reading of old letters was before that evening , though [I]0-i could hardly tell why . The letters were as happy as letters could be — at least those early letters were . There was in them a vivid and intense sense of the present time , which seemed so strong and full , as if it could never pass away , and as if the warm , living hearts that so expressed [themselves]853-themselves could never die , and be as nothing to [the sunny earth]854-the sunny earth . [I]0-i should have felt less melancholy , [I]0-i believe , if the letters had been more so . [I]0-i saw the tears stealing down the well - worn furrows of [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s cheeks , and [her]98-miss matty spectacles often wanted wiping . [I]0-i trusted at last that [she]98-miss matty would light the other candle , for [my]0-i own eyes were rather dim , and [I]0-i wanted more light to see the pale , faded ink ; but no , even through [her]98-miss matty tears , [she]98-miss matty saw and remembered [her]98-miss matty little economical ways . The earliest set of letters were two bundles tied together , and ticketed ( in [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty ’s handwriting ) “ Letters interchanged between [[my]0-i ever - honoured father]2300-my ever - honoured father and [[my]0-i dearly - beloved mother]2301-my dearly - beloved mother , prior to [their]2302-their marriage , in July 1774 . ”[0-i] [I]0-i should guess that [the rector of [Cranford]1-cranford]855-the rector of cranford was about twenty - seven years of age when [he]855-the rector of cranford wrote those letters ; and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty told [me]0-i that [[her]98-miss matty mother]439-her mother was just eighteen at the time of [her]439-her mother wedding . With [my]0-i idea of [the rector]2120-the rector derived from a picture in [the dining - parlour]858-the dining - parlour , stiff and stately , in a huge full - bottomed wig , with gown , cassock , and bands , and [his]2120-the rector hand upon a copy of the only sermon [he]2120-the rector ever published — it was strange to read these letters . They were full of eager , passionate ardour ; short homely sentences , right fresh from the heart ( very different from the grand Latinised , Johnsonian style of the printed sermon preached before [some judge]859-some judge at assize time ) . [His]2120-the rector letters were a curious contrast to those of [[his]2120-the rector girl - bride]860-his girl - bride . [She]98-miss matty was evidently rather annoyed at [his]2120-the rector demands upon [her]98-miss matty for expressions of love , and could not quite understand what [he]2120-the rector meant by repeating the same thing over in so many different ways ; but what [she]98-miss matty was quite clear about was a longing for a white “ Paduasoy”—whatever[98-miss matty] that might be ; and six or seven letters were principally occupied in asking [[her]98-miss matty lover]861-her lover to use [his]2120-the rector influence with [[her]98-miss matty parents]862-her parents ( who evidently kept [her]98-miss matty in good order ) to obtain this or that article of dress , more especially the white “ Paduasoy . ”[2120-the rector] [He]2120-the rector cared nothing how [she]98-miss matty was dressed ; [she]98-miss matty was always lovely enough for [him]2120-the rector , as [he]2120-the rector took pains to assure [her]98-miss matty , when [she]98-miss matty begged [him]2120-the rector to express in [his]2120-the rector answers a predilection for particular pieces of finery , in order that [she]98-miss matty might show what [he]2120-the rector said to [[her]98-miss matty parents]862-her parents . But at length [he]2120-the rector seemed to find out that [she]98-miss matty would not be married till [she]98-miss matty had a “ trousseau ”[2120-the rector] to [her]98-miss matty mind ; and then [he]2120-the rector sent [her]98-miss matty a letter , which had evidently accompanied a whole box full of finery , and in which [he]2120-the rector requested that [she]98-miss matty might be dressed in everything [her]98-miss matty heart desired . This was the first letter , ticketed in a frail , delicate hand , “ From [[my]2120-the rector dearest]2303-my dearest [John]136-john . ”[2120-the rector] Shortly afterwards [they]864-them were married , [I]0-i suppose , from the intermission in [their]864-them correspondence . “ [We]864-them must burn [them]864-them , [I]98-miss matty think , ”[98-miss matty] said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , looking doubtfully at [me]0-i . “ [No one]477-no one will care for [them]864-them when [I]98-miss matty am gone . ”[98-miss matty] And one by one [she]98-miss matty dropped them into the middle of the fire , watching each blaze up , die out , and rise away , in faint , white , ghostly semblance , up the chimney , before [she]98-miss matty gave another to the same fate . [The room]370-the room was light enough now ; but [I]0-i , like [her]98-miss matty , was fascinated into watching the destruction of those letters , into which the honest warmth of a manly heart had been poured forth . The next letter , likewise docketed by [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty , was endorsed , “ Letter of pious congratulation and exhortation from [[my]593-his wife venerable grandfather]2305-my venerable grandfather to [[my]593-his wife beloved mother]2306-my beloved mother , on occasion of [my]593-his wife own birth . Also some practical remarks on the desirability of keeping warm the extremities of [infants]2307-infants , from [[my]593-his wife excellent grandmother]2308-my excellent grandmother . ”[593-his wife] The first part was , indeed , a severe and forcible picture of the responsibilities of [mothers]866-mothers , and a warning against the evils that were in [the world]333-the world , and lying in ghastly wait for [the little baby of two days old]868-the little baby of two days old . [[His]869-he wife]593-his wife did not write , said [the old gentleman]754-the old gentleman , because [he]869-he had forbidden it , [she]593-his wife being indisposed with a sprained ankle , which ( [he]869-he said ) quite incapacitated [her]593-his wife from holding a pen . However , at the foot of the page was a small “ T.O. , ”[869-he] and on turning it over , sure enough , there was a letter to “ [[my]869-he dear]2063-my dear , dearest [Molly]109-mary , ”[869-he] begging [her]593-his wife , when [she]593-his wife left [[her]593-his wife room]732-her room , whatever [she]593-his wife did , to go _ up _ [stairs]873-stairs before going _ down _ : and telling [her]593-his wife to wrap [[her]593-his wife baby]874-her baby ’s feet up in flannel , and keep it warm by the fire , although it was summer , for [babies]875-babies were so tender . It was pretty to see from the letters , which were evidently exchanged with some frequency between [the young mother]876-the young mother and [the grandmother]877-the grandmother , how the girlish vanity was being weeded out of [her]593-his wife heart by love for [[her]593-his wife baby]874-her baby . The white “ Paduasoy ”[880-it] figured again in the letters , with almost as much vigour as before . In one , it was being made into a christening cloak for [the baby]879-the baby . [It]880-it decked [it]879-the baby when [it]879-the baby went with [[its]879-the baby parents]881-its parents to spend a day or two at [Arley Hall]23-arley hall . [It]880-it added to [its]879-the baby charms , when it was “ [the prettiest little baby that ever was seen]2310-the prettiest little baby that ever was seen . [Dear mother]2311-dear mother , [I]880-it wish [you]2311-dear mother could see [her]98-miss matty ! Without any pershality , [I]880-it do think [she]98-miss matty will grow up a regular bewty ! ”[880-it] [I]0-i thought of [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty , grey , withered , and wrinkled , and [I]0-i wondered if [[her]98-miss matty mother]439-her mother had known [her]98-miss matty in [the courts of heaven]883-the courts of heaven : and then [I]0-i knew that [she]439-her mother had , and that [they]884-they stood there in angelic guise . There was a great gap before any of [the rector]2120-the rector ’s letters appeared . And then [[his]2120-the rector wife]593-his wife had changed [her]593-his wife mode of [her]593-his wife endorsement . It was no longer from , “ [[My]593-his wife dearest]2303-my dearest [John]136-john ; ”[593-his wife] it was from “ [[My]593-his wife Honoured Husband]2313-my honoured husband . ”[593-his wife] The letters were written on occasion of the publication of the same sermon which was represented in the picture . The preaching before “ [[My]593-his wife Lord Judge]2314-my lord judge , ”[593-his wife] and the “ publishing by request , ”[593-his wife] was evidently the culminating point — the event of [his]2120-the rector life . It had been necessary for [him]2120-the rector to go up to [London]4-london to superintend it through the press . [Many friends]887-many friends had to be called upon and consulted before [he]2120-the rector could decide on any printer fit for so onerous a task ; and at length it was arranged that [J.]137-j. and [J. Rivingtons]137-j. were to have the honourable responsibility . [The worthy rector]888-the worthy rector seemed to be strung up by the occasion to a high literary pitch , for [he]2120-the rector could hardly write a letter to [[his]2120-the rector wife]593-his wife without cropping out into Latin . [I]0-i remember the end of one of [his]2120-the rector letters ran thus : “ [I]2120-the rector shall ever hold the virtuous qualities of [[my]2120-the rector Molly]2315-my molly in remembrance , _ dum memor ipse mei _ , _ dum spiritus regit artus _ , ”[2120-the rector] which , considering that the English of [[his]2120-the rector correspondent]890-his correspondent was sometimes at fault in grammar , and often in spelling , might be taken as a proof of how much [he]2120-the rector “ idealised [[his]2120-the rector [Molly]109-mary]2316-his molly ; ”[2120-the rector] and , as [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty used to say , “ [People]359-people talk a great deal about idealising now - a - days , whatever that may mean . ”[2120-the rector] But this was nothing to a fit of writing classical poetry which soon seized [him]2120-the rector , in which [his]2120-the rector [Molly]109-mary figured away as “ [Maria]138-maria . ”[109-mary] The letter containing [the _ carmen _]891-the _ carmen _ was endorsed by [her]593-his wife , “ Hebrew verses sent [me]593-his wife by [[my]593-his wife honoured husband]2313-my honoured husband . [I]593-his wife thowt to have had a letter about killing the pig , but must wait . Mem . , to send the poetry to [Sir Peter Arley]121-peter , as [[my]593-his wife husband]2319-my husband desires . ”[593-his wife] And in a post - scriptum note in [his]2120-the rector handwriting it was stated that the Ode had appeared in the _ Gentleman ’s Magazine _ , December 1782 . [Her]593-his wife letters back to [[her]593-his wife husband]601-her husband ( treasured as fondly by [him]2120-the rector as if they had been _ M. T. Ciceronis Epistolæ _ ) were more satisfactory to [an absent husband]893-an absent husband and [father]894-father than [his]2120-the rector could ever have been to [her]593-his wife . [She]593-his wife told [him]2120-the rector how [Deborah]99-deborah sewed [her]593-his wife seam very neatly every day , and read to [her]593-his wife in the books [he]2120-the rector had set [her]593-his wife ; how [she]593-his wife was [a very “ forrard , ”[593-his wife] good child]895-a very “ forrard , ” good child , but would ask questions [[her]593-his wife mother]439-her mother could not answer , but how [she]593-his wife did not let [herself]593-his wife down by saying [she]593-his wife did not know , but took to stirring the fire , or sending [the “ forrard ”[898-the mother] child]897-the “ forrard ” child on an errand . [Matty]98-miss matty was now [[the mother]898-the mother ’s darling]899-the mother ’s darling , and promised ( like [[her]98-miss matty sister]394-her sister at [her]98-miss matty age ) , to be [a great beauty]901-a great beauty . [I]0-i was reading this aloud to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , who smiled and sighed a little at the hope , so fondly expressed , that “ [little Matty]98-miss matty might not be vain , even if [she]98-miss matty were [a bewty]2320-a bewty . ”[98-miss matty] “ [I]86-miss jenkyns had very pretty hair , [[my]86-miss jenkyns dear]2063-my dear , ”[86-miss jenkyns] said [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns ; “ and not a bad mouth . ”[86-miss jenkyns] And [I]0-i saw [her]98-miss matty soon afterwards adjust [her]98-miss matty cap and draw [herself]98-miss matty up . But to return to [Mrs Jenkyns]116-mrs jenkyns ’s letters . [She]98-miss matty told [[her]98-miss matty husband]601-her husband about [the poor in [the parish]297-the parish]903-the poor in the parish ; what homely domestic medicines [she]98-miss matty had administered ; what kitchen physic [she]98-miss matty had sent . [She]98-miss matty had evidently held [his]601-her husband displeasure as a rod in pickle over the heads of all [the ne’er - do - wells]905-the ne’er - do - wells . [She]98-miss matty asked for [his]601-her husband directions about the cows and pigs ; and did not always obtain them , as [I]0-i have shown before . [The kind old grandmother]906-the kind old grandmother was dead when [a little boy]907-a little boy was born , soon after the publication of the sermon ; but there was another letter of exhortation from [the grandfather]908-the grandfather , more stringent and admonitory than ever , now that there was [a boy to be guarded from the snares of]909-a boy to be guarded from the snares of [the world]333-the world . [He]908-the grandfather described all the various sins into which [men]491-men might fall , until [I]0-i wondered how [any man]912-any man ever came to a natural death . The gallows seemed as if it must have been the termination of the lives of [most of [the grandfather]908-the grandfather ’s friends]913-most of the grandfather ’s friends and [acquaintance]915-acquaintance ; and [I]0-i was not surprised at the way in which [he]908-the grandfather spoke of this life being “ a vale of tears . ”[908-the grandfather] It seemed curious that [I]0-i should never have heard of [this brother]916-this brother before ; but [I]0-i concluded that [he]908-the grandfather had died young , or else surely [his]908-the grandfather name would have been alluded to by [[his]908-the grandfather sisters]917-his sisters . By - and - by [we]918-we came to packets of [Miss Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns ’s letters . [These Miss Matty]98-miss matty did regret to burn . [She]86-miss jenkyns said all the others had been only interesting to those who loved [the writers]919-the writers , and that it seemed as if it would have hurt [her]86-miss jenkyns to allow [them]920-them to fall into the hands of [strangers]433-strangers , who had not known [[her]86-miss jenkyns dear mother]922-her dear mother , and how good [she]922-her dear mother was , although [she]922-her dear mother did not always spell quite in the modern fashion ; but [Deborah]99-deborah ’s letters were so very superior ! [Any one]2107-any one might profit by reading them . It was a long time since [she]86-miss jenkyns had read [Mrs Chapone]139-mrs chapone , but [she]86-miss jenkyns knew [she]86-miss jenkyns used to think that [Deborah]99-deborah could have said the same things quite as well ; and as for [Mrs Carter]140-mrs carter ! [people]359-people thought a deal of [her]99-deborah letters , just because [she]99-deborah had written “ Epictetus , ”[99-deborah] but [she]86-miss jenkyns was quite sure [Deborah]99-deborah would never have made use of such a common expression as “ [I]99-deborah canna be fashed ! ”[99-deborah] [ Picture : [I]0-i made use of the time to think of many other things ] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty did grudge burning these letters , it was evident . [She]98-miss matty would not let them be carelessly passed over with any quiet reading , and skipping , to [myself]0-i . [She]98-miss matty took them from [me]0-i , and even lighted the second candle in order to read them aloud with a proper emphasis , and without stumbling over the big words . Oh dear ! how [I]0-i wanted facts instead of reflections , before those letters were concluded ! They lasted [us]925-us two nights ; and [I]0-i wo n’t deny that [I]0-i made use of the time to think of many other things , and yet [I]0-i was always at [my]0-i post at the end of each sentence . [The rector]2120-the rector ’s letters , and those of [[his]2120-the rector wife]593-his wife and [mother - in - law]928-mother - in - law , had all been tolerably short and pithy , written in a straight hand , with the lines very close together . Sometimes the whole letter was contained on a mere scrap of paper . The paper was very yellow , and the ink very brown ; some of the sheets were ( as [Miss Matty]98-miss matty made [me]0-i observe ) the old original post , with the stamp in the corner representing [a post - boy riding for life]929-a post - boy riding for life and twanging [his]929-a post - boy riding for life horn . The letters of [Mrs Jenkyns]116-mrs jenkyns and [[her]116-mrs jenkyns mother]439-her mother were fastened with a great round red wafer ; for it was before [Miss Edgeworth]141-miss edgeworth ’s “ patronage ”[141-miss edgeworth] had banished wafers from [polite society]931-polite society . It was evident , from the tenor of what was said , that franks were in great request , and were even used as a means of paying debts by [needy members of Parliament]932-needy members of parliament . [The rector]2120-the rector sealed [his]2120-the rector epistles with an immense coat of arms , and showed by the care with which [he]2120-the rector had performed this ceremony that [he]2120-the rector expected they should be cut open , not broken by any thoughtless or impatient hand . Now , [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty ’s letters were of a later date in form and writing . [She]98-miss matty wrote on the square sheet which [we]934-we have learned to call old - fashioned . [Her]98-miss matty hand was admirably calculated , together with [her]98-miss matty use of many - syllabled words , to fill up a sheet , and then came the pride and delight of crossing . [Poor Miss Matty]98-miss matty got sadly puzzled with this , for the words gathered size like snowballs , and towards the end of [her]98-miss matty letter [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty used to become quite sesquipedalian . In one to [[her]116-mrs jenkyns father]397-her father , slightly theological and controversial in its tone , [she]98-miss matty had spoken of [Herod]142-herod , [Tetrarch of [Idumea]24-idumea]936-tetrarch of idumea . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty read it “ [Herod Petrarch of [Etruria]25-etruria]2322-herod petrarch of etruria , ”[98-miss matty] and was just as well pleased as if [she]98-miss matty had been right . [I]0-i ca n’t quite remember the date , but [I]0-i think it was in 1805 that [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty wrote the longest series of letters — on occasion of [her]98-miss matty absence on a visit to [some friends near [Newcastle - upon - Tyne]26-newcastle - upon - tyne]937-some friends near newcastle - upon - tyne . [These friends]938-these friends were intimate with [the commandant of [the garrison there]940-the garrison there]939-the commandant of the garrison there , and heard from [him]939-the commandant of the garrison there of all the preparations that were being made to repel the invasion of [Buonaparte]27-buonaparte , which [some people]2160-some people imagined might take place at [the mouth of [the Tyne]28-the tyne]942-the mouth of the tyne . [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty was evidently very much alarmed ; and the first part of [her]98-miss matty letters was often written in pretty intelligible English , conveying particulars of the preparations which were made in [the family with whom [she]98-miss matty was residing against the dreaded event]943-the family with whom she was residing against the dreaded event ; the bundles of clothes that were packed up ready for a flight to [Alston Moor]29-alston moor ( [a wild hilly piece of ground between [Northumberland]30-northumberland and [Cumberland]31-cumberland]944-a wild hilly piece of ground between northumberland and cumberland ) ; the signal that was to be given for this flight , and for the simultaneous turning out of [the volunteers under arms]945-the volunteers under arms — which said signal was to consist ( if [I]0-i remember rightly ) in ringing the church bells in a particular and ominous manner . One day , when [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty and [[her]98-miss matty hosts]946-her hosts were at a dinner - party in [Newcastle]32-newcastle , this warning summons was actually given ( not a very wise proceeding , if there be any truth in the moral attached to the fable of [the Boy]947-the boy and the Wolf ; but so it was ) , and [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty , hardly recovered from [her]98-miss matty fright , wrote the next day to describe the sound , the breathless shock , the hurry and alarm ; and then , taking breath , [she]98-miss matty added , “ How trivial , [[my]98-miss matty dear father]2323-my dear father , do all [our]2324-we apprehensions of the last evening appear , at the present moment , to calm and enquiring minds ! ”[98-miss matty] And here [Miss Matty]98-miss matty broke in with — “ But , indeed , [[my]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear , they were not at all trivial or trifling at the time . [I]98-miss matty know [I]98-miss matty used to wake up in the night many a time and think [I]98-miss matty heard the tramp of the French entering [Cranford]1-cranford . [Many people]2326-many people talked of hiding [themselves]2326-many people in [the salt mines]2327-the salt mines — and meat would have kept capitally down there , only perhaps [we]2324-we should have been thirsty . And [[my]98-miss matty father]2082-my father preached a whole set of sermons on the occasion ; one set in the mornings , all about [David]143-david and [Goliath]144-goliath , to spirit up [the people]2329-the people to fighting with spades or bricks , if need were ; and the other set in the afternoons , proving that [Napoleon]145-napoleon ( that was another name for [Bony]146-bony , as [we]2324-we used to call [him]145-napoleon ) was all the same as an [Apollyon]147-apollyon and [Abaddon]33-abaddon . [I]98-miss matty remember [[my]98-miss matty father]2082-my father rather thought [he]2082-my father should be asked to print this last set ; but [the parish]297-the parish had , perhaps , had enough of [them]2332-them with hearing . ”[98-miss matty] [Peter Marmaduke Arley Jenkyns]148-peter ( “ poor [Peter]148-peter ! ”[148-peter] as [Miss Matty]98-miss matty began to call [him]148-peter ) was at school at [Shrewsbury]34-shrewsbury by this time . [The rector]2120-the rector took up [his]2120-the rector pen , and rubbed up [his]2120-the rector Latin once more , to correspond with [[his]2120-the rector boy]949-his boy . It was very clear that [the lad]950-the lad ’s were what are called show letters . They were of a highly mental description , giving an account of [his]148-peter studies , and [his]148-peter intellectual hopes of various kinds , with an occasional quotation from the classics ; but , now and then , the animal nature broke out in such a little sentence as this , evidently written in a trembling hurry , after the letter had been inspected : “ [Mother]2153-mother dear , do send [me]951-her boy a cake , and put plenty of citron in . ”[2334-the “ mother] [The “ mother]2334-the “ mother dear ”[98-miss matty] probably answered [[her]98-miss matty boy]951-her boy in the form of cakes and “ goody , ”[98-miss matty] for there were none of [her]98-miss matty letters among this set ; but a whole collection of [the rector]2120-the rector ’s , to whom the Latin in [[his]2120-the rector boy]949-his boy ’s letters was like a trumpet to the old war - horse . [I]0-i do not know much about Latin , certainly , and it is , perhaps , an ornamental language , but not very useful , [I]0-i think — at least to judge from the bits [I]0-i remember out of [the rector]2120-the rector ’s letters . One was , “ [You]951-her boy have not got [that town]2335-that town in [[your]951-her boy map of [Ireland]35-ireland]2336-your map of ireland ; but _ Bonus Bernardus non videt omnia _ , as the Proverbia say . ”[98-miss matty] Presently it became very evident that “ poor [Peter]148-peter ”[148-peter] got [himself]148-peter into many scrapes . There were letters of stilted penitence to [[his]148-peter father]955-his father , for some wrong - doing ; and among them all was a badly - written , badly - sealed , badly - directed , blotted note:—“My dear , [dear]2179-dear , [dear]2179-dear , [dearest mother]2339-dearest mother , [I]98-miss matty will be [a better boy]2340-a better boy ; [I]98-miss matty will , indeed ; but do n’t , please , be ill for [me]98-miss matty ; [I]98-miss matty am not worth it ; but [I]98-miss matty will be good , [darling mother]2341-darling mother . ”[98-miss matty] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty could not speak for crying , after [she]98-miss matty had read this note . [She]98-miss matty gave it to [me]0-i in silence , and then got up and took it to [her]98-miss matty sacred recesses in [[her]98-miss matty own room]956-her own room , for fear , by any chance , it might get burnt . “ [Poor Peter]149-poor peter ! ”[98-miss matty] [she]98-miss matty said ; “ [he]149-poor peter was always in scrapes ; [he]149-poor peter was too easy . [They]957-kind friends led [him]149-poor peter wrong , and then left [him]149-poor peter in the lurch . But [he]149-poor peter was too fond of mischief . [He]149-poor peter could never resist a joke . [Poor Peter]149-poor peter ! ”[98-miss matty] CHAPTER VI . [POOR PETER POOR Peter]150-poor peter poor peter ’s career lay before [him]150-poor peter poor peter rather pleasantly mapped out by [kind friends]957-kind friends , but [_ Bonus Bernardus]151-_ bonus bernardus non videt omnia _ , in this map too . [He]150-poor peter poor peter was to win honours at [the Shrewsbury School]958-the shrewsbury school , and carry [them]959-them thick to [Cambridge]36-cambridge , and after that , a living awaited [him]150-poor peter poor peter , the gift of [[his]150-poor peter poor peter godfather]960-his godfather , [Sir Peter Arley]121-peter . [Poor Peter]149-poor peter ! [his]149-poor peter lot in life was very different to what [[his]149-poor peter friends]961-his friends had hoped and planned . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty told [me]0-i all about it , and [I]0-i think it was a relief when [she]98-miss matty had done so . [He]150-poor peter poor peter was [the darling of [[his]150-poor peter poor peter mother]963-his mother , who seemed to dote on all [[her]963-his mother children]964-her children]962-the darling of his mother , who seemed to dote on all her children , though [she]963-his mother was , perhaps , a little afraid of [Deborah]99-deborah ’s superior acquirements . [Deborah]99-deborah was [the favourite of [[her]99-deborah father]397-her father]965-the favourite of her father , and when [Peter]121-peter disappointed [him]397-her father , [she]99-deborah became [his]397-her father pride . The sole honour [Peter]121-peter brought away from [Shrewsbury]34-shrewsbury was the reputation of being [the best good fellow that ever was]967-the best good fellow that ever was , and of being [the captain of [the school]969-the school]968-the captain of the school in the art of practical joking . [[His]121-peter father]955-his father was disappointed , but set about remedying the matter in a manly way . [He]955-his father could not afford to send [Peter]121-peter to read with [any tutor]971-any tutor , but [he]955-his father could read with [him]955-his father [himself]955-his father ; and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty told [me]0-i much of the awful preparations in the way of dictionaries and lexicons that were made in [[[her]98-miss matty father]397-her father ’s study]973-her father ’s study the morning [Peter]121-peter began . “ [[My]98-miss matty poor mother]2342-my poor mother ! ”[98-miss matty] said [she]98-miss matty . “ [I]98-miss matty remember how [she]2342-my poor mother used to stand in [the hall]2343-the hall , just near enough [the study]2344-the study - door , to catch the tone of [[my]98-miss matty father]2082-my father ’s voice . [I]98-miss matty could tell in a moment if all was going right , by [her]2342-my poor mother face . And it did go right for a long time . ”[98-miss matty] “ What went wrong at last ? ”[0-i] said [I.]0-i “ That tiresome Latin , [I]0-i dare say . ”[0-i] “ No ! it was not the Latin . [Peter]121-peter was in high favour with [[my]98-miss matty father]2082-my father , for [he]121-peter worked up well for [him]121-peter . But [he]121-peter seemed to think that [the Cranford people]2347-the cranford people might be joked about , and made fun of , and [they]2347-the cranford people did not like it ; [nobody]2061-nobody does . [He]121-peter was always hoaxing [them]2347-the cranford people ; ‘ hoaxing ’ is not a pretty word , [[my]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear , and [I]98-miss matty hope [you]2063-my dear wo n’t tell [[your]2063-my dear father]2350-your father [I]98-miss matty used it , for [I]98-miss matty should not like [him]2082-my father to think that [I]98-miss matty was not choice in [my]98-miss matty language , after living with [such a woman]2351-such a woman as [Deborah]99-deborah . And be sure [you]2063-my dear never use it [yourself]2063-my dear . [I]98-miss matty do n’t know how it slipped out of [my]98-miss matty mouth , except it was that [I]98-miss matty was thinking of poor [Peter]121-peter and it was always [his]121-peter expression . But [he]121-peter was [a very gentlemanly boy]2352-a very gentlemanly boy in many things . [He]121-peter was like dear [Captain Brown]80-captain brown in always being ready to help [any old person]2353-any old person or [a child]2069-a child . Still , [he]121-peter did like joking and making fun ; and [he]121-peter seemed to think [the old ladies in [Cranford]1-cranford]2355-the old ladies in cranford would believe anything . There were [many old ladies living [here]2357-here then]2356-many old ladies living here then ; [we]2358-we are [principally ladies]2359-principally ladies now , [I]98-miss matty know , but [we]2358-we are not so old as [the ladies]417-the ladies used to be when [I]98-miss matty was [a girl]2174-a girl . [I]98-miss matty could laugh to think of some of [Peter]121-peter ’s jokes . No , [[my]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear , [I]98-miss matty wo n’t tell [you]2063-my dear of them , because [they]417-the ladies might not shock [you]2063-my dear as [they]417-the ladies ought to do , and they were very shocking . [He]121-peter even took in [[my]98-miss matty father]2082-my father once , by dressing [himself]121-peter up as [a lady that was passing through [the town]281-the town and wished to see [the Rector of [Cranford]1-cranford]855-the rector of cranford , ‘ who had published that admirable Assize Sermon . ’ [Peter]121-peter said [he]121-peter was awfully frightened [himself]121-peter when [he]121-peter saw how [[my]98-miss matty father]2082-my father]2364-a lady that was passing through the town and wished to see the rector of cranford , ‘ who had published that admirable assize sermon . ’ peter said he was awfully frightened himself when he saw how my father took it all in , and even offered to copy out all [his]121-peter Napoleon Buonaparte sermons for [her]2368-her — [him]121-peter , [I]98-miss matty mean — no , [her]2368-her , for [Peter]121-peter was [a lady]677-a lady then . [He]121-peter told [me]98-miss matty [he]121-peter was more terrified than [he]121-peter ever was before , all the time [[my]98-miss matty father]2082-my father was speaking . [He]121-peter did not think [[my]98-miss matty father]2082-my father would have believed [him]121-peter ; and yet if [he]121-peter had not , it would have been a sad thing for [Peter]121-peter . As it was , [he]121-peter was none so glad of it , for [[my]98-miss matty father]2082-my father kept [him]121-peter hard at work copying out all those twelve Buonaparte sermons for [the lady]2373-the lady — that was for [Peter]121-peter [himself]121-peter , [you]2374-you know . [He]2373-the lady was [the lady]2373-the lady . And once when [he]121-peter wanted to go fishing , [Peter]121-peter said , ‘ Confound [the woman!’—very bad language]2376-the woman!’—very bad language , [[my]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear , but [Peter]121-peter was not always so guarded as [he]121-peter should have been ; [[my]98-miss matty father]2082-my father was so angry with [him]121-peter , it nearly frightened [me]98-miss matty out of [my]98-miss matty wits : and yet [I]98-miss matty could hardly keep from laughing at the little curtseys [Peter]121-peter kept making , quite slyly , whenever [[my]98-miss matty father]2082-my father spoke of [the lady]2373-the lady ’s excellent taste and sound discrimination . ”[98-miss matty] [ Picture : Confound [the woman]974-the woman ] “ Did [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty know of these tricks ? ”[975-i] said [I.]975-i “ Oh , no ! [Deborah]99-deborah would have been too much shocked . No , [no one]477-no one knew but [me]975-i . [I]975-i wish [I]975-i had always known of [Peter]121-peter ’s plans ; but sometimes [he]121-peter did not tell [me]975-i . [He]121-peter used to say [the old ladies in [the town]281-the town]2382-the old ladies in the town wanted something to talk about ; but [I]975-i do n’t think [they]2382-the old ladies in the town did . [They]2382-the old ladies in the town had [the _ St James ’s Chronicle]2384-the _ st james ’s chronicle _ three times a week , just as [we]2385-we have now , and [we]2385-we have plenty to say ; and [I]975-i remember the clacking noise there always was when [some of [the ladies]417-the ladies]2386-some of the ladies got together . But , probably , [schoolboys]2388-schoolboys talk more than [ladies]2218-ladies . At last there was a terrible , sad thing happened . ”[975-i] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty got up , went to the door , and opened it ; [no one]477-no one was there . [She]98-miss matty rang the bell for [Martha]98-miss matty , and when [Martha]98-miss matty came , [[her]98-miss matty mistress]341-her mistress told [her]98-miss matty to go for eggs to [a farm at [the other end of [the town]281-the town]979-the other end of the town]978-a farm at the other end of the town . “ [I]98-miss matty will lock the door after [you]98-miss matty , [Martha]98-miss matty . [You]98-miss matty are not afraid to go , are [you]98-miss matty ? ”[98-miss matty] “ No , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , not at all ; [Jem Hearn]133-jem will be only too proud to go with [me]98-miss matty . ”[98-miss matty] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty drew [herself]98-miss matty up , and as soon as [we]981-we were alone , [she]98-miss matty wished that [Martha]98-miss matty had more maidenly reserve . “ [We]981-we ’ll put out the candle , [[my]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear . [We]981-we can talk just as well by firelight , [you]2063-my dear know . [There]289-there ! Well , [you]2063-my dear see , [Deborah]99-deborah had gone from [home]306-home for a fortnight or so ; it was a very still , quiet day , [I]98-miss matty remember , overhead ; and the lilacs were all in flower , so [I]98-miss matty suppose it was spring . [[My]98-miss matty father]2082-my father had gone out to see [some sick people in [the parish]297-the parish]2395-some sick people in the parish ; [I]98-miss matty recollect seeing [him]2082-my father leave [the house]2059-the house with [his]2082-my father wig and shovel - hat and cane . What possessed [our]981-we poor Peter [I]98-miss matty do n’t know ; [he]982-he had the sweetest temper , and yet [he]982-he always seemed to like to plague [Deborah]99-deborah . [She]99-deborah never laughed at [his]982-he jokes , and thought [him]982-he ungenteel , and not careful enough about improving [his]982-he mind ; and that vexed [him]982-he . “[98-miss matty] Well ! [he]982-he went to [[her]983-her room]732-her room , it seems , and dressed [himself]982-he in [her]983-her old gown , and shawl , and bonnet ; just the things [she]983-her used to wear in [Cranford]1-cranford , and was known by everywhere ; and [he]982-he made the pillow into a little — [you]985-you are sure [you]985-you locked the door , [[my]0-i dear]2063-my dear , for [I]0-i should not like [anyone]987-anyone to hear — into — into [a little baby]988-a little baby , with white long clothes . It was only , as [he]982-he told [me]0-i afterwards , to make something to talk about in [the town]281-the town ; [he]982-he never thought of it as affecting [Deborah]99-deborah . And [he]982-he went and walked up and down in [the Filbert walk]990-the filbert walk — just half - hidden by the rails , and half - seen ; and [he]982-he cuddled [his]982-he pillow , just like [a baby]991-a baby , and talked to it all [the nonsense people]992-the nonsense people do . Oh dear ! and [[my]0-i father]2082-my father came stepping stately up [the street]467-the street , as [he]2082-my father always did ; and what should [he]2082-my father see but [a little black crowd of people]995-a little black crowd of people — [I]0-i daresay as many as twenty — all peeping through [his]2082-my father garden rails . So [he]2082-my father thought , at first , [they]995-a little black crowd of people were only looking at a new rhododendron that was in full bloom , and that [he]2082-my father was very proud of ; and [he]2082-my father walked slower , that [they]995-a little black crowd of people might have more time to admire . And [he]2082-my father wondered if [he]2082-my father could make out a sermon from the occasion , and thought , perhaps , there was some relation between the rhododendrons and the lilies of [the field]996-the field . [[My]0-i poor father]997-my poor father ! When [he]2082-my father came nearer , [he]2082-my father began to wonder that [they]995-a little black crowd of people did not see [him]2082-my father ; but [their]995-a little black crowd of people heads were all so close together , peeping and peeping ! [[My]0-i father]2082-my father was amongst [them]995-a little black crowd of people , meaning , [he]2082-my father said , to ask [them]995-a little black crowd of people to walk into [the garden]753-the garden with [him]2082-my father , and admire the beautiful vegetable production , when — oh , [[my]0-i dear]2063-my dear , [I]0-i tremble to think of it — [he]2082-my father looked through the rails [himself]2082-my father , and saw — [I]0-i do n’t know what [he]2082-my father thought [he]2082-my father saw , but [old Clare]152-old clare told [me]0-i [his]2082-my father face went quite grey - white with anger , and [his]2082-my father eyes blazed out under [his]2082-my father frowning black brows ; and [he]2082-my father spoke out — oh , so terribly!—and bade [them]995-a little black crowd of people all stop where [they]995-a little black crowd of people were — not one of [them]995-a little black crowd of people to go , not one of [them]995-a little black crowd of people to stir a step ; and , swift as light , [he]2082-my father was in at [the garden]753-the garden door , and down [the Filbert walk]990-the filbert walk , and seized hold of poor [Peter]121-peter , and tore [his]121-peter clothes off [his]121-peter back — bonnet , shawl , gown , and all — and threw the pillow among [the people]2329-the people over the railings : and then [he]2082-my father was very , very angry indeed , and before all [the people]2329-the people [he]2082-my father lifted up [his]2082-my father cane and flogged [Peter]121-peter ! “ [[My]2082-my father dear]2063-my dear , [that boy]2399-that boy ’s trick , on that sunny day , when all seemed going straight and well , broke [[my]2082-my father mother]2400-my mother ’s heart , and changed [[my]2082-my father father]2082-my father for life . It did , indeed . [Old Clare]152-old clare said , [Peter]121-peter looked as white as [[my]2082-my father father]2082-my father ; and stood as still as a statue to be flogged ; and [[my]2082-my father father]2082-my father struck hard ! When [[my]2082-my father father]2082-my father stopped to take breath , [Peter]121-peter said , ‘ Have [you]2082-my father done enough , [sir]2208-sir ? ’ quite hoarsely , and still standing quite quiet . [I]2082-my father do n’t know what [[my]2082-my father father]2082-my father said — or if [he]2082-my father said anything . But [old Clare]152-old clare said , [Peter]121-peter turned to where [the people outside the railing]2407-the people outside the railing were , and made [them]2407-the people outside the railing a low bow , as grand and as grave as [any gentleman]2408-any gentleman ; and then walked slowly into [the house]2059-the house . [I]2082-my father was in [the store - room]420-the store - room helping [[my]2082-my father mother]2400-my mother to make cowslip wine . [I]2082-my father can not abide the wine now , nor the scent of the flowers ; [they]2407-the people outside the railing turn [me]2082-my father sick and faint , as [they]2407-the people outside the railing did that day , when [Peter]121-peter came in , looking as haughty as [any man]912-any man — indeed , looking like [a man]2058-a man , not like [a boy]2414-a boy . ‘ [Mother]153-mother ! ’ [he]121-peter said , ‘ [I]2082-my father am come to say , [God]103-god bless [you]153-mother for ever . ’ [I]2082-my father saw [his]121-peter lips quiver as [he]121-peter spoke ; and [I]2082-my father think [he]121-peter durst not say anything more loving , for the purpose that was in [his]121-peter heart . [She]153-mother looked at [him]121-peter rather frightened , and wondering , and asked [him]121-peter what was to do . [He]121-peter did not smile or speak , but put [his]121-peter arms round [her]153-mother and kissed [her]153-mother as if [he]121-peter did not know how to leave off ; and before [she]153-mother could speak again , [he]121-peter was gone . [We]2415-we talked it over , and could not understand it , and [she]153-mother bade [me]2082-my father go and seek [[my]2082-my father father]2082-my father , and ask what it was all about . [I]2082-my father found [him]121-peter walking up and down , looking very highly displeased . “[2082-my father] ‘ Tell [[your]1005-your mother]1006-your mother [I]0-i have flogged [Peter]121-peter , and that [he]121-peter richly deserved it . ’ “ [I]0-i durst not ask any more questions . When [I]0-i told [[my]0-i mother]2400-my mother , [she]2400-my mother sat down , quite faint , for a minute . [I]0-i remember , a few days after , [I]0-i saw the poor , withered cowslip flowers thrown out to the leaf heap , to decay and die there . There was no making of cowslip wine that year at [the rectory]2418-the rectory — nor , indeed , ever after . “[0-i] Presently [[my]0-i mother]2400-my mother went to [[my]0-i father]2082-my father . [I]0-i know [I]0-i thought of [Queen Esther]154-queen esther and [King Ahasuerus]155-king ahasuerus ; for [[my]0-i mother]2400-my mother was very pretty and delicate - looking , and [[my]0-i father]2082-my father looked as terrible as [King Ahasuerus]155-king ahasuerus . Some time after [they]1011-they came out together ; and then [[my]0-i mother]2400-my mother told [me]0-i what had happened , and that [she]2400-my mother was going up to [[Peter]121-peter ’s room]1013-peter ’s room at [[my]0-i father]2082-my father ’s desire — though [she]2400-my mother was not to tell [Peter]121-peter this — to talk the matter over with [him]121-peter . But no [Peter]121-peter was [there]289-there . [We]1016-we looked over [the house]2059-the house ; no [Peter]121-peter was [there]289-there ! Even [[my]0-i father]2082-my father , who had not liked to join in the search at first , helped [us]1016-we before long . [The rectory]2418-the rectory was [a very old house]1021-a very old house — steps up into [a room]1022-a room , steps down into [a room]1022-a room , all through . At first , [[my]0-i mother]2400-my mother went calling low and soft , as if to reassure [the poor boy]1025-the poor boy , ‘ [Peter]121-peter ! [Peter]121-peter , [dear]2179-dear ! it ’s only [me]0-i ; ’ but , by - and - by , as [the servants]1027-the servants came back from the errands [[my]0-i father]2082-my father had sent [them]1027-the servants , in different directions , to find where [Peter]121-peter was — as [we]1016-we found [he]121-peter was not in [the garden]753-the garden , nor [the hayloft]1030-the hayloft , nor anywhere about — [[my]0-i mother]2400-my mother ’s cry grew louder and wilder , ‘ [Peter]121-peter ! [Peter]121-peter , [[my]0-i darling]1032-my darling ! where are [you]121-peter ? ’ for then [she]2400-my mother felt and understood that that long kiss meant some sad kind of ‘ good - bye . ’ The afternoon went on — [[my]0-i mother]2400-my mother never resting , but seeking again and again in every possible place that had been looked into twenty times before , nay , that [she]2400-my mother had looked into over and over again [herself]2400-my mother . [[My]0-i father]2082-my father sat with [his]2082-my father head in [his]2082-my father hands , not speaking except when [[his]2082-my father messengers]1035-his messengers came in , bringing no tidings ; then [he]2082-my father lifted up [his]2082-my father face , so strong and sad , and told [them]1035-his messengers to go again in some new direction . [[My]0-i mother]2400-my mother kept passing from room to [room]1037-room , in and out of [the house]2059-the house , moving noiselessly , but never ceasing . Neither [she]2400-my mother nor [[my]0-i father]2082-my father durst leave [the house]2059-the house , which was the meeting - place for [all the messengers]1041-all the messengers . At last ( and it was nearly dark ) , [[my]0-i father]2082-my father rose up . [He]2082-my father took hold of [[my]0-i mother]2400-my mother ’s arm as [she]2400-my mother came with wild , sad pace through one door , and quickly towards another . [She]2400-my mother started at the touch of [his]2082-my father hand , for [she]2400-my mother had forgotten all in [the world]333-the world but [Peter]121-peter . “ ‘ [Molly]138-maria ! ’ said [he]2082-my father , ‘ [I]2400-my mother did not think all this would happen . ’ [He]2082-my father looked into [her]2400-my mother face for comfort — [her]2400-my mother poor face all wild and white ; for neither [she]2400-my mother nor [[my]2400-my mother father]2082-my father had dared to acknowledge — much less act upon — the terror that was in [their]2420-their hearts , lest [Peter]121-peter should have made away with [himself]121-peter . [[My]2400-my mother father]2082-my father saw no conscious look in [[his]2082-my father wife]593-his wife ’s hot , dreary eyes , and [he]2082-my father missed the sympathy that [she]2400-my mother had always been ready to give [him]2082-my father — [strong man as [he]2082-my father was]2423-strong man as he was , and at the dumb despair in [her]2400-my mother face [his]2082-my father tears began to flow . But when [she]2400-my mother saw this , a gentle sorrow came over [her]2400-my mother countenance , and [she]2400-my mother said , ‘ [Dearest John]136-john ! do n’t cry ; come with [me]2400-my mother , and [we]2420-their ’ll find [him]121-peter , ’ almost as cheerfully as if [she]2400-my mother knew where [he]121-peter was . And [she]2400-my mother took [[my]2400-my mother father]2082-my father ’s great hand in [her]2400-my mother little soft one , and led [him]121-peter along , the tears dropping as [he]121-peter walked on that same unceasing , weary walk , from room to room , through [house]2425-house and [garden]2426-garden . “[2400-my mother] Oh , how [I]0-i wished for [Deborah]99-deborah ! [I]0-i had no time for crying , for now all seemed to depend on [me]0-i . [I]0-i wrote for [Deborah]99-deborah to come [home]306-home . [I]0-i sent a message privately to [that same [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook ’s house]1046-that same mr holbrook ’s house — poor [Mr Holbrook;—you]156-mr holbrook;—you know who [I]0-i mean . [I]0-i do n’t mean [I]0-i sent a message to [him]119-mr holbrook , but [I]0-i sent one that [I]0-i could trust to know if [Peter]121-peter was at [[his]119-mr holbrook house]734-his house . For at one time [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook was an occasional visitor at [the rectory]2418-the rectory — [you]1049-you know [he]119-mr holbrook was [[Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s cousin]1050-miss pole ’s cousin — and [he]119-mr holbrook had been very kind to [Peter]121-peter , and taught [him]121-peter how to fish — [he]119-mr holbrook was very kind to [everybody]296-everybody , and [I]0-i thought [Peter]121-peter might have gone off there . But [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook was from [home]306-home , and [Peter]121-peter had never been seen . It was night now ; but the doors were all wide open , and [[my]0-i father]2082-my father and [mother]2153-mother walked on and on ; it was more than an hour since [he]2082-my father had joined [her]2153-mother , and [I]0-i do n’t believe [they]1055-them had ever spoken all that time . [I]0-i was getting the parlour fire lighted , and [one of [the servants]1027-the servants]1056-one of the servants was preparing tea , for [I]0-i wanted [them]1055-them to have something to eat and drink and warm [them]1055-them , when [old Clare]152-old clare asked to speak to [me]0-i . “ ‘ [I]152-old clare have borrowed the nets from the weir , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty . Shall [we]1058-we drag the ponds to - night , or wait for the morning ? ’ “[152-old clare] [I]0-i remember staring in [his]2082-my father face to gather [his]2082-my father meaning ; and when [I]0-i did , [I]0-i laughed out loud . The horror of that new thought — [our]1058-we bright , darling [Peter]121-peter , cold , and stark , and dead ! [I]0-i remember the ring of [my]0-i own laugh now . “ The next day [Deborah]99-deborah was at [home]306-home before [I]0-i was [myself]0-i again . [She]99-deborah would not have been so weak as to give way as [I]0-i had done ; but [my]0-i screams ( [my]0-i horrible laughter had ended in crying ) had roused [[my]0-i sweet dear mother , whose poor wandering wits were called back and collected as soon as [a child]2069-a child needed [her]2400-my mother care]2428-my sweet dear mother , whose poor wandering wits were called back and collected as soon as a child needed her care . [She]99-deborah and [Deborah]99-deborah sat by [my]0-i bedside ; [I]0-i knew by the looks of each that there had been no news of [Peter]121-peter — no awful , ghastly news , which was what [I]0-i most had dreaded in [my]0-i dull state between sleeping and waking . “[0-i] The same result of all the searching had brought something of the same relief to [[my]0-i mother]2400-my mother , to whom , [I]0-i am sure , the thought that [Peter]121-peter might even then be hanging dead in some of [the familiar home places]1060-the familiar home places had caused that never - ending walk of yesterday . [Her]2400-my mother soft eyes never were the same again after that ; they had always a restless , craving look , as if seeking for what [they]1061-they could not find . Oh ! it was an awful time ; coming down like a thunder - bolt on the still sunny day when the lilacs were all in bloom . ” “[157-mr peter] Where was [Mr Peter]157-mr peter ? ” said [I.]0-i “[157-mr peter] [He]157-mr peter had made [his]157-mr peter way to [Liverpool]37-liverpool ; and there was war then ; and [some of [[the king]1063-the king ’s ships]1064-the king ’s ships lay off [the mouth of [the Mersey]38-the mersey]1065-the mouth of the mersey]1062-some of the king ’s ships lay off the mouth of the mersey ; and [they]1062-some of the king ’s ships lay off the mouth of the mersey were only too glad to have [a fine likely boy such as [him]157-mr peter]1066-a fine likely boy such as him ( five foot nine [he]157-mr peter was ) , come to offer [himself]157-mr peter . [The captain]367-the captain wrote to [[my]0-i father]2082-my father , and [Peter]157-mr peter wrote to [[my]0-i mother]2400-my mother . Stay ! those letters will be somewhere here . ” [We]2430-we lighted the candle , and found [the captain]367-the captain ’s letter and [Peter]157-mr peter ’s too . And [we]2430-we also found a little simple begging letter from [Mrs Jenkyns]116-mrs jenkyns to [Peter]157-mr peter , addressed to [him]157-mr peter at [the house of an old schoolfellow whither [she]116-mrs jenkyns fancied [he]157-mr peter might have gone]2432-the house of an old schoolfellow whither she fancied he might have gone . [They]1071-we had returned it unopened ; and unopened it had remained ever since , having been inadvertently put by among the other letters of that time . This is it : — “[2303-my dearest] [[MY]0-i DEAREST]2303-my dearest [PETER,—You]158-peter,—you did not think [we]1071-we should be so sorry as [we]1071-we are , [I]0-i know , or [you]158-peter,—you would never have gone away . [You]158-peter,—you are too good . [[Your]158-peter,—you father]2350-your father sits and sighs till [my]0-i heart aches to hear [him]2350-your father . [He]2350-your father can not hold up [his]2350-your father head for grief ; and yet [he]2350-your father only did what [he]2350-your father thought was right . Perhaps [he]2350-your father has been too severe , and perhaps [I]0-i have not been kind enough ; but [God]103-god knows how [we]1071-we love [you]158-peter,—you , [[my]0-i dear only boy]1073-my dear only boy . [Don]124-don quixote looks so sorry [you]158-peter,—you are gone . Come back , and make [us]1071-we happy , who love [you]158-peter,—you so much . [I]0-i know [you]158-peter,—you will come back . ” But [Peter]157-mr peter did not come back . That spring day was the last time [he]157-mr peter ever saw [[his]157-mr peter mother]963-his mother ’s face . [The writer of the letter]2434-the writer of the letter — the last — [the only person who had ever seen what was written in it]2435-the only person who had ever seen what was written in it , was dead long ago ; and [I]0-i , [a stranger , not born at the time when this occurrence took place]2436-a stranger , not born at the time when this occurrence took place , was [the one to open it]2437-the one to open it . [The captain]367-the captain ’s letter summoned [the father]2439-the father and [mother]2153-mother to [Liverpool]37-liverpool instantly , if [they]1077-we wished to see [[their]1077-we boy]2441-their boy ; and , by some of the wild chances of life , [the captain]367-the captain ’s letter had been detained somewhere , somehow . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty went on , “[0-i] And it was racetime , and [all the post - horses at [Cranford]1-cranford]1074-all the post - horses at cranford were gone to the races ; but [[my]0-i father]2082-my father and [mother]2153-mother set off in [[our]1077-we own gig]1078-our own gig — and oh ! [[my]0-i dear]2063-my dear , [they]1080-they were too late — [the ship]1081-the ship was gone ! And now read [Peter]157-mr peter ’s letter to [[my]0-i mother]2400-my mother ! ” It was full of love , and sorrow , and pride in [his]157-mr peter new profession , and a sore sense of [his]157-mr peter disgrace in the eyes of [the people at [Cranford]1-cranford]2443-the people at cranford ; but ending with a passionate entreaty that [she]2400-my mother would come and see [him]157-mr peter before [he]157-mr peter left [the Mersey]38-the mersey : “[153-mother] [Mother]153-mother ; [we]1077-we may go into battle . [I]0-i hope [we]1077-we shall , and lick those French : but [I]0-i must see [you]153-mother again before that time . ” “[0-i] And [she]2400-my mother was too late , ” said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ; “[2400-my mother] too late ! ” [We]1077-we sat in silence , pondering on the full meaning of those sad , sad words . At length [I]2400-my mother asked [Miss Matty]98-miss matty to tell [me]2400-my mother how [[her]0-i mother]439-her mother bore it . “[2400-my mother] Oh ! ” [she]98-miss matty said , “[2400-my mother] [she]2400-my mother was patience itself . [She]2400-my mother had never been strong , and this weakened [her]2400-my mother terribly . [[My]0-i father]2082-my father used to sit looking at [her]2400-my mother : far more sad than [she]2400-my mother was . [He]2082-my father seemed as if [he]2082-my father could look at nothing else when [she]2400-my mother was by ; and [he]2082-my father was so humble — so very gentle now . [He]2082-my father would , perhaps , speak in [his]2082-my father old way — laying down the law , as it were — and then , in a minute or two , [he]2082-my father would come round and put [his]2082-my father hand on [our]1084-us shoulders , and ask [us]1084-us in a low voice , if [he]2082-my father had said anything to hurt [us]1084-us . [I]0-i did not wonder at [his]2082-my father speaking so to [Deborah]99-deborah , for [she]99-deborah was so clever ; but [I]0-i could not bear to hear [him]2082-my father talking so to [me]0-i . “ But , [you]0-i see , [he]2082-my father saw what [we]1084-us did not — that it was killing [[my]2082-my father mother]2400-my mother . Yes ! killing [her]2400-my mother ( put out the candle , [[my]2082-my father dear]2063-my dear ; [I]2082-my father can talk better in the dark ) , for [she]2400-my mother was but [a frail woman]2447-a frail woman , and ill - fitted to stand the fright and shock [she]2400-my mother had gone through ; and [she]2400-my mother would smile at [him]2082-my father and comfort [him]2082-my father , not in words , but in [her]2400-my mother looks and tones , which were always cheerful when [he]2082-my father was there . And [she]2400-my mother would speak of how [she]2400-my mother thought [Peter]157-mr peter stood a good chance of being [admiral]2448-admiral very soon — [he]157-mr peter was so brave and clever ; and how [she]2400-my mother thought of seeing [him]157-mr peter in [his]157-mr peter navy uniform , and what sort of hats [admirals]2449-admirals wore ; and how much more fit [he]157-mr peter was to be [a sailor]2450-a sailor than [a clergyman]2451-a clergyman ; and all in that way , just to make [[my]2082-my father father]2082-my father think [she]2400-my mother was quite glad of what came of that unlucky morning ’s work , and the flogging which was always in [his]2082-my father mind , as [we]2453-we all knew . But oh , [[my]2082-my father dear]2063-my dear ! the bitter , bitter crying [she]2400-my mother had when [she]2400-my mother was alone ; and at last , as [she]2400-my mother grew weaker , [she]2400-my mother could not keep [her]2400-my mother tears in when [Deborah]99-deborah or [me]2082-my father was by , and would give [us]2453-we message after message for [Peter]157-mr peter ( [[his]157-mr peter ship]285-his ship had gone to [the Mediterranean]39-the mediterranean , or somewhere down there , and then [he]157-mr peter was ordered off to [India]15-india , and there was no overland route then ) ; but [she]2400-my mother still said that [no one]477-no one knew where [their]2457-their death lay in wait , and that [we]2453-we were not to think [hers]2400-my mother was near . [We]2453-we did not think it , but [we]2453-we knew it , as [we]2453-we saw [her]2400-my mother fading away . “[2082-my father] Well , [[my]0-i dear]2063-my dear , it ’s very foolish of [me]0-i , [I]0-i know , when in all likelihood [I]0-i am so near seeing [her]1086-her again . “ And only think , love ! the very day after [her]1086-her death — for [she]1086-her did not live quite a twelvemonth after [Peter]157-mr peter went away — the very day after — came a parcel for [her]1086-her from [India]15-india — from [[her]1086-her poor boy]2458-her poor boy . It was a large , soft , white Indian shawl , with just a little narrow border all round ; just what [[my]1087-we mother]2400-my mother would have liked . “[1087-we] [We]1087-we thought it might rouse [[my]0-i father]2082-my father , for [he]2082-my father had sat with [her]1086-her hand in [his]2082-my father all night long ; so [Deborah]99-deborah took it in to [him]2082-my father , and [Peter]157-mr peter ’s letter to [her]1086-her , and all . At first , [he]2082-my father took no notice ; and [we]1087-we tried to make a kind of light careless talk about the shawl , opening it out and admiring it . Then , suddenly , [he]2082-my father got up , and spoke : ‘ [She]1086-her shall be buried in it , ’ [he]2082-my father said ; ‘ [Peter]157-mr peter shall have that comfort ; and [she]1086-her would have liked it . ’ “ Well , perhaps it was not reasonable , but what could [we]1087-we do or say ? [One]2460-one gives [people]359-people in grief [their]359-people own way . [He]2082-my father took it up and felt it : ‘ It is just such a shawl as [she]1086-her wished for when [she]1086-her was married , and [[her]1086-her mother]439-her mother did not give it [her]1086-her . [I]2082-my father did not know of it till after , or [she]1086-her should have had it — [she]1086-her should ; but [she]1086-her shall have it now . ’ “[2082-my father] [[My]0-i mother]2400-my mother looked so lovely in [her]2400-my mother death ! [She]2400-my mother was always pretty , and now [she]2400-my mother looked fair , and waxen , and young — younger than [Deborah]99-deborah , as [she]2400-my mother stood trembling and shivering by [her]2400-my mother . [We]1090-we decked [her]2400-my mother in the long soft folds ; [she]2400-my mother lay smiling , as if pleased ; and [people]359-people came — all [Cranford]96-signor brunoni came — to beg to see [her]2400-my mother , for [they]359-people had loved [her]2400-my mother dearly , as well [they]359-people might ; and [the countrywomen]1092-the countrywomen brought posies ; [[old Clare]152-old clare ’s wife]1093-old clare ’s wife brought some white violets and begged [they]1094-they might lie on [her]2400-my mother breast . “ [Deborah]99-deborah said to [me]1093-old clare ’s wife , the day of [[my]1093-old clare ’s wife mother]2400-my mother ’s funeral , that if [she]99-deborah had a hundred offers [she]99-deborah never would marry and leave [[my]1093-old clare ’s wife father]2082-my father . It was not very likely [she]99-deborah would have so many — [I]1093-old clare ’s wife do n’t know that [she]99-deborah had one ; but it was not less to [her]99-deborah credit to say so . [She]99-deborah was [such a daughter to [[my]1093-old clare ’s wife father]2082-my father]2465-such a daughter to my father as [I]1093-old clare ’s wife think there never was before or since . [His]2082-my father eyes failed [him]2082-my father , and [she]99-deborah read book after book , and wrote , and copied , and was always at [his]2082-my father service in [any parish business]2467-any parish business . [She]99-deborah could do many more things than [[my]1093-old clare ’s wife poor mother]2342-my poor mother could ; [she]99-deborah even once wrote a letter to [the bishop]2469-the bishop for [[my]1093-old clare ’s wife father]2082-my father . But [he]2082-my father missed [[my]1093-old clare ’s wife mother]2400-my mother sorely ; [the whole parish]2472-the whole parish noticed it . Not that [he]2082-my father was less active ; [I]1093-old clare ’s wife think [he]2082-my father was more so , and more patient in helping [every one]426-every one . [I]1093-old clare ’s wife did all [I]1093-old clare ’s wife could to set [Deborah]99-deborah at liberty to be with [him]2082-my father ; for [I]1093-old clare ’s wife knew [I]1093-old clare ’s wife was good for little , and that [my]1093-old clare ’s wife best work in [the world]333-the world was to do odd jobs quietly , and set [others]838-others at liberty . But [[my]1093-old clare ’s wife father]2082-my father was [a changed man]2477-a changed man . ”[1093-old clare ’s wife] “ Did [Mr Peter]157-mr peter ever come [home]306-home ? ”[1092-the countrywomen] “ Yes , once . [He]157-mr peter came [home]306-home [a lieutenant]2480-a lieutenant ; [he]157-mr peter did not get to be [admiral]2448-admiral . And [he]157-mr peter and [[my]1093-old clare ’s wife father]2082-my father were [such friends]2483-such friends ! [[My]1093-old clare ’s wife father]2082-my father took [him]157-mr peter into [every house in [the parish]297-the parish]2485-every house in the parish , [he]2082-my father was so proud of [him]157-mr peter . [He]157-mr peter never walked out without [Peter]157-mr peter ’s arm to lean upon . [Deborah]99-deborah used to smile ( [I]1093-old clare ’s wife do n’t think [we]2487-we ever laughed again after [[my]1093-old clare ’s wife mother]2400-my mother ’s death ) , and say [she]99-deborah was quite put in a corner . Not but what [[my]1093-old clare ’s wife father]2082-my father always wanted [her]99-deborah when there was letter - writing or reading to be done , or anything to be settled . ”[1093-old clare ’s wife] “ And then ? ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , after a pause . “ Then [Peter]157-mr peter went to [sea]2490-sea again ; and , by - and - by , [[my]0-i father]2082-my father died , blessing [us]2487-we both , and thanking [Deborah]99-deborah for all [she]99-deborah had been to [him]2082-my father ; and , of course , [our]2487-we circumstances were changed ; and , instead of living at [the rectory]2418-the rectory , and keeping [three maids]2493-three maids and [a man]2058-a man , [we]2487-we had to come to [this small house]2495-this small house , and be content with [a servant - of - all - work]2496-a servant - of - all - work ; but , as [Deborah]99-deborah used to say , [we]2487-we have always lived genteelly , even if circumstances have compelled [us]2487-we to simplicity . [Poor Deborah]99-deborah ! ”[0-i] “ And [Mr Peter]157-mr peter ? ”[1095-i] asked [I.]1095-i “ Oh , there was some great war in [India]15-india — [I]1095-i forget what [they]2497-they call it — and [we]2487-we have never heard of [Peter]157-mr peter since then . [I]1095-i believe [he]157-mr peter is dead [myself]1095-i ; and it sometimes fidgets [me]1095-i that [we]2487-we have never put on mourning for [him]157-mr peter . And then again , when [I]1095-i sit by [myself]1095-i , and all [the house]2059-the house is still , [I]1095-i think [I]1095-i hear [his]157-mr peter step coming up [the street]467-the street , and [my]1095-i heart begins to flutter and beat ; but the sound always goes past — and [Peter]157-mr peter never comes . “[1095-i] That ’s [Martha]98-miss matty back ? No ! _ [I]0-i ’ll _ go , [[my]0-i dear]2063-my dear ; [I]0-i can always find [my]0-i way in the dark , [you]2063-my dear know . And a blow of fresh air at the door will do [my]0-i head good , and it ’s rather got a trick of aching . ” So [she]98-miss matty pattered off . [I]98-miss matty had lighted the candle , to give [the room]370-the room a cheerful appearance against [her]98-miss matty return . “[98-miss matty] Was it [Martha]98-miss matty ? ” asked [I.]98-miss matty “[98-miss matty] Yes . And [I]0-i am rather uncomfortable , for [I]0-i heard such a strange noise , just as [I]0-i was opening the door . ” “[0-i] Where ? ” [I]0-i asked , for [her]98-miss matty eyes were round with affright . “[0-i] In [the street]467-the street — just outside — it sounded like ” — “[0-i] Talking ? ” [I]0-i put in , as [she]98-miss matty hesitated a little . “[0-i] No ! kissing ” — CHAPTER VII . VISITING ONE morning , as [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [I]0-i sat at [our]2501-our work — it was before twelve o’clock , and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had not changed the cap with yellow ribbons that had been [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty ’s best , and which [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was now wearing out in private , putting on the one made in imitation of [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s at all times when [she]98-miss matty expected to be seen — [Martha]98-miss matty came up , and asked if [Miss Betty Barker]81-miss barker might speak to [[her]98-miss matty mistress]341-her mistress . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty assented , and quickly disappeared to change the yellow ribbons , while [Miss Barker]81-miss barker came [upstairs]340-upstairs ; but , as [she]98-miss matty had forgotten [her]98-miss matty spectacles , and was rather flurried by the unusual time of the visit , [I]0-i was not surprised to see [her]98-miss matty return with one cap on the top of the other . [She]98-miss matty was quite unconscious of it [herself]98-miss matty , and looked at [us]2501-our , with bland satisfaction .
