[Miss Pole]89-miss pole ignored [his]215-mr hayter presence , and pretended to be absorbed in convincing [us]2854-we that [we]2854-we had been cheated , and had not seen [Signor Brunoni]96-signor brunoni after all . CHAPTER X. THE PANIC [I]2120-the rector THINK a series of circumstances dated from [Signor Brunoni]96-signor brunoni ’s visit to [Cranford]1-cranford , which seemed at the time connected in [our]2854-we minds with [him]215-mr hayter , though [I]2120-the rector do n’t know that [he]215-mr hayter had anything really to do with [them]2851-the national school boys . All at once all sorts of uncomfortable rumours got afloat in [the town]281-the town . There were one or two robberies — [real _ bonâ fide _ robberies]2857-real _ bonâ fide _ robberies ; [men]491-men had up before [the magistrates]2859-the magistrates and committed for trial — and that seemed to make [us]2854-we all afraid of being robbed ; and for a long time , at [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s , [I]2120-the rector know , [we]2854-we used to make a regular expedition all round [the kitchens]2860-the kitchens and [cellars]2861-cellars every night , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty leading the way , armed with the poker , [I]2120-the rector following with the hearth - brush , and [Martha]98-miss matty carrying the shovel and fire - irons with which to sound the alarm ; and by the accidental hitting together of [them]2851-the national school boys [she]98-miss matty often frightened [us]2854-we so much that [we]2854-we bolted [ourselves]2854-we up , all three together , in [the back - kitchen]2862-the back - kitchen , or [store - room]2863-store - room , or wherever [we]2854-we happened to be , till , when [our]2854-we affright was over , [we]2854-we recollected [ourselves]2854-we and set out afresh with double valiance . By day [we]2854-we heard strange stories from [the shopkeepers]2864-the shopkeepers and [cottagers]2865-cottagers , of [carts that went about in the dead of night , drawn by horses shod with felt]2866-carts that went about in the dead of night , drawn by horses shod with felt , and guarded by [men in dark clothes]2867-men in dark clothes , going round [the town]281-the town , no doubt in search of [some unwatched house]2869-some unwatched house or some unfastened door . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , who affected great bravery [herself]89-miss pole , was [the principal person to collect and arrange these reports so as to make [them]2871-them assume [their]2871-them most fearful aspect]2870-the principal person to collect and arrange these reports so as to make them assume their most fearful aspect . But [we]2854-we discovered that [she]89-miss pole had begged one of [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ’s worn - out hats to hang up in [[her]89-miss pole lobby]2872-her lobby , and [we]2854-we ( at least [I]2120-the rector ) had doubts as to whether [she]89-miss pole really would enjoy the little adventure of having [[her]89-miss pole house]600-her house broken into , as [she]89-miss pole protested [she]89-miss pole should . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty made no secret of being [an arrant coward]2874-an arrant coward , but [she]98-miss matty went regularly through [[her]98-miss matty housekeeper]2875-her housekeeper ’s duty of inspection — only the hour for this became earlier and earlier , till at last [we]2854-we went the rounds at half - past six , and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty adjourned to bed soon after seven , “[2120-the rector] in order to get the night over the sooner . ” [Cranford]1-cranford had so long piqued [itself]1-cranford on being [an honest and moral town]2876-an honest and moral town that [it]1-cranford had grown to fancy [itself]1-cranford too genteel and well - bred to be otherwise , and felt the stain upon [its]1-cranford character at this time doubly . But [we]2854-we comforted [ourselves]2854-we with the assurance which [we]2854-we gave to [each other]302-each other that the robberies could never have been committed by [any Cranford person]2878-any cranford person ; it must have been [a stranger]2879-a stranger or [strangers who brought this disgrace upon]2880-strangers who brought this disgrace upon [the town]281-the town , and occasioned as many precautions as if [we]2854-we were living among [the Red Indians]2882-the red indians or [the French]216-the french . This last comparison of [our]2854-we nightly state of defence and fortification was made by [[Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester , whose father had served under [General Burgoyne]217-general burgoyne in the American war , and whose husband had fought [the French]216-the french in [Spain]46-spain]2883-mrs forrester , whose father had served under general burgoyne in the american war , and whose husband had fought the french in spain . [She]77-mrs forrester indeed inclined to the idea that , in some way , [the French]216-the french were connected with the small thefts , which were ascertained facts , and the burglaries and highway robberies , which were rumours . [She]77-mrs forrester had been deeply impressed with the idea of [French spies]2884-french spies at some time in [her]77-mrs forrester life ; and the notion could never be fairly eradicated , but sprang up again from time to time . And now [her]77-mrs forrester theory was this:—The [Cranford people]2885-cranford people respected [themselves]2885-cranford people too much , and were too grateful to [the aristocracy who were so kind as to live near [the town]281-the town , ever to disgrace [their]2886-the aristocracy who were so kind as to live near the town , ever to disgrace their bringing up by being dishonest or immoral bringing up by being dishonest or immoral]2886-the aristocracy who were so kind as to live near the town , ever to disgrace their bringing up by being dishonest or immoral ; therefore , [we]2854-we must believe that [the robbers]2888-the robbers were [strangers]433-strangers — if [strangers]433-strangers , why not [foreigners?—if foreigners]2891-foreigners?—if foreigners , who so likely as [the French]216-the french ? [Signor Brunoni]96-signor brunoni spoke broken English like [a Frenchman]2892-a frenchman ; and , though [he]96-signor brunoni wore a turban like [a Turk]2893-a turk , [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester had seen a print of [Madame de Staël]218-madame de staël with a turban on , and another of [Mr Denon]219-mr denon in just such a dress as that in which [the conjuror]2758-the conjuror had made [his]2758-the conjuror appearance , showing clearly that [the French]216-the french , as well as [the Turks]2895-the turks , wore turbans . There could be no doubt [Signor Brunoni]96-signor brunoni was [a Frenchman]2892-a frenchman — [a French spy come to discover [the weak and undefended places of [England]3-england]2898-the weak and undefended places of england , and doubtless [he]96-signor brunoni had [[his]96-signor brunoni accomplices]2899-his accomplices]2897-a french spy come to discover the weak and undefended places of england , and doubtless he had his accomplices . For [her]77-mrs forrester part , [she]77-mrs forrester , [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester , had always had [her]77-mrs forrester own opinion of [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s adventure at the “[2120-the rector] George Inn”—seeing [two men where only one]2900-two men where only one was believed to be . [French people]2901-french people had ways and means which , [she]77-mrs forrester was thankful to say , [the English]220-the english knew nothing about ; and [she]77-mrs forrester had never felt quite easy in [her]77-mrs forrester mind about going to see [that conjuror]2902-that conjuror — it was rather too much like a forbidden thing , though [the rector]2120-the rector was there . In short , [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester grew more excited than [we]2904-we had ever known [her]77-mrs forrester before , and , being [[an officer]2905-an officer ’s daughter]2906-an officer ’s daughter and [widow]2907-widow , [we]2904-we looked up to [her]77-mrs forrester opinion , of course . Really [I]2120-the rector do not know how much was true or false in the reports which flew about like wildfire just at this time ; but it seemed to [me]2120-the rector then that there was every reason to believe that at [Mardon]47-mardon ( [a small town about eight miles from Cranford]2908-a small town about eight miles from cranford ) [houses]2909-houses and [shops]2910-shops were entered by holes made in the walls , the bricks being silently carried away in the dead of the night , and all done so quietly that no sound was heard either in or out of [the house]2059-the house . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty gave it up in despair when [she]98-miss matty heard of this . “[2120-the rector] What was the use , ” said [she]98-miss matty , “[2120-the rector] of locks and bolts , and bells to the windows , and going round [the house]2059-the house every night ? That last trick was fit for [a conjuror]1302-a conjuror . Now [she]1303-she did believe that [Signor Brunoni]96-signor brunoni was at the bottom of it . ” One afternoon , about five o’clock , [we]2904-we were startled by a hasty knock at the door . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty bade [me]96-signor brunoni run and tell [Martha]98-miss matty on no account to open the door till [she]98-miss matty ( [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ) had reconnoitred through the window ; and [she]98-miss matty armed [herself]98-miss matty with a footstool to drop down on the head of [the visitor]2912-the visitor , in case [he]2912-the visitor should show a face covered with black crape , as [he]2912-the visitor looked up in answer to [her]98-miss matty inquiry of who was there . But it was [nobody]2061-nobody but [Miss Pole]89-miss pole and [Betty]81-miss barker . [The former]2914-the former came [upstairs]340-upstairs , carrying a little hand - basket , and [she]0-i was evidently in a state of great agitation . “[96-signor brunoni] Take care of that ! ” said [she]0-i to [me]96-signor brunoni , as [I]96-signor brunoni offered to relieve [her]0-i of [her]0-i basket . “[96-signor brunoni] It ’s [my]0-i plate . [I]0-i am sure there is a plan to rob [[my]0-i house]2252-my house to - night . [I]0-i am come to throw [myself]0-i on [your]1305-you hospitality , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty . [Betty]81-miss barker is going to sleep with [[her]81-miss barker cousin]1306-her cousin at [the ‘ George]1307-the ‘ george . ’ [I]0-i can sit up here all night if [you]1305-you will allow [me]0-i ; but [[my]0-i house]2252-my house is so far from [any neighbours]1309-any neighbours , and [I]0-i do n’t believe [we]1310-we could be heard if [we]1310-we screamed ever so ! ” “[1310-we] But , ” said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , “[1310-we] what has alarmed [you]1305-you so much ? Have [you]1305-you seen [any men]1311-any men lurking about [the house]2059-the house ? ” “[1305-you] Oh , yes ! ” answered [Miss Pole]89-miss pole . “[1305-you] [Two very bad - looking men]1313-two very bad - looking men have gone three times past [the house]2059-the house , very slowly ; and [an Irish beggar - woman]1315-an irish beggar - woman came not half - an - hour ago , and all but forced [herself]1315-an irish beggar - woman in past [Betty]81-miss barker , saying [[her]1315-an irish beggar - woman children]964-her children were starving , and [she]1315-an irish beggar - woman must speak to [the mistress]1317-the mistress . [You]1318-you see , [she]1315-an irish beggar - woman said ‘ [mistress]694-mistress , ’ though there was a hat hanging up in [the hall]2343-the hall , and it would have been more natural to have said ‘ [master]1321-master . ’ But [Betty]81-miss barker shut the door in [her]81-miss barker face , and came up to [me]0-i , and [we]1322-we got the spoons together , and sat in the parlour - window watching till [we]1322-we saw [Thomas Jones]221-thomas jones going from [his]221-thomas jones work , when [we]1322-we called to [him]221-thomas jones and asked [him]221-thomas jones to take care of [us]1322-we into [the town]281-the town . ” [We]1322-we might have triumphed over [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , who had professed such bravery until [she]89-miss pole was frightened ; but [we]1322-we were too glad to perceive that [she]89-miss pole shared in the weaknesses of humanity to exult over [her]89-miss pole ; and [I]221-thomas jones gave up [[my]221-thomas jones room]2916-my room to [her]89-miss pole very willingly , and shared [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s bed for the night . But before [we]1322-we retired , [the two ladies]2783-the two ladies rummaged up , out of the recesses of [their]2783-the two ladies memory , such horrid stories of robbery and murder that [I]221-thomas jones quite quaked in [my]221-thomas jones shoes . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole was evidently anxious to prove that such terrible events had occurred within [her]89-miss pole experience that [she]89-miss pole was justified in [her]89-miss pole sudden panic ; and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty did not like to be outdone , and capped every story with one yet more horrible , till it reminded [me]221-thomas jones oddly enough , of an old story [I]221-thomas jones had read somewhere , of [a nightingale]2918-a nightingale and [a musician , who strove one against the other which could produce the most admirable music]2919-a musician , who strove one against the other which could produce the most admirable music , till poor [Philomel]222-philomel dropped down dead . One of the stories that haunted [me]221-thomas jones for a long time afterwards was of [a girl who was left in charge of [a great house in [Cumberland]31-cumberland]2921-a great house in cumberland on some particular fair - day , when [the other servants]2922-the other servants all went off to the gaieties]2920-a girl who was left in charge of a great house in cumberland on some particular fair - day , when the other servants all went off to the gaieties . [The family]567-the family were away in [London]4-london , and [a pedlar]2924-a pedlar came by , and asked to leave [his]2924-a pedlar large and heavy pack in [the kitchen]635-the kitchen , saying [he]2924-a pedlar would call for it again at night ; and [the girl]2926-the girl ( [[a gamekeeper]2927-a gamekeeper ’s daughter]2928-a gamekeeper ’s daughter ) , roaming about in search of amusement , chanced to hit upon a gun hanging up in [the hall]2343-the hall , and took it down to look at the chasing ; and it went off through the open kitchen door , hit the pack , and a slow dark thread of blood came oozing out . ( How [Miss Pole]89-miss pole enjoyed this part of the story , dwelling on each word as if [she]89-miss pole loved it ! ) [She]89-miss pole rather hurried over the further account of [the girl]2926-the girl ’s bravery , and [I]221-thomas jones have but a confused idea that , somehow , [she]89-miss pole baffled [the robbers]2888-the robbers with Italian irons , heated red - hot , and then restored to blackness by being dipped in grease . [We]2932-we parted for the night with an awe - stricken wonder as to what [we]2932-we should hear of in the morning — and , on [my]221-thomas jones part , with a vehement desire for the night to be over and gone : [I]221-thomas jones was so afraid lest [the robbers]2888-the robbers should have seen , from some dark lurking - place , that [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had carried off [her]89-miss pole plate , and thus have a double motive for attacking [[our]2932-we house]2934-our house . [ Picture : Asked [him]2927-a gamekeeper to take care of [us]2932-we ] But until [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire came to call next day [we]2932-we heard of nothing unusual . The kitchen fire - irons were in exactly the same position against the back door as when [Martha]98-miss matty and [I]221-thomas jones had skilfully piled them up , like spillikins , ready to fall with an awful clatter if only a cat had touched the outside panels . [I]221-thomas jones had wondered what [we]2932-we should all do if thus awakened and alarmed , and had proposed to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty that [we]2932-we should cover up [our]2932-we faces under the bed - clothes so that there should be no danger of [the robbers]2888-the robbers thinking that [we]2932-we could identify [them]2888-the robbers ; but [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , who was trembling very much , scouted this idea , and said [we]2932-we owed it to [society]2936-society to apprehend [them]2888-the robbers , and that [she]98-miss matty should certainly do [her]98-miss matty best to lay hold of [them]2888-the robbers and lock [them]2888-the robbers up in [the garret]2937-the garret till morning . When [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire came , [we]2932-we almost felt jealous of [her]182-lady glenmire . [[Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s house]2706-mrs jamieson ’s house had really been attacked ; at least there were [men]491-men ’s footsteps to be seen on the flower borders , underneath the kitchen windows , “[221-thomas jones] where nae [men]491-men should be ; ” and [Carlo]166-carlo had barked all through the night as if [strangers]433-strangers were abroad . [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson had been awakened by [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire , and [they]2941-they had rung the bell which communicated with [[Mr Mulliner]193-mr mulliner ’s room]2942-mr mulliner ’s room in [the third storey]2943-the third storey , and when [his]193-mr mulliner night - capped head had appeared over [the bannisters]2944-the bannisters , in answer to the summons , [they]2941-they had told [him]193-mr mulliner of [their]2941-they alarm , and the reasons for it ; whereupon [he]193-mr mulliner retreated into [[his]193-mr mulliner bedroom]2945-his bedroom , and locked the door ( for fear of draughts , as [he]193-mr mulliner informed [them]2941-they in the morning ) , and opened the window , and called out valiantly to say , if [the supposed robbers]2946-the supposed robbers would come to [him]193-mr mulliner [he]193-mr mulliner would fight [them]2946-the supposed robbers ; but , as [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire observed , that was but poor comfort , since [they]2941-they would have to pass by [[Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s room]2947-mrs jamieson ’s room and [her]182-lady glenmire own before [they]2941-they could reach [him]193-mr mulliner , and must be of a very pugnacious disposition indeed if [they]2941-they neglected the opportunities of robbery presented by [the unguarded lower storeys]2948-the unguarded lower storeys , to go up to [a garret]2949-a garret , and there force a door in order to get at the champion of [the house]2059-the house . [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire , after waiting and listening for some time in [the drawing - room]503-the drawing - room , had proposed to [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson that [they]2941-they should go to bed ; but [that lady]603-that lady said [she]603-that lady should not feel comfortable unless [she]603-that lady sat up and watched ; and , accordingly , [she]603-that lady packed [herself]603-that lady warmly up on the sofa , where [she]603-that lady was found by [the housemaid]2953-the housemaid , when [she]603-that lady came into [the room]370-the room at six o’clock , fast asleep ; but [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire went to bed , and kept awake all night . When [Miss Pole]89-miss pole heard of this , [she]89-miss pole nodded [her]89-miss pole head in great satisfaction . [She]89-miss pole had been sure [we]2955-we should hear of something happening in [Cranford]1-cranford that night ; and [we]2955-we had heard . It was clear enough [they]2941-they had first proposed to attack [[her]89-miss pole house]600-her house ; but when [they]2941-they saw that [she]89-miss pole and [Betty]81-miss barker were on [their]2941-they guard , and had carried off the plate , [they]2941-they had changed [their]2941-they tactics and gone to [[Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s]2657-mrs jamieson ’s , and [no one]477-no one knew what might have happened if [Carlo]166-carlo had not barked , like a good dog as [he]166-carlo was ! [Poor Carlo]166-carlo ! [his]166-carlo barking days were nearly over . Whether [the gang who infested [the neighbourhood]2511-the neighbourhood]2959-the gang who infested the neighbourhood were afraid of [him]166-carlo , or whether [they]2959-the gang who infested the neighbourhood were revengeful enough , for the way in which [he]166-carlo had baffled [them]2959-the gang who infested the neighbourhood on the night in question , to poison [him]166-carlo ; or whether , as some among [the more uneducated people]2961-the more uneducated people thought , [he]166-carlo died of apoplexy , brought on by too much feeding and too little exercise ; at any rate , it is certain that , two days after this eventful night , [Carlo]166-carlo was found dead , with [his]166-carlo poor legs stretched out stiff in the attitude of running , as if by such unusual exertion [he]166-carlo could escape [the sure pursuer]2962-the sure pursuer , Death . [We]2963-we were all sorry for [Carlo]166-carlo , [the old familiar friend who had snapped at [us]2963-we for so many years]2964-the old familiar friend who had snapped at us for so many years ; and the mysterious mode of [his]166-carlo death made [us]2963-we very uncomfortable . Could [Signor Brunoni]96-signor brunoni be at the bottom of this ? [He]96-signor brunoni had apparently killed [a canary with only a word of command]2965-a canary with only a word of command ; [his]96-signor brunoni will seemed of deadly force ; who knew but what [he]96-signor brunoni might yet be lingering in [the neighbourhood]2511-the neighbourhood willing all sorts of awful things ! [We]2963-we whispered these fancies among [ourselves]2963-we in the evenings ; but in the mornings [our]2963-we courage came back with the daylight , and in a week ’s time [we]2963-we had got over the shock of [Carlo]166-carlo ’s death ; all but [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson . [She]78-mrs jamieson , poor thing , felt it as [she]78-mrs jamieson had felt no event since [[her]78-mrs jamieson husband]601-her husband ’s death ; indeed , [Miss Pole]89-miss pole said , that as [the Honourable Mr Jamieson]185-mr jamieson drank a good deal , and occasioned [her]78-mrs jamieson much uneasiness , it was possible that [Carlo]166-carlo ’s death might be the greater affliction . But there was always a tinge of cynicism in [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s remarks . However , one thing was clear and certain — it was necessary for [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson to have some change of scene ; and [Mr Mulliner]193-mr mulliner was very impressive on this point , shaking [his]193-mr mulliner head whenever [we]2963-we inquired after [[his]193-mr mulliner mistress]2616-his mistress , and speaking of [her]2616-his mistress loss of appetite and bad nights very ominously ; and with justice too , for if [she]2616-his mistress had two characteristics in [her]2616-his mistress natural state of health they were a facility of eating and sleeping . If [she]2616-his mistress could neither eat nor sleep , [she]2616-his mistress must be indeed out of spirits and out of health . [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire ( who had evidently taken very kindly to [Cranford]1-cranford ) did not like the idea of [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s going to [Cheltenham]48-cheltenham , and more than once insinuated pretty plainly that it was [Mr Mulliner]193-mr mulliner ’s doing , who had been much alarmed on the occasion of [the house]2059-the house being attacked , and since had said , more than once , that [he]193-mr mulliner felt it a very responsible charge to have to defend [so many women]2970-so many women . Be that as it might , [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson went to [Cheltenham]48-cheltenham , escorted by [Mr Mulliner]193-mr mulliner ; and [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire remained in possession of [the house]2059-the house , [[her]182-lady glenmire ostensible office]2972-her ostensible office being to take care that [the maid - servants]2973-the maid - servants did not pick up [followers]2292-followers . [She]182-lady glenmire made [a very pleasant - looking dragon]2975-a very pleasant - looking dragon ; and , as soon as it was arranged for [her]182-lady glenmire stay in [Cranford]1-cranford , [she]182-lady glenmire found out that [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s visit to [Cheltenham]48-cheltenham was just the best thing in [the world]333-the world . [She]182-lady glenmire had let [[her]182-lady glenmire house]600-her house in [Edinburgh]9-edinburgh , and was for the time [house]2425-house - less , so the charge of [[[her]182-lady glenmire sister - in - law]2641-her sister - in - law ’s comfortable abode]2980-her sister - in - law ’s comfortable abode was very convenient and acceptable . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole was very much inclined to instal [herself]89-miss pole as [a heroine]2981-a heroine , because of the decided steps [she]89-miss pole had taken in flying from [the two men]2982-the two men and [one woman]2983-one woman , whom [she]89-miss pole entitled “[1325-that murderous gang] [that murderous gang]1325-that murderous gang . ” [She]89-miss pole described [their]2982-the two men appearance in glowing colours , and [I]1327-her men noticed that every time [she]89-miss pole went over the story some fresh trait of villainy was added to [their]2982-the two men appearance . [One]2460-one was tall — [he]2460-one grew to be gigantic in height before [we]2985-we had done with [him]2460-one ; [he]2460-one of course had black hair — and by - and - by it hung in elf - locks over [his]2460-one forehead and down [his]2460-one back . The other was short and broad — and a hump sprouted out on [his]2460-one shoulder before [we]2985-we heard the last of [him]2460-one ; [he]2460-one had red hair — which deepened into carroty ; and [she]89-miss pole was almost sure [he]2460-one had a cast in the eye — a decided squint . As for [the woman]974-the woman , [her]974-the woman eyes glared , and [she]974-the woman was masculine - looking — [a perfect virago]2987-a perfect virago ; most probably [a man dressed in [woman]2989-woman ’s clothes]2988-a man dressed in woman ’s clothes ; afterwards , [we]2985-we heard of a beard on [her]974-the woman chin , and a manly voice and a stride . If [Miss Pole]89-miss pole was delighted to recount the events of that afternoon to [all inquirers]2990-all inquirers , [others]838-others were not so proud of [their]838-others adventures in the robbery line . [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins , [the surgeon]290-the surgeon , had been attacked at [his]105-mr hoggins own door by [two ruffians , who were concealed in the shadow of the porch]2993-two ruffians , who were concealed in the shadow of the porch , and so effectually silenced [him]105-mr hoggins that [he]105-mr hoggins was robbed in the interval between ringing [his]105-mr hoggins bell and [the servant]2994-the servant ’s answering it . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole was sure it would turn out that this robbery had been committed by “[1327-her men] [[her]1326-her men]1327-her men , ” and went the very day [she]89-miss pole heard the report to have [her]89-miss pole teeth examined , and to question [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins . [She]89-miss pole came to [us]2995-we afterwards ; so [we]2995-we heard what [she]89-miss pole had heard , straight and direct from the source , while [we]2995-we were yet in the excitement and flutter of the agitation caused by the first intelligence ; for the event had only occurred the night before . “[1327-her men] Well ! ” said [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , sitting down with the decision of [a person who has made up [her]89-miss pole mind as to the nature of life and [the world]333-the world]2996-a person who has made up her mind as to the nature of life and the world ( and [such people]2998-such people never tread lightly , or seat [themselves]2998-such people without a bump ) , “[1327-her men] well , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ! [men]491-men will be [men]491-men . [[Every mother]1330-every mother ’s son of [them]491-men]1331-every mother ’s son of them wishes to be considered [Samson]92-sam weller and [Solomon]223-solomon rolled into one — too strong ever to be beaten or discomfited — too wise ever to be outwitted . If [you]1332-you will notice , [they]491-men have always foreseen events , though [they]491-men never tell one for [one]2460-one ’s warning before the events happen . [[My]0-i father]2082-my father was [a man]2058-a man , and [I]0-i know the sex pretty well . ” [She]0-i had talked [herself]0-i out of breath , and [we]2999-we should have been very glad to fill up the necessary pause as [chorus]3000-chorus , but [we]2999-we did not exactly know what to say , or which [man]2122-man had suggested this diatribe against the sex ; so [we]2999-we only joined in generally , with a grave shake of the head , and a soft murmur of “[2058-a man] [They]491-men are very incomprehensible , certainly ! ” “[491-men] Now , only think , ” said [she]0-i . “[491-men] There , [I]0-i have undergone the risk of having one of [my]0-i remaining teeth drawn ( for one is terribly at the mercy of [any surgeon - dentist]1336-any surgeon - dentist ; and [I]0-i , for one , always speak them fair till [I]0-i have got [my]0-i mouth out of [their]491-men clutches ) , and , after all , [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins is too much of [a man]2058-a man to own that [he]105-mr hoggins was robbed last night . ” “[105-mr hoggins] Not robbed ! ” exclaimed [the chorus]3002-the chorus . “[81-miss barker] Do n’t tell [me]0-i ! ” [Miss Pole]89-miss pole exclaimed , angry that [we]3003-we could be for a moment imposed upon . “[0-i] [I]0-i believe [he]105-mr hoggins was robbed , just as [Betty]81-miss barker told [me]0-i , and [he]105-mr hoggins is ashamed to own [it]1338-it ; and , to be sure , it was very silly of [him]105-mr hoggins to be robbed just at [his]105-mr hoggins own door ; [I]0-i daresay [he]105-mr hoggins feels that such a thing wo n’t raise [him]105-mr hoggins in the eyes of [Cranford]1-cranford society , and is anxious to conceal it — but [he]105-mr hoggins need not have tried to impose upon [me]0-i , by saying [I]0-i must have heard an exaggerated account of some petty theft of a neck of mutton , which , it seems , was stolen out of the safe in [[his]105-mr hoggins yard]1339-his yard last week ; [he]105-mr hoggins had the impertinence to add , [he]105-mr hoggins believed that that was taken by the cat . [I]0-i have no doubt , if [I]0-i could get at the bottom of it , it was [that Irishman dressed up in [woman]2989-woman ’s clothes , who came spying about [[my]0-i house]2252-my house , with the story about [the starving children]1343-the starving children]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children . ” After [we]3004-we had duly condemned the want of candour which [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins had evinced , and abused [men in general]3005-men in general , taking [him]105-mr hoggins for the representative and type , [we]3004-we got round to the subject about which [we]3004-we had been talking when [Miss Pole]89-miss pole came in ; namely , how far , in [the present disturbed state of [the country]710-the country]3006-the present disturbed state of the country , [we]3004-we could venture to accept an invitation which [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had just received from [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester , to come as usual and keep the anniversary of [her]98-miss matty wedding - day by drinking tea with [her]98-miss matty at five o’clock , and playing a quiet pool afterwards . [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester had said that [she]77-mrs forrester asked [us]3004-we with some diffidence , because [the roads]3008-the roads were , [she]77-mrs forrester feared , very unsafe . But [she]77-mrs forrester suggested that perhaps [one of [us]3004-we]3009-one of us would not object to take [the sedan]2635-the sedan , and that [the others]3011-the others , by walking briskly , might keep up with the long trot of [the chairmen]3012-the chairmen , and so [we]3004-we might all arrive safely at [Over Place]49-over place , [a suburb of [the town]281-the town]3013-a suburb of the town . ( No ; that is too large an expression : [a small cluster of houses separated from [Cranford]1-cranford]3015-a small cluster of houses separated from cranford by about two hundred yards of [a dark and lonely lane]3016-a dark and lonely lane . ) There was no doubt but that a similar note was awaiting [Miss Pole]89-miss pole at [home]306-home ; so [her]77-mrs forrester call was a very fortunate affair , as it enabled [us]3004-we to consult together . [We]3004-we would all much rather have declined this invitation ; but [we]3004-we felt that it would not be quite kind to [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester , who would otherwise be left to a solitary retrospect of [her]77-mrs forrester not very happy or fortunate life . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had been [visitors on this occasion]3018-visitors on this occasion for many years , and now [they]3011-the others gallantly determined to nail [their]3011-the others colours to the mast , and to go through [Darkness Lane]50-darkness lane rather than fail in loyalty to [[their]3011-the others friend]3019-their friend . But when the evening came , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ( for it was [she]98-miss matty who was voted into the chair , as [she]98-miss matty had a cold ) , before being shut down in [the sedan]2635-the sedan , like [jack - in - a - box]3021-jack - in - a - box , implored [the chairmen]3012-the chairmen , whatever might befall , not to run away and leave [her]98-miss matty fastened up there , to be murdered ; and even after [they]3012-the chairmen had promised , [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children saw [her]98-miss matty tighten [her]98-miss matty features into the stern determination of [a martyr]3023-a martyr , and [she]98-miss matty gave [me]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children a melancholy and ominous shake of the head through the glass . However , [we]3024-we got [there]289-there safely , only rather out of breath , for it was who could trot hardest through [Darkness Lane]50-darkness lane , and [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children am afraid poor [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was sadly jolted . [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester had made extra preparations , in acknowledgment of [our]3024-we exertion in coming to see [her]98-miss matty through such dangers . The usual forms of genteel ignorance as to what [[her]77-mrs forrester servants]3026-her servants might send up were all gone through ; and harmony and Preference seemed likely to be the order of the evening , but for an interesting conversation that began [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children do n’t know how , but which had relation , of course , to [the robbers who infested [the neighbourhood of [Cranford]1-cranford]3028-the neighbourhood of cranford]3027-the robbers who infested the neighbourhood of cranford . Having braved the dangers of [Darkness Lane]50-darkness lane , and thus having a little stock of reputation for courage to fall back upon ; and also , [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children daresay , desirous of proving [ourselves]3024-we superior to [men]491-men ( _ videlicet _ [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ) in the article of candour , [we]3024-we began to relate [our]3024-we individual fears , and the private precautions [we]3024-we each of [us]3024-we took . [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children owned that [my]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children pet apprehension was eyes — eyes looking at [me]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children , and watching [me]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children , glittering out from some dull , flat , wooden surface ; and that if [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children dared to go up to [my]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children looking - glass when [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children was panic - stricken , [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children should certainly turn it round , with its back towards [me]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children , for fear of seeing eyes behind [me]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children looking out of the darkness . [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children saw [Miss Matty]98-miss matty nerving [herself]98-miss matty up for a confession ; and at last out it came . [She]98-miss matty owned that , ever since [she]98-miss matty had been [a girl]2174-a girl , [she]98-miss matty had dreaded being caught by [her]98-miss matty last leg , just as [she]98-miss matty was getting into bed , by [some one concealed under it]3031-some one concealed under it . [She]98-miss matty said , when [she]98-miss matty was younger and more active , [she]98-miss matty used to take a flying leap from a distance , and so bring both [her]98-miss matty legs up safely into bed at once ; but that this had always annoyed [Deborah]99-deborah , who piqued [herself]99-deborah upon getting into bed gracefully , and [she]99-deborah had given it up in consequence . But now the old terror would often come over [her]98-miss matty , especially since [[Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s house]3032-miss pole ’s house had been attacked ( [we]3033-we had got quite to believe in the fact of the attack having taken place ) , and yet it was very unpleasant to think of looking under a bed , and seeing [a man]2058-a man concealed , with a great , fierce face staring out at [you]3035-you ; so [she]98-miss matty had bethought [herself]98-miss matty of something — perhaps [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children had noticed that [she]98-miss matty had told [Martha]98-miss matty to buy [her]98-miss matty a penny ball , such as [children]1116-children play with — and now [she]98-miss matty rolled this ball under the bed every night : if it came out on the other side , well and good ; if not [she]98-miss matty always took care to have [her]98-miss matty hand on the bell - rope , and meant to call out [John]162-john bullish and [Harry]106-harry , just as if [she]98-miss matty expected [men - servants]3037-men - servants to answer [her]98-miss matty ring . [We]3033-we all applauded this ingenious contrivance , and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty sank back into satisfied silence , with a look at [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester as if to ask for _ [her]98-miss matty _ private weakness . [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester looked askance at [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , and tried to change the subject a little by telling [us]3033-we that [she]98-miss matty had borrowed [a boy from [one of [the neighbouring cottages]3040-the neighbouring cottages]3039-one of the neighbouring cottages]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages and promised [[his]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages parents]3041-his parents a hundredweight of coals at Christmas , and [his]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages supper every evening , for the loan of [him]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages at nights . [She]98-miss matty had instructed [him]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages in [his]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages possible duties when [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages first came ; and , finding [him]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages sensible , [she]98-miss matty had given [him]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages [the Major]674-the major ’s sword ( [the Major]674-the major was [[her]98-miss matty late husband]3044-her late husband ) , and desired [him]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages to put it very carefully behind [his]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages pillow at night , turning the edge towards the head of the pillow . [He]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages was [a sharp lad]3045-a sharp lad , [she]98-miss matty was sure ; for , spying out [the Major]674-the major ’s cocked hat , [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages had said , if [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages might have that to wear , [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages was sure [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages could frighten [two Englishmen]3047-two englishmen , or [four Frenchmen]3048-four frenchmen any day . But [she]98-miss matty had impressed upon [him]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages anew that [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages was to lose no time in putting on hats or anything else ; but , if [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages heard any noise , [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages was to run at it with [his]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages drawn sword . On [my]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children suggesting that some accident might occur from such slaughterous and indiscriminate directions , and that [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages might rush on [Jenny]104-jenny getting up to wash , and have spitted [her]104-jenny before [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages had discovered that [she]104-jenny was not [a Frenchman]2892-a frenchman , [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester said [she]77-mrs forrester did not think that that was likely , for [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages was [a very sound sleeper]3050-a very sound sleeper , and generally had to be well shaken or cold - pigged in a morning before [they]3051-they could rouse [him]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages . [She]77-mrs forrester sometimes thought such dead sleep must be owing to the hearty suppers [the poor lad]3052-the poor lad ate , for [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages was half - starved at [home]306-home , and [she]77-mrs forrester told [Jenny]104-jenny to see that [he]3038-a boy from one of the neighbouring cottages got a good meal at night . [ Picture : Slaughterous and indiscriminate directions ] Still this was no confession of [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester ’s peculiar timidity , and [we]3054-we urged [her]77-mrs forrester to tell [us]3054-we what [she]77-mrs forrester thought would frighten [her]77-mrs forrester more than anything . [She]77-mrs forrester paused , and stirred the fire , and snuffed the candles , and then [she]77-mrs forrester said , in a sounding whisper — “[1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children] Ghosts ! ” [She]77-mrs forrester looked at [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , as much as to say , [she]77-mrs forrester had declared it , and would stand by it . Such a look was a challenge in itself . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole came down upon [her]77-mrs forrester with indigestion , spectral illusions , optical delusions , and a great deal out of [Dr Ferrier]224-dr ferrier and [Dr Hibbert]225-dr hibbert besides . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had rather a leaning to ghosts , as [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children have mentioned before , and what little [she]77-mrs forrester did say was all on [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester ’s side , who , emboldened by sympathy , protested that ghosts were a part of [her]77-mrs forrester religion ; that surely [she]77-mrs forrester , [the widow of [a major in [the army]3057-the army]3056-a major in the army]3055-the widow of a major in the army , knew what to be frightened at , and what not ; in short , [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children never saw [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester so warm either before or since , for [she]77-mrs forrester was [a gentle , meek , enduring old lady in most things]3058-a gentle , meek , enduring old lady in most things . Not all the elder - wine that ever was mulled could this night wash out the remembrance of this difference between [Miss Pole]89-miss pole and [[her]89-miss pole hostess]3059-her hostess . Indeed , when the elder - wine was brought in , it gave rise to a new burst of discussion ; for [Jenny]104-jenny , [the little maiden who staggered under the tray]3060-the little maiden who staggered under the tray , had to give evidence of having seen a ghost with [her]104-jenny own eyes , not so many nights ago , in [Darkness Lane]50-darkness lane , [the very lane [we]3062-we were to go through on [our]3062-we way [home]306-home]3061-the very lane we were to go through on our way home . In spite of the uncomfortable feeling which this last consideration gave [me]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children , [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children could not help being amused at [Jenny]104-jenny ’s position , which was exceedingly like that of [a witness]3064-a witness being examined and cross - examined by [two counsel who are not at all scrupulous about asking leading questions]3065-two counsel who are not at all scrupulous about asking leading questions . The conclusion [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children arrived at was , that [Jenny]104-jenny had certainly seen something beyond what a fit of indigestion would have caused . [A lady all in white]3066-a lady all in white , and without [her]3066-a lady all in white head , was what [she]3066-a lady all in white deposed and adhered to , supported by a consciousness of the secret sympathy of [[her]3066-a lady all in white mistress]341-her mistress under the withering scorn with which [Miss Pole]89-miss pole regarded [her]3066-a lady all in white . And not only [she]3066-a lady all in white , but [many others]531-many others , had seen [this headless lady]3069-this headless lady , who sat by the roadside wringing [her]3066-a lady all in white hands as in deep grief . [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester looked at [us]3070-we from time to time with an air of conscious triumph ; but then [she]77-mrs forrester had not to pass through [Darkness Lane]50-darkness lane before [she]77-mrs forrester could bury [herself]77-mrs forrester beneath [her]77-mrs forrester own familiar bed - clothes . [We]3070-we preserved a discreet silence as to [the headless lady]3071-the headless lady while [we]3070-we were putting on [our]3070-we things to go [home]306-home , for there was no knowing how near the ghostly head and ears might be , or what spiritual connection [they]3073-they might be keeping up with the unhappy body in [Darkness Lane]50-darkness lane ; and , therefore , even [Miss Pole]89-miss pole felt that it was as well not to speak lightly on such subjects , for fear of vexing or insulting that woebegone trunk . At least , so [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children conjecture ; for , instead of the busy clatter usual in the operation , [we]3070-we tied on [our]3070-we cloaks as sadly as mutes at a funeral . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty drew the curtains round the windows of the chair to shut out disagreeable sights , and [the men]3074-the men ( either because [they]3074-the men were in spirits that [their]3074-the men labours were so nearly ended , or because [they]3074-the men were going down [hill]3075-hill ) , set off at such a round and merry pace , that it was all [Miss Pole]89-miss pole and [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children could do to keep up with [them]3074-the men . [She]98-miss matty had breath for nothing beyond an imploring “[1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children] Do n’t leave [me]0-i ! ” uttered as [she]98-miss matty clutched [my]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children arm so tightly that [I]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children could not have quitted [her]98-miss matty , ghost or [no ghost]3076-no ghost . What a relief it was when [the men]3074-the men , weary of [their]3074-the men burden and [their]3074-the men quick trot , stopped just where [Headingley Causeway]51-headingley causeway branches off from [Darkness Lane]50-darkness lane ! [Miss Pole]89-miss pole unloosed [me]1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children and caught at [one of [the men]3074-the men]3078-one of the men — “[1340-that irishman dressed up in woman ’s clothes , who came spying about my house , with the story about the starving children] Could not [you]1344-you — could not [you]1344-you take [Miss Matty]98-miss matty round by [Headingley Causeway?—the]52-headingley causeway?—the pavement in [Darkness Lane]50-darkness lane jolts so , and [she]98-miss matty is not very strong . ” A smothered voice was heard from the inside of the chair — “[98-miss matty] Oh ! pray go on ! What is the matter ? What is the matter ? [I]0-i will give [you]1344-you sixpence more to go on very fast ; pray do n’t stop here . ” “[0-i] And [I]0-i ’ll give [you]1344-you a shilling , ” said [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , with tremulous dignity , “[0-i] if [you]1344-you ’ll go by [Headingley Causeway]51-headingley causeway . ” [The two men]2982-the two men grunted acquiescence and took up the chair , and went along [the causeway]3081-the causeway , which certainly answered [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s kind purpose of saving [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s bones ; for it was covered with soft , thick mud , and even a fall there would have been easy till the getting - up came , when there might have been some difficulty in extrication . [CHAPTER XI . SAMUEL BROWN]226-chapter xi . samuel brown THE next morning [I]0-i met [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire and [Miss Pole]89-miss pole setting out on a long walk to find [some old woman who was famous in [the neighbourhood]2511-the neighbourhood for [her]77-mrs forrester skill in knitting woollen stockings]3082-some old woman who was famous in the neighbourhood for her skill in knitting woollen stockings . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole said to [me]0-i , with a smile half - kindly and half - contemptuous upon [her]0-i countenance , “[0-i] [I]0-i have been just telling [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire of [[our]1345-they poor friend]1346-our poor friend [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester , and [her]77-mrs forrester terror of ghosts . It comes from living so much alone , and listening to the bug - a - boo stories of [that Jenny of [hers]77-mrs forrester]1347-that jenny of hers . ” [She]0-i was so calm and so much above superstitious fears [herself]0-i that [I]1347-that jenny of hers was almost ashamed to say how glad [I]1347-that jenny of hers had been of [her]0-i [Headingley Causeway]51-headingley causeway proposition the night before , and turned off the conversation to something else . In the afternoon [Miss Pole]89-miss pole called on [Miss Matty]98-miss matty to tell [her]98-miss matty of the adventure — the real adventure [they]1345-they had met with on [their]1345-they morning ’s walk . [They]1345-they had been perplexed about the exact path which [they]1345-they were to take across [the fields]787-the fields in order to find [the knitting old woman]3085-the knitting old woman , and had stopped to inquire at [a little wayside public - house]3086-a little wayside public - house , standing on [the high road to [London]4-london]3087-the high road to london , about three miles from [Cranford]1-cranford . [The good woman]3088-the good woman had asked [them]1345-they to sit down and rest [themselves]1345-they while [she]3088-the good woman fetched [[her]3088-the good woman husband]601-her husband , who could direct [them]1345-they better than [she]3088-the good woman could ; and , while [they]1345-they were sitting in the sanded parlour , [a little girl]3090-a little girl came in . [They]1345-they thought that [she]3090-a little girl belonged to [the landlady]3091-the landlady , and began some trifling conversation with [her]3090-a little girl ; but , on [Mrs Roberts]227-mrs roberts ’s return , [she]3088-the good woman told [them]1345-they that [the little thing]3092-the little thing was [the only child of [a couple who were staying in [the house]2059-the house]3094-a couple who were staying in the house]3093-the only child of a couple who were staying in the house . And then [she]3088-the good woman began a long story , out of which [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire and [Miss Pole]89-miss pole could only gather one or two decided facts , which were that , about six weeks ago , a light spring - cart had broken down just before [their]1345-they door , in which there were [two men]3096-two men , [one woman]2983-one woman , and [this child]3098-this child . [One of [the men]3074-the men]3078-one of the men was seriously hurt — no bones broken , only “[1347-that jenny of hers] shaken , ” [the landlady]3091-the landlady called it ; but [he]3078-one of the men had probably sustained some severe internal injury , for [he]3078-one of the men had languished in [[their]1345-they house]3102-their house ever since , attended by [[his]3078-one of the men wife]593-his wife , [the mother of [this little girl]3105-this little girl]3104-the mother of this little girl . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had asked what [he]3078-one of the men was , what [he]3078-one of the men looked like . And [Mrs Roberts]227-mrs roberts had made answer that [he]3078-one of the men was not like [a gentleman]321-a gentleman , nor yet like [a common person]1150-a common person ; if it had not been that [he]3078-one of the men and [[his]3078-one of the men wife]593-his wife were [such decent , quiet people]3109-such decent , quiet people , [she]227-mrs roberts could almost have thought [he]3078-one of the men was [a mountebank]3110-a mountebank , or something of that kind , for [they]1345-they had a great box in [the cart]3111-the cart , full of [she]227-mrs roberts did not know what . [She]227-mrs roberts had helped to unpack it , and take out [their]1345-they linen and clothes , when [the other man]3112-the other man — [[his]3078-one of the men twin - brother]3113-his twin - brother , [she]227-mrs roberts believed [he]3112-the other man was — had gone off with the horse and [cart]3114-cart . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had begun to have [her]89-miss pole suspicions at this point , and expressed [her]89-miss pole idea that it was rather strange that the box and cart and horse and all should have disappeared ; but [good Mrs Roberts]227-mrs roberts seemed to have become quite indignant at [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s implied suggestion ; in fact , [Miss Pole]89-miss pole said [she]89-miss pole was as angry as if [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had told [her]227-mrs roberts that [she]89-miss pole [herself]89-miss pole was [a swindler]3115-a swindler . As the best way of convincing [the ladies]417-the ladies , [she]227-mrs roberts bethought [her]227-mrs roberts of begging [them]417-the ladies to see [the wife]3117-the wife ; and , as [Miss Pole]89-miss pole said , there was no doubting the honest , worn , bronzed face of [the woman]974-the woman , who at the first tender word from [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire , burst into tears , which [she]974-the woman was too weak to check until some word from [the landlady]3091-the landlady made [her]974-the woman swallow down [her]974-the woman sobs , in order that [she]974-the woman might testify to the Christian kindness shown by [Mr]3120-mr and [Mrs Roberts]227-mrs roberts . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole came round with a swing to as vehement a belief in the sorrowful tale as [she]89-miss pole had been sceptical before ; and , as a proof of this , [her]89-miss pole energy in [the poor sufferer]3121-the poor sufferer ’s behalf was nothing daunted when [she]89-miss pole found out that [he]3121-the poor sufferer , and [no other]3122-no other , was [[our]3123-we Signor [Brunoni]96-signor brunoni , to whom all [Cranford]96-signor brunoni had been attributing all manner of evil this six weeks past]96-signor brunoni ! Yes ! [[his]3121-the poor sufferer wife]593-his wife said [his]3121-the poor sufferer proper name was [Samuel Brown—“Sam]228-samuel brown—“sam[1347-that jenny of hers] , ” [she]593-his wife called [him]3121-the poor sufferer — but to the last [we]3123-we preferred calling [him]3121-the poor sufferer “[3125-the signor ”] [the Signor ”]3125-the signor ” ; it sounded so much better . The end of [their]3123-we conversation with [the Signora Brunoni]229-the signora brunoni was that it was agreed that [he]3121-the poor sufferer should be placed under medical advice , and for any expense incurred in procuring [this Lady Glenmire]3126-this lady glenmire promised to hold [herself]593-his wife responsible , and had accordingly gone to [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins to beg [him]105-mr hoggins to ride over to [the “[3125-the signor ”] Rising Sun ”]3127-the “ rising sun ” that very afternoon , and examine into [the signor]3128-the signor ’s real state ; and , as [Miss Pole]89-miss pole said , if it was desirable to remove [him]3121-the poor sufferer to [Cranford]1-cranford to be more immediately under [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ’s eye , [she]593-his wife would undertake to see for lodgings and arrange about the rent . [Mrs Roberts]227-mrs roberts had been as kind as could be all throughout , but it was evident that [their]3123-we long residence there had been a slight inconvenience . Before [Miss Pole]89-miss pole left [us]3123-we , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [I]230-jack were as full of the morning ’s adventure as [she]89-miss pole was . [We]3123-we talked about it all the evening , turning it in every possible light , and [we]3123-we went to bed anxious for the morning , when [we]3123-we should surely hear from [someone]3129-someone what [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins thought and recommended ; for , as [Miss Matty]98-miss matty observed , though [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins did say “[230-jack] [Jack]230-jack ’s up , ” “[230-jack] a fig for [his]1348-his heels , ” and called [Preference]40-preference “[230-jack] Pref . ” [she]593-his wife believed [he]105-mr hoggins was [a very worthy man]3130-a very worthy man and [a very clever surgeon]3131-a very clever surgeon . Indeed , [we]3123-we were rather proud of [[our]3123-we doctor]3132-our doctor at [Cranford]1-cranford , as [a doctor]3133-a doctor . [We]3123-we often wished , when [we]3123-we heard of [Queen Adelaide]164-queen adelaide or [the Duke of [Wellington]53-wellington]3134-the duke of wellington being ill , that [they]3135-they would send for [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ; but , on consideration , [we]3123-we were rather glad [they]3135-they did not , for , if [we]3123-we were ailing , what should [we]3123-we do if [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins had been appointed [physician - in - ordinary to [the Royal Family]3137-the royal family]3136-physician - in - ordinary to the royal family ? As [a surgeon]292-a surgeon [we]3123-we were proud of [him]105-mr hoggins ; but as [a man]2058-a man — or rather , [I]230-jack should say , as [a gentleman]321-a gentleman — [we]3123-we could only shake [our]3123-we heads over [his]105-mr hoggins name and [himself]105-mr hoggins , and wished that [he]105-mr hoggins had read [Lord Chesterfield]232-lord chesterfield ’s Letters in the days when [his]105-mr hoggins manners were susceptible of improvement . Nevertheless , [we]3123-we all regarded [his]105-mr hoggins dictum in [the signor]3128-the signor ’s case as infallible , and when [he]105-mr hoggins said that with care and attention [he]105-mr hoggins might rally , [we]3123-we had no more fear for [him]105-mr hoggins . But , although [we]3123-we had no more fear , [everybody]296-everybody did as much as if there was great cause for anxiety — as indeed there was until [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins took charge of [him]105-mr hoggins . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole looked out clean and comfortable , if [homely , lodgings]3143-homely , lodgings ; [Miss Matty]98-miss matty sent the sedan - chair for [him]105-mr hoggins , and [Martha]98-miss matty and [I]230-jack aired it well before it left [Cranford]1-cranford by holding a warming - pan full of red - hot coals in it , and then shutting it up close , smoke and all , until the time when [he]105-mr hoggins should get into it at the “[230-jack] Rising Sun . ” [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire undertook [the medical department under [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ’s directions]3144-the medical department under mr hoggins ’s directions , and rummaged up all [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s medicine glasses , and spoons , and bed - tables , in a free - and - easy way , that made [Miss Matty]98-miss matty feel a little anxious as to what [that lady]603-that lady and [Mr Mulliner]193-mr mulliner might say , if [they]3146-they knew . [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester made some of the bread - jelly , for which [she]77-mrs forrester was so famous , to have ready as a refreshment in [the lodgings]3147-the lodgings when [he]105-mr hoggins should arrive . A present of this bread - jelly was the highest mark of favour dear [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester could confer . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had once asked [her]77-mrs forrester for the receipt , but [she]77-mrs forrester had met with a very decided rebuff ; [that lady]603-that lady told [her]77-mrs forrester that [she]603-that lady could not part with it to any one during [her]603-that lady life , and that after [her]603-that lady death it was bequeathed , as [[her]603-that lady executors]3149-her executors would find , to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty . What [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , or , as [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester called [her]98-miss matty ( remembering the clause in [her]98-miss matty will and the dignity of the occasion ) , [Miss Matilda Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns — might choose to do with the receipt when it came into [her]98-miss matty possession — whether to make it public , or to hand it down as an heirloom — [she]98-miss matty did not know , nor would [she]98-miss matty dictate . And a mould of this admirable , digestible , unique bread - jelly was sent by [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester to [[our]3150-our poor sick conjuror]3151-our poor sick conjuror . Who says that [the aristocracy]3152-the aristocracy are proud ? Here was [a lady by birth [a Tyrrell]1105-a tyrrell , and descended from the great Sir Walter that shot [King Rufus]233-king rufus , and in whose veins ran the blood of [him]3155-him who murdered [the little princes in [the Tower]3157-the tower]3156-the little princes in the tower , going every day to see what dainty dishes [she]98-miss matty could prepare for [Samuel Brown]234-sam , a mountebank]3153-a lady by birth a tyrrell , and descended from the great sir walter that shot king rufus , and in whose veins ran the blood of him who murdered the little princes in the tower , going every day to see what dainty dishes she could prepare for samuel brown , a mountebank ! But , indeed , it was wonderful to see what kind feelings were called out by [this poor man]3158-this poor man ’s coming amongst [us]3150-our . And also wonderful to see how [the great Cranford panic]3159-the great cranford panic , which had been occasioned by [his]3158-this poor man first coming in [his]3158-this poor man Turkish dress , melted away into thin air on [his]3158-this poor man second coming — pale and feeble , and with [his]3158-this poor man heavy , filmy eyes , that only brightened a very little when [they]3160-they fell upon the countenance of [[his]3158-this poor man faithful wife]3161-his faithful wife , or [[their]3160-they pale and sorrowful little girl]3162-their pale and sorrowful little girl . Somehow [we]3150-our all forgot to be afraid . [I]230-jack daresay it was that finding out that [he]3158-this poor man , who had first excited [our]3150-our love of the marvellous by [his]3158-this poor man unprecedented arts , had not sufficient every - day gifts to manage a shying horse , made [us]3150-our feel as if [we]3150-our were [ourselves]3150-our again . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole came with [her]89-miss pole little basket at all hours of the evening , as if [[her]89-miss pole lonely house]3163-her lonely house and [the unfrequented road to [it]3163-her lonely house]3164-the unfrequented road to it had never been infested by that “[230-jack] murderous gang ” ; [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester said [she]77-mrs forrester thought that neither [Jenny]104-jenny nor [she]77-mrs forrester need mind [the headless lady who wept and wailed in]3165-the headless lady who wept and wailed in [Darkness Lane]50-darkness lane , for surely the power was never given to [such beings]3166-such beings to harm [those who went about to try to do what little good was in [their]3167-those who went about to try to do what little good was in their power power]3167-those who went about to try to do what little good was in their power , to which [Jenny]104-jenny tremblingly assented ; but [the mistress]1317-the mistress ’s theory had little effect on [the maid]3169-the maid ’s practice until [she]1317-the mistress had sewn two pieces of red flannel in the shape of a cross on [her]1317-the mistress inner garment . [I]0-i found [Miss Matty]98-miss matty covering [her]98-miss matty penny ball — the ball that [she]98-miss matty used to roll under [her]98-miss matty bed — with gay - coloured worsted in rainbow stripes . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]2063-my dear , ” said [she]0-i , “[2063-my dear] [my]0-i heart is sad for [that little careworn child]1350-that little careworn child . Although [[her]1350-that little careworn child father]397-her father is [a conjuror]1302-a conjuror , [she]1350-that little careworn child looks as if [she]1350-that little careworn child had never had a good game of play in [her]1350-that little careworn child life . [I]0-i used to make very pretty balls in this way when [I]0-i was [a girl]2174-a girl , and [I]0-i thought [I]0-i would try if [I]0-i could not make this one smart and take it to [Phœbe]235-phœbe this afternoon . [I]0-i think ‘ [the gang]1354-the gang ’ must have left [the neighbourhood]2511-the neighbourhood , for [one]2460-one does not hear any more of [their]1354-the gang violence and robbery now . ” [We]3170-we were all of [us]3170-we far too full of [the signor]3128-the signor ’s precarious state to talk either about [robbers or ghosts]3172-robbers or ghosts . Indeed , [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire said [she]182-lady glenmire never had heard of any actual robberies , except that [two little boys]2816-two little boys had stolen some apples from [[Farmer Benson]236-farmer benson ’s orchard]3174-farmer benson ’s orchard , and that some eggs had been missed on a market - day off [[Widow Hayward]237-widow hayward ’s stall]3175-widow hayward ’s stall . But that was expecting too much of [us]3170-we ; [we]3170-we could not acknowledge that [we]3170-we had only had this small foundation for all [our]3170-we panic . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole drew [herself]89-miss pole up at this remark of [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire ’s , and said “[1357-she] that [she]1357-she wished [she]1357-she could agree with [her]1357-she as to the very small reason [we]1358-we had had for alarm , but with the recollection of [a man disguised as a woman who had endeavoured to force [himself]1359-a man disguised as a woman who had endeavoured to force himself into her house while his confederates waited outside into [[her]1357-she house]600-her house while [[his]1359-a man disguised as a woman who had endeavoured to force himself into her house while his confederates waited outside confederates]1361-his confederates waited outside]1359-a man disguised as a woman who had endeavoured to force himself into her house while his confederates waited outside ; with the knowledge gained from [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire [herself]182-lady glenmire , of the footprints seen on [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s flower borders ; with the fact before [her]182-lady glenmire of the audacious robbery committed on [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins at [his]105-mr hoggins own door”—But here [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire broke in with a very strong expression of doubt as to whether this last story was not an entire fabrication founded upon the theft of a cat ; [she]182-lady glenmire grew so red while [she]182-lady glenmire was saying all this that [I]1362-her ladyship was not surprised at [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s manner of bridling up , and [I]1362-her ladyship am certain , if [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire had not been “[1362-her ladyship] [[her]182-lady glenmire ladyship]1362-her ladyship , ” [we]3176-we should have had a more emphatic contradiction than the “[1362-her ladyship] Well , to be sure ! ” and similar fragmentary ejaculations , which were all that [she]182-lady glenmire ventured upon in [[my]1362-her ladyship lady]1151-my lady ’s presence . But when [she]182-lady glenmire was gone [Miss Pole]89-miss pole began a long congratulation to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty that so far [they]3178-they had escaped marriage , which [she]89-miss pole noticed always made [people]359-people credulous to the last degree ; indeed , [she]89-miss pole thought it argued great natural credulity in [a woman]3180-a woman if [she]3180-a woman could not keep [herself]3180-a woman from being married ; and in what [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire had said about [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ’s robbery [we]3176-we had a specimen of what [people]359-people came to if [they]359-people gave way to such a weakness ; evidently [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire would swallow anything if [she]182-lady glenmire could believe the poor vamped - up story about a neck of mutton and a pussy with which [he]105-mr hoggins had tried to impose on [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , only [she]182-lady glenmire had always been on [her]182-lady glenmire guard against believing too much of what [men]491-men said . [We]3176-we were thankful , as [Miss Pole]89-miss pole desired [us]3176-we to be , that [we]3176-we had never been married ; but [I]1362-her ladyship think , of [the two]2648-the two , [we]3176-we were even more thankful that [the robbers]2888-the robbers had left [Cranford]1-cranford ; at least [I]1362-her ladyship judge so from a speech of [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s that evening , as [we]3176-we sat over the fire , in which [she]182-lady glenmire evidently looked upon [a husband]3185-a husband as a great protector against [thieves]3186-thieves , [burglars]3187-burglars , and ghosts ; and said that [she]182-lady glenmire did not think that [she]182-lady glenmire should dare to be always warning [young people]2615-young people against matrimony , as [Miss Pole]89-miss pole did continually ; to be sure , marriage was a risk , as [she]182-lady glenmire saw , now [she]182-lady glenmire had had some experience ; but [she]182-lady glenmire remembered the time when [she]182-lady glenmire had looked forward to being married as much as [any one]2107-any one . “[1362-her ladyship] Not to [any particular person]1363-any particular person , [[my]0-i dear]2063-my dear , ” said [she]182-lady glenmire , hastily checking [herself]182-lady glenmire up , as if [she]182-lady glenmire were afraid of having admitted too much ; “[619-gentlemen] only the old story , [you]2063-my dear know , of [ladies]2218-ladies always saying , ‘ _ When _ [I]0-i marry , ’ and [gentlemen]619-gentlemen , ‘ _ If _ [I]0-i marry . ’ ” It was a joke spoken in rather a sad tone , and [I]619-gentlemen doubt if [either of [us]3191-us]3190-either of us smiled ; but [I]619-gentlemen could not see [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s face by the flickering fire - light . In a little while [she]0-i continued — “[619-gentlemen] But , after all , [I]0-i have not told [you]2063-my dear the truth . It is so long ago , and [no one]477-no one ever knew how much [I]0-i thought of it at the time , unless , indeed , [[my]0-i dear mother]1368-my dear mother guessed ; but [I]0-i may say that there was a time when [I]0-i did not think [I]0-i should have been only [Miss Matty Jenkyns]98-miss matty all [my]0-i life ; for even if [I]0-i did meet with [any one who wished to marry [me]0-i now ( and , as [Miss Pole]89-miss pole says , one is never too safe]1369-any one who wished to marry me now ( and , as miss pole says , one is never too safe ) , [I]0-i could not take [him]1369-any one who wished to marry me now ( and , as miss pole says , one is never too safe — [I]0-i hope [he]1369-any one who wished to marry me now ( and , as miss pole says , one is never too safe would not take it too much to heart , but [I]0-i could _ not _ take [him]1369-any one who wished to marry me now ( and , as miss pole says , one is never too safe — or any one but [the person [I]0-i once thought [I]0-i should be married to]1370-the person i once thought i should be married to ; and [he]1369-any one who wished to marry me now ( and , as miss pole says , one is never too safe is dead and gone , and [he]1369-any one who wished to marry me now ( and , as miss pole says , one is never too safe never knew how it all came about that [I]0-i said ‘ No , ’ when [I]0-i had thought many and many a time — Well , it ’s no matter what [I]0-i thought . [God]103-god ordains it all , and [I]0-i am very happy , [[my]0-i dear]2063-my dear . [No one]477-no one has such kind friends as [I]0-i , ” continued [she]0-i , taking [my]0-i hand and holding it in [hers]0-i . If [I]0-i had never known of [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook , [I]0-i could have said something in this pause , but as [I]0-i had , [I]0-i could not think of anything that would come in naturally , and so [we]1374-we both kept silence for a little time . “[0-i] [[My]0-i father]2082-my father once made [us]1374-we , ” [she]0-i began , “[2082-my father] keep a diary , in two columns ; on one side [we]1374-we were to put down in the morning what [we]1374-we thought would be the course and events of the coming day , and at night [we]1374-we were to put down on the other side what really had happened . It would be to [some people]2160-some people rather a sad way of telling [their]2160-some people lives , ” ( a tear dropped upon [my]1376-my hand at these words)—“I[1376-my] do n’t mean that [mine]1376-my has been sad , only so very different to what [I]0-i expected . [I]0-i remember , one winter ’s evening , sitting over [our]1374-we bedroom fire with [Deborah]99-deborah — [I]0-i remember it as if it were yesterday — and [we]1374-we were planning [our]1374-we future lives , [both of [us]1374-we]1377-both of us were planning , though only [she]99-deborah talked about it . [She]99-deborah said [she]99-deborah should like to marry [an archdeacon]1378-an archdeacon , and write [his]1378-an archdeacon charges ; and [you]1379-you know , [[my]0-i dear]2063-my dear , [she]99-deborah never was married , and , for aught [I]0-i know , [she]99-deborah never spoke to [an unmarried archdeacon]1381-an unmarried archdeacon in [her]99-deborah life . [I]0-i never was ambitious , nor could [I]0-i have written charges , but [I]0-i thought [I]0-i could manage [a house]2155-a house ( [[my]0-i mother]2400-my mother used to call [me]0-i [her]2400-my mother right hand ) , and [I]0-i was always so fond of [little children]1384-little children — [the shyest babies]1385-the shyest babies would stretch out [their]1385-the shyest babies little arms to come to [me]0-i ; when [I]0-i was [a girl]2174-a girl , [I]0-i was half [my]0-i leisure time nursing in [the neighbouring cottages]3040-the neighbouring cottages ; but [I]0-i do n’t know how it was , when [I]0-i grew sad and grave — which [I]0-i did a year or two after this time — the little things drew back from [me]0-i , and [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i lost the knack , though [I]0-i am just as fond of [children]1116-children as ever , and have a strange yearning at [my]0-i heart whenever [I]0-i see [a mother]1389-a mother with [[her]1389-a mother baby]874-her baby in [her]1389-a mother arms . Nay , [[my]0-i dear]2063-my dear ” ( and by a sudden blaze which sprang up from a fall of the unstirred coals , [I]2063-my dear saw that [her]1392-a little child — always the same eyes were full of tears — gazing intently on some vision of what might have been ) , “[2063-my dear] do [you]2063-my dear know [I]0-i dream sometimes that [I]0-i have [a little child — always the same]1392-a little child — always the same — [a little girl of about two years old]1393-a little girl of about two years old ; [she]1392-a little child — always the same never grows older , though [I]0-i have dreamt about [her]1392-a little child — always the same for many years . [I]0-i do n’t think [I]0-i ever dream of any words or sound [she]1392-a little child — always the same makes ; [she]1392-a little child — always the same is very noiseless and still , but [she]1392-a little child — always the same comes to [me]0-i when [she]1392-a little child — always the same is very sorry or very glad , and [I]0-i have wakened with the clasp of [her]1392-a little child — always the same dear little arms round [my]0-i neck . Only last night — perhaps because [I]0-i had gone to sleep thinking of this ball for [Phœbe]235-phœbe — [[my]0-i little darling]1394-my little darling came in [my]0-i dream , and put up [her]1392-a little child — always the same mouth to be kissed , just as [I]0-i have seen [real babies]1395-real babies do to [real mothers]1396-real mothers before going to bed . But all this is nonsense , [dear]2179-dear ! only do n’t be frightened by [Miss Pole]89-miss pole from being married . [I]0-i can fancy it may be a very happy state , and a little credulity helps [one]2460-one on through life very smoothly — better than always doubting and doubting and seeing difficulties and disagreeables in everything . ” [ Picture : Would stretch out [their]3192-their little arms ] If [I]359-people had been inclined to be daunted from matrimony , it would not have been [Miss Pole]89-miss pole to do it ; it would have been the lot of [poor Signor Brunoni]96-signor brunoni and [[his]96-signor brunoni wife]593-his wife .
