And yet again , it was an encouragement to see how , through all [their]3192-their cares and sorrows , [they]3192-their thought of [each other]302-each other and not of [themselves]3192-their ; and how keen were [their]3192-their joys , if [they]3192-their only passed through [each other]302-each other , or through the little Phœbe . [The signora]3196-the signora told [me]359-people , one day , a good deal about [their]3192-their lives up to this period . It began by [my]359-people asking [her]3196-the signora whether [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s story of [the twin - brothers]3197-the twin - brothers were true ; it sounded so wonderful a likeness , that [I]359-people should have had [my]359-people doubts , if [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had not been unmarried . But [the signora]3196-the signora , or ( as [we]3199-we found out [she]3196-the signora preferred to be called ) [Mrs Brown]238-mrs brown , said it was quite true ; that [[her]238-mrs brown brother - in - law]3200-her brother - in - law was by many taken for [[her]238-mrs brown husband]601-her husband , which was of great assistance to [them]3197-the twin - brothers in [their]3197-the twin - brothers profession ; “[359-people] though , ” [she]0-i continued , “[359-people] how [people]359-people can mistake [Thomas]119-mr holbrook for [the real Signor Brunoni]96-signor brunoni , [I]0-i ca n’t conceive ; but [he]119-mr holbrook says [they]359-people do ; so [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i must believe [him]119-mr holbrook . Not but what [he]119-mr holbrook is [a very good man]1400-a very good man ; [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i do n’t know how [we]1401-we should have paid [our]1401-we bill at the ‘ Rising Sun ’ but for the money [he]119-mr holbrook sends ; but [people]359-people must know very little about art if [they]359-people can take [him]119-mr holbrook for [[my]0-i husband]2319-my husband . Why , [Miss]1404-miss , in the ball trick , where [[my]0-i husband]2319-my husband spreads [his]2319-my husband fingers wide , and throws out [his]2319-my husband little finger with quite an air and a grace , [Thomas]119-mr holbrook just clumps up [his]119-mr holbrook hand like a fist , and might have ever so many balls hidden in it . Besides , [he]119-mr holbrook has never been in [India]15-india , and knows nothing of the proper sit of a turban . ” “[0-i] Have [you]0-i been in [India]15-india ? ” said [I]0-i , rather astonished . “[0-i] Oh , yes ! many a year , [ma’am]2067-ma’am . [Sam]234-sam was [a sergeant in the 31st]1407-a sergeant in the 31st ; and when [the regiment]1408-the regiment was ordered to [India]15-india , [I]0-i drew a lot to go , and [I]0-i was more thankful than [I]0-i can tell ; for it seemed as if it would only be a slow death to [me]0-i to part from [[my]0-i husband]2319-my husband . But , indeed , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , if [I]0-i had known all , [I]0-i do n’t know whether [I]0-i would not rather have died there and then than gone through what [I]0-i have done since . To be sure , [I]0-i ’ve been able to comfort [Sam]234-sam , and to be with [him]234-sam ; but , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , [I]0-i ’ve lost [six children]1412-six children , ” said [she]0-i , looking up at [me]0-i with those strange eyes that [I]0-i ’ve never noticed but in [mothers of dead children]3202-mothers of dead children — with a kind of wild look in [them]3202-mothers of dead children , as if seeking for what [they]3202-mothers of dead children never more might find . “[0-i] Yes ! [Six children]1412-six children died off , like little buds nipped untimely , in [that cruel India]1414-that cruel india . [I]0-i thought , as [each died]1415-each died , [I]0-i never could — [I]0-i never would — love [a child]2069-a child again ; and when the next came , it had not only [its]2069-a child own love , but the deeper love that came from the thoughts of [[its]2069-a child little dead brothers]1417-its little dead brothers and [sisters]308-sisters . And when [Phœbe]235-phœbe was coming , [I]0-i said to [[my]0-i husband]2319-my husband , ‘ [Sam]234-sam , when [the child]2130-the child is born , and [I]0-i am strong , [I]0-i shall leave [you]234-sam ; it will cut [my]0-i heart cruel ; but if [this baby]1421-this baby dies too , [I]0-i shall go mad ; the madness is in [me]0-i now ; but if [you]234-sam let [me]0-i go down to [Calcutta]54-calcutta , carrying [[my]0-i baby]1422-my baby step by step , it will , maybe , work itself off ; and [I]0-i will save , and [I]0-i will hoard , and [I]0-i will beg — and [I]0-i will die , to get a passage home to [England]3-england , where [[our]1423-our baby]1424-our baby may live ? ’ [God]103-god bless [him]1421-this baby ! [he]1421-this baby said [I]0-i might go ; and [he]1421-this baby saved up [his]1421-this baby pay , and [I]0-i saved every pice [I]0-i could get for washing or any way ; and when [Phœbe]235-phœbe came , and [I]0-i grew strong again , [I]0-i set off . It was very lonely ; through [the thick forests]1425-the thick forests , dark again with their heavy trees — along by [the river]1426-the river ’s side ( but [I]0-i had been brought up near [the Avon]55-the avon in [Warwickshire]56-warwickshire , so that flowing noise sounded like [home)—from station]1427-home)—from station to [station]1428-station , from [Indian village]1429-indian village to [village]1430-village , [I]0-i went along , carrying [[my]0-i child]1431-my child . [I]0-i had seen [one of [[the officer]1433-the officer ’s ladies]1434-the officer ’s ladies]1432-one of the officer ’s ladies with a little picture , [ma’am]2067-ma’am — done by [a Catholic foreigner]1436-a catholic foreigner , [ma’am]2067-ma’am — of [the Virgin]1438-the virgin and [the little Saviour]1439-the little saviour , [ma’am]2067-ma’am . [She]1432-one of the officer ’s ladies had [him]1431-my child on [her]1432-one of the officer ’s ladies arm , and [her]1432-one of the officer ’s ladies form was softly curled round [him]1431-my child , and [their]1441-their cheeks touched . Well , when [I]0-i went to bid good - bye to [this lady]1171-this lady , for whom [I]0-i had washed , [she]1171-this lady cried sadly ; for [she]1171-this lady , too , had lost [[her]1171-this lady children]964-her children , but [she]1171-this lady had not another to save , like [me]0-i ; and [I]0-i was bold enough to ask [her]1171-this lady would [she]1171-this lady give [me]0-i that print . And [she]1171-this lady cried the more , and said [[her]1171-this lady children]964-her children were with [that little blessed Jesus]1445-that little blessed jesus ; and gave it [me]0-i , and told [me]0-i that [she]1171-this lady had heard it had been painted on the bottom of a cask , which made it have that round shape . And when [my]0-i body was very weary , and [my]0-i heart was sick ( for there were times when [I]0-i misdoubted if [I]0-i could ever reach [[my]0-i home]1446-my home , and there were times when [I]0-i thought of [[my]0-i husband]2319-my husband , and one time when [I]0-i thought [[my]0-i baby]1422-my baby was dying ) , [I]0-i took out that picture and looked at it , till [I]0-i could have thought [the mother]898-the mother spoke to [me]0-i , and comforted [me]0-i . And [the natives]1450-the natives were very kind . [We]1451-we could not understand [one another]1452-one another ; but [they]1450-the natives saw [[my]0-i baby]1422-my baby on [my]0-i breast , and [they]1450-the natives came out to [me]0-i , and brought [me]0-i rice and milk , and sometimes flowers — [I]0-i have got some of the flowers dried . Then , the next morning , [I]0-i was so tired ; and [they]1450-the natives wanted [me]0-i to stay with [them]1450-the natives — [I]0-i could tell that — and tried to frighten [me]0-i from going into [the deep woods]1454-the deep woods , which , indeed , looked very strange and dark ; but it seemed to [me]0-i as if [Death]239-death was following [me]0-i to take [[my]0-i baby]1422-my baby away from [me]0-i ; and as if [I]0-i must go on , and on — and [I]0-i thought how [God]103-god had cared for [mothers]866-mothers ever since [the world]333-the world was made , and would care for [me]0-i ; so [I]0-i bade [them]866-mothers good - bye , and set off afresh . And once when [[my]0-i baby]1422-my baby was ill , and both [she]1422-my baby and [I]0-i needed rest , [He]103-god led [me]0-i to a place where [I]0-i found [a kind Englishman]1459-a kind englishman lived , right in [the midst of [the natives]1450-the natives]1460-the midst of the natives . ” “[1459-a kind englishman] And [you]0-i reached [Calcutta]54-calcutta safely at last ? ” “[0-i] Yes , safely ! Oh ! when [I]0-i knew [I]0-i had only two days ’ journey more before [me]0-i , [I]0-i could not help it , [ma’am]2067-ma’am — it might be idolatry , [I]0-i can not tell — but [I]0-i was near [one of [the native temples]1464-the native temples]1463-one of the native temples , and [I]0-i went into [it]1463-one of the native temples with [[my]0-i baby]1422-my baby to thank [God]103-god for [His]103-god great mercy ; for it seemed to [me]0-i that where [others]838-others had prayed before to [[their]838-others God]1467-their god , in [their]838-others joy or in [their]838-others agony , was of [itself]1463-one of the native temples [a sacred place]1468-a sacred place . And [I]0-i got as servant to [an invalid lady]1469-an invalid lady , who grew quite fond of [[my]0-i baby]1422-my baby aboard - [ship]1471-ship ; and , in two years ’ time , [Sam]234-sam earned [his]234-sam discharge , and came [home]306-home to [me]0-i , and to [[our]1473-our child]1474-our child . Then [he]234-sam had to fix on a trade ; but [he]234-sam knew of none ; and once , once upon a time , [he]234-sam had learnt some tricks from [an Indian juggler]1475-an indian juggler ; so [he]234-sam set up conjuring , and it answered so well that [he]234-sam took [Thomas]119-mr holbrook to help [him]234-sam — as [[his]234-sam man]1476-his man , [you]1477-you know , not as [another conjuror]1478-another conjuror , though [Thomas]119-mr holbrook has set it up now on [his]119-mr holbrook own hook . But it has been a great help to [us]1473-our that likeness between [the twins]1479-the twins , and made a good many tricks go off well that [they]1479-the twins made up together . And [Thomas]119-mr holbrook is [a good brother]1480-a good brother , only [he]119-mr holbrook has not the fine carriage of [[my]0-i husband]2319-my husband , so that [I]0-i ca n’t think how [he]119-mr holbrook can be taken for [Signor Brunoni]96-signor brunoni [himself]96-signor brunoni , as [he]96-signor brunoni says [he]119-mr holbrook is . ” “[96-signor brunoni] [Poor little Phœbe]235-phœbe ! ” said [I]235-phœbe , [my]235-phœbe thoughts going back to the baby [she]235-phœbe carried all those hundred miles . “[235-phœbe] Ah ! [you]1482-you may say so ! [I]0-i never thought [I]0-i should have reared [her]235-phœbe , though , when [she]235-phœbe fell ill at [Chunderabaddad]57-chunderabaddad ; but that good , kind [Aga Jenkyns]240-the aga jenkyns took [us]1483-us in , which [I]0-i believe was the very saving of [her]235-phœbe . ” “[240-the aga jenkyns] [Jenkyns]240-the aga jenkyns ! ” said [I.]235-phœbe “[240-the aga jenkyns] Yes , [Jenkyns]240-the aga jenkyns . [I]0-i shall think [all people of that name]1484-all people of that name are kind ; for here is [that nice old lady who comes every day to take [Phœbe]235-phœbe]1485-that nice old lady who comes every day to take phœbe a walk ! ” But an idea had flashed through [my]121-peter head ; could [the Aga Jenkyns]240-the aga jenkyns be [the lost Peter]121-peter ? True [he]121-peter was reported by [many]3203-many to be dead . But , equally true , [some]3204-some had said that [he]121-peter had arrived at the dignity of [Great Lama of Thibet]241-great lama of thibet . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty thought [he]121-peter was alive . [I]121-peter would make further inquiry . CHAPTER XII . [ENGAGED TO BE MARRIED]242-engaged to be married WAS the “[121-peter] poor [Peter]121-peter ” of [Cranford]1-cranford [the Aga Jenkyns of]3205-the aga jenkyns of [Chunderabaddad]57-chunderabaddad , or was [he]121-peter not ? As [somebody]3206-somebody says , that was the question . In [[my]121-peter own home]3207-my own home , whenever [people]359-people had nothing else to do , [they]359-people blamed [me]121-peter for want of discretion . Indiscretion was [my]121-peter bug - bear fault . [Everybody]296-everybody has a bug - bear fault , a sort of standing characteristic — a _ pièce de résistance _ for [[their]296-everybody friends]3210-their friends to cut at ; and in general [they]296-everybody cut and come again . [I]121-peter was tired of being called indiscreet and incautious ; and [I]121-peter determined for once to prove [myself]121-peter a model of prudence and wisdom . [I]121-peter would not even hint [my]121-peter suspicions respecting [the Aga]240-the aga jenkyns . [I]121-peter would collect evidence and carry it [home]306-home to lay before [[my]121-peter father]2082-my father , as [the family friend of [the two Miss Jenkynses]134-the miss jenkynses]3213-the family friend of the two miss jenkynses . In [my]121-peter search after facts , [I]121-peter was often reminded of a description [[my]121-peter father]2082-my father had once given of [a ladies ’ committee that [he]2082-my father had had to preside over]3215-a ladies ’ committee that he had had to preside over . [He]2082-my father said [he]2082-my father could not help thinking of a passage in [Dickens]243-dickens , which spoke of a chorus in which [every man]291-every man took the tune [he]291-every man knew best , and sang it to [his]291-every man own satisfaction . So , at this charitable committee , [every lady]3217-every lady took the subject uppermost in [her]3217-every lady mind , and talked about it to [her]3217-every lady own great contentment , but not much to the advancement of the subject [they]3215-a ladies ’ committee that he had had to preside over had met to discuss . But even that committee could have been nothing to [the Cranford ladies]305-the cranford ladies when [I]121-peter attempted to gain some clear and definite information as to poor [Peter]121-peter ’s height , appearance , and when and where [he]121-peter was seen and heard of last . For instance , [I]121-peter remember asking [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ( and [I]121-peter thought the question was very opportune , for [I]121-peter put it when [I]121-peter met [her]89-miss pole at a call at [[Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester ’s]3219-mrs forrester ’s , and both [the ladies]417-the ladies had known [Peter]121-peter , and [I]121-peter imagined that [they]417-the ladies might refresh [each other]302-each other ’s memories)—I asked [Miss Pole]89-miss pole what was the very last thing [they]417-the ladies had ever heard about [him]121-peter ; and then [she]89-miss pole named the absurd report to which [I]121-peter have alluded , about [his]121-peter having been elected [Great Lama of Thibet]241-great lama of thibet ; and this was a signal for [each lady]3222-each lady to go off on [her]3222-each lady separate idea . [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester ’s start was made on [the veiled prophet in [Lalla Rookh]58-lalla rookh]3223-the veiled prophet in lalla rookh — whether [I]121-peter thought [he]121-peter was meant for [the Great Lama]241-great lama of thibet , though [Peter]121-peter was not so ugly , indeed rather handsome , if [he]121-peter had not been freckled . [I]121-peter was thankful to see [her]77-mrs forrester double upon [Peter]121-peter ; but , in a moment , [the delusive lady]3224-the delusive lady was off upon [Rowland]244-rowland ’s [Kalydor]59-kalydor , and the merits of cosmetics and hair oils in general , and holding forth so fluently that [I]121-peter turned to listen to [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , who ( through [the llamas , the beasts of burden]3225-the llamas , the beasts of burden ) had got to Peruvian bonds , and the share market , and [her]89-miss pole poor opinion of [joint - stock banks]3226-joint - stock banks in general , and of that one in particular in which [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s money was invested . In vain [I]121-peter put in “[121-peter] When was it — in what year was it that [you]1486-you heard that [Mr Peter]157-mr peter was [the Great Lama]1487-the great lama ? ” [They]3227-they only joined issue to dispute whether llamas were carnivorous animals or not ; in which dispute [they]3227-they were not quite on fair grounds , as [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester ( after [they]3227-they had grown warm and cool again ) acknowledged that [she]77-mrs forrester always confused carnivorous and graminivorous together , just as [she]77-mrs forrester did horizontal and perpendicular ; but then [she]77-mrs forrester apologised for it very prettily , by saying that in [her]77-mrs forrester day the only use [people made of four - syllabled words]3228-people made of four - syllabled words was to teach how they should be spelt . The only fact [I]1487-the great lama gained from this conversation was that certainly [Peter]157-mr peter had last been heard of in [India]15-india , “[1487-the great lama] or [that neighbourhood]1488-that neighbourhood ” ; and that this scanty intelligence of [his]157-mr peter whereabouts had reached [Cranford]1-cranford in the year when [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had bought [her]89-miss pole Indian muslin gown , long since worn out ( [we]3229-we washed it and mended it , and traced its decline and fall into a window - blind before [we]3229-we could go on ) ; and in a year when [Wombwell]203-wombwell came to [Cranford]1-cranford , because [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had wanted to see an elephant in order that [she]98-miss matty might the better imagine [Peter]157-mr peter riding on one ; and had seen a boa - constrictor too , which was more than [she]98-miss matty wished to imagine in [her]98-miss matty fancy - pictures of [[Peter]157-mr peter ’s locality]3230-peter ’s locality ; and in a year when [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty had learnt some piece of poetry off by heart , and used to say , at all the [Cranford]1-cranford parties , how [Peter]157-mr peter was “[1487-the great lama] surveying [mankind]1489-mankind from [China]60-china to [Peru]61-peru , ” which [everybody]296-everybody had thought very grand , and rather appropriate , because [India]15-india was between [China]60-china and [Peru]61-peru , if [you]3232-you took care to turn the globe to the left instead of the right . [I]1487-the great lama suppose all these inquiries of [mine]1487-the great lama , and the consequent curiosity excited in the minds of [[my]1487-the great lama friends]2176-my friends , made [us]3234-we blind and deaf to what was going on around [us]3234-we . It seemed to [me]1487-the great lama as if the sun rose and shone , and as if the rain rained on [Cranford]1-cranford , just as usual , and [I]1487-the great lama did not notice any sign of the times that could be considered as a prognostic of any uncommon event ; and , to the best of [my]1487-the great lama belief , not only [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester , but even [Miss Pole]89-miss pole [herself]89-miss pole , whom [we]3234-we looked upon as [a kind of prophetess]3235-a kind of prophetess , from the knack [she]89-miss pole had of foreseeing things before they came to pass — although [she]89-miss pole did not like to disturb [[her]89-miss pole friends]453-her friends by telling [them]453-her friends [her]89-miss pole foreknowledge — even [Miss Pole]89-miss pole [herself]89-miss pole was breathless with astonishment when [she]89-miss pole came to tell [us]3234-we of the astounding piece of news . But [I]1487-the great lama must recover [myself]1487-the great lama ; the contemplation of it , even at this distance of time , has taken away [my]1487-the great lama breath and [my]1487-the great lama grammar , and unless [I]1487-the great lama subdue [my]1487-the great lama emotion , [my]1487-the great lama spelling will go too . [We]3234-we were sitting — [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [I]1487-the great lama — much as usual , [she]98-miss matty in the blue chintz easy - chair , with [her]98-miss matty back to the light , and [her]98-miss matty knitting in [her]98-miss matty hand , [I]1487-the great lama reading aloud the _ [St James]194-st james ’s Chronicle _ . A few minutes more , and [we]3234-we should have gone to make the little alterations in dress usual before calling - time ( twelve o’clock ) in [Cranford]1-cranford . [I]1487-the great lama remember the scene and the date well . [We]3234-we had been talking of [the signor]3128-the signor ’s rapid recovery since the warmer weather had set in , and praising [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ’s skill , and lamenting [his]105-mr hoggins want of refinement and manner ( it seems a curious coincidence that this should have been [our]3234-we subject , but so it was ) , when a knock was heard — [a caller]2164-a caller ’s knock — three distinct taps — and [we]3234-we were flying ( that is to say , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty could not walk very fast , having had a touch of rheumatism ) to [[our]3234-we rooms]3239-our rooms , to change cap and collars , when [Miss Pole]89-miss pole arrested [us]3234-we by calling out , as [she]0-i came up [the stairs]3240-the stairs , “[1487-the great lama] Do n’t go — [I]0-i ca n’t wait — it is not twelve , [I]0-i know — but never mind [your]1490-you dress — [I]0-i must speak to [you]1490-you . ” [We]3234-we did [our]3234-we best to look as if it was not [we]3234-we who had made the hurried movement , the sound of which [she]0-i had heard ; for , of course , [we]3234-we did not like to have it supposed that [we]3234-we had any old clothes that it was convenient to wear out in [the “[0-i] sanctuary of [home]306-home]3241-the “ sanctuary of home , ” as [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty once prettily called [the back parlour]3242-the back parlour , where [she]98-miss matty was tying up preserves . So [we]3234-we threw [our]3234-we gentility with double force into [our]3234-we manners , and very genteel [we]3234-we were for two minutes while [Miss Pole]89-miss pole recovered breath , and excited [our]3234-we curiosity strongly by lifting up [her]89-miss pole hands in amazement , and bringing them down in silence , as if what [she]89-miss pole had to say was too big for words , and could only be expressed by pantomime . “[1490-you] What do [you]1490-you think , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ? What _ do _ [you]1490-you think ? [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire is to marry — is to be married , [I]0-i mean — [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire — [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins — [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins is going to marry [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire ! ” “[105-mr hoggins] Marry ! ” said [we]3234-we . “[1490-you] Marry ! Madness ! ” [ Picture : What do [you]1490-you think , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ] “[182-lady glenmire] Marry ! ” said [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , with the decision that belonged to [her]89-miss pole character . “[0-i] _ [I]0-i _ said marry ! as [you]1490-you do ; and [I]0-i also said , ‘ What a fool [[my]0-i lady]1151-my lady is going to make of [herself]1151-my lady ! ’ [I]0-i could have said ‘ Madness ! ’ but [I]0-i controlled [myself]0-i , for it was in [a public shop]1493-a public shop that [I]0-i heard of it . Where feminine delicacy is gone to , [I]0-i do n’t know ! [You]1490-you and [I]0-i , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , would have been ashamed to have known that [our]1494-our marriage was spoken of in [[a grocer]1495-a grocer ’s shop]1496-a grocer ’s shop , in the hearing of [shopmen]1497-shopmen ! ” “[1495-a grocer] But , ” said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , sighing as one recovering from a blow , “[1495-a grocer] perhaps it is not true . Perhaps [we]1494-our are doing [her]1151-my lady injustice . ” “[1495-a grocer] No , ” said [Miss Pole]89-miss pole . “[1495-a grocer] [I]0-i have taken care to ascertain that . [I]0-i went straight to [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam , to borrow a cookery - book which [I]0-i knew [she]168-mrs fitz - adam had ; and [I]0-i introduced [my]0-i congratulations _ à propos _ of the difficulty [gentlemen]619-gentlemen must have in [house]2425-house - keeping ; and [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam bridled up , and said that [she]168-mrs fitz - adam believed it was true , though how and where [I]0-i could have heard it [she]168-mrs fitz - adam did not know . [She]168-mrs fitz - adam said [[her]168-mrs fitz - adam brother]1500-her brother and [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire had come to an understanding at last . ‘ Understanding ! ’ such a coarse word ! But [[my]0-i lady]1151-my lady will have to come down to many a want of refinement . [I]0-i have reason to believe [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins sups on bread - and - cheese and beer every night . “ Marry ! ”[98-miss matty] said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty once again . “ Well ! [I]98-miss matty never thought of it . [Two people that [we]3243-two people that we know going to be married know going to be married]3243-two people that we know going to be married . [It]3244-it ’s coming very near ! ”[98-miss matty] “ So near that [my]89-miss pole heart stopped beating when [I]89-miss pole heard of it , while [you]3245-you might have counted twelve , ”[89-miss pole] said [Miss Pole]89-miss pole . “ [One]2460-one does not know whose turn may come next . Here , in [Cranford]1-cranford , [poor Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire might have thought [herself]182-lady glenmire safe , ”[98-miss matty] said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , with a gentle pity in [her]98-miss matty tones . “ Bah ! ”[89-miss pole] said [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , with a toss of [her]89-miss pole head . “ Do n’t [you]3245-you remember poor dear [Captain Brown]80-captain brown ’s song ‘ [Tibbie Fowler]245-tibbie fowler , ’ and the line — ‘ Set [her]182-lady glenmire on the Tintock tap , The wind will blaw [a man]2058-a man till [her]182-lady glenmire . ’ ”[89-miss pole] “ That was because ‘ [Tibbie Fowler]245-tibbie fowler ’ was rich , [I]98-miss matty think . ”[98-miss matty] “ Well ! there was a kind of attraction about [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire that [I]0-i , for one , should be ashamed to have . ”[0-i] [I]0-i put in [my]0-i wonder . “ But how can [she]182-lady glenmire have fancied [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ? [I]89-miss pole suppose [she]1503-she takes the surgery with it , ”[89-miss pole] said [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , with a little dry laugh at [her]89-miss pole own joke . [The person whom [she]1503-she had left in charge of [[her]1503-she house]600-her house to keep off [followers]2292-followers from [[her]1503-she maids]1508-her maids to set up [a follower of [her]1503-she own]1509-a follower of her own]1505-the person whom she had left in charge of her house to keep off followers from her maids to set up a follower of her own ! Or had [their]1515-their interviews been confined to the occasional meetings in the chamber of [the poor sick conjuror]1516-the poor sick conjuror , to whom , with all [our]1517-we sense of the _ mésalliance _ , [we]1517-we could not help allowing that [they]1515-their had both been exceedingly kind ? And now it turned out that [a servant of [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s]1518-a servant of mrs jamieson ’s had been ill , and [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins had been attending [her]1518-a servant of mrs jamieson ’s for some weeks . So the wolf had got into the fold , and now [he]1510-a man whom mrs jamieson had tabooed as vulgar , and inadmissible to cranford society was carrying off [the shepherdess]1519-the shepherdess . What would [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson say ? [We]1517-we looked into the darkness of futurity as [a child]2069-a child gazes after a rocket up in the cloudy sky , full of wondering expectation of the rattle , the discharge , and the brilliant shower of sparks and light . Then [we]1517-we brought [ourselves]1517-we down to earth and the present time by questioning [each other]302-each other ( being all equally ignorant , and all equally without the slightest data to build any conclusions upon ) as to when IT would take place ? Where ? How much a year [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins had ? Whether [she]1518-a servant of mrs jamieson ’s would drop [her]1518-a servant of mrs jamieson ’s title ? And how [Martha]98-miss matty and [the other correct servants in [Cranford]1-cranford]1522-the other correct servants in cranford would ever be brought to announce [a married couple]280-a married couple as [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire and [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ? But would [they]280-a married couple be visited ? Would [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson let [us]1517-we ? Or must [we]1517-we choose between [the Honourable Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson and [the degraded Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire ? [We]1517-we all liked [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire the best . [She]182-lady glenmire was bright , and kind , and sociable , and agreeable ; and [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson was dull , and inert , and pompous , and tiresome . But [we]1517-we had acknowledged the sway of [the latter]554-the latter so long , that it seemed like a kind of disloyalty now even to meditate disobedience to the prohibition [we]1517-we anticipated . [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester surprised [us]1517-we in [our]1517-we darned caps and patched collars ; and [we]1517-we forgot all about them in [our]1517-we eagerness to see how [she]77-mrs forrester would bear the information , which [we]1517-we honourably left to [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , to impart , although , if [we]1517-we had been inclined to take unfair advantage , [we]1517-we might have rushed in [ourselves]1517-we , for [she]77-mrs forrester had a most out - of - place fit of coughing for five minutes after [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester entered [the room]370-the room . [I]0-i shall never forget the imploring expression of [her]77-mrs forrester eyes , as [she]77-mrs forrester looked at [us]1517-we over [her]77-mrs forrester pocket - handkerchief . [They]1526-they said , as plain as words could speak , “ Do n’t let [Nature]246-nature deprive [me]1526-they of the treasure which is [mine]1526-they , although for a time [I]1526-they can make no use of it . ”[1526-they] And [we]1517-we did not . [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester ’s surprise was equal to [ours]1517-we ; and [her]77-mrs forrester sense of injury rather greater , because [she]77-mrs forrester had to feel for [her]77-mrs forrester Order , and saw more fully than [we]1517-we could do how such conduct brought stains on [the aristocracy]3152-the aristocracy . When [she]77-mrs forrester and [Miss Pole]89-miss pole left [us]1517-we [we]1517-we endeavoured to subside into calmness ; but [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was really upset by the intelligence [she]98-miss matty had heard . [She]98-miss matty reckoned it up , and it was more than fifteen years since [she]98-miss matty had heard of [any of [her]98-miss matty acquaintance]1528-any of her acquaintance going to be married , with the one exception of [Miss Jessie Brown]85-miss jessie ; and , as [she]98-miss matty said , it gave [her]98-miss matty quite a shock , and made [her]98-miss matty feel as if [she]98-miss matty could not think what would happen next . [I]0-i do n’t know whether it is a fancy of [mine]0-i , or a real fact , but [I]0-i have noticed that , just after the announcement of an engagement in any set , [the unmarried ladies in that set]1529-the unmarried ladies in that set flutter out in an unusual gaiety and newness of dress , as much as to say , in a tacit and unconscious manner , “ [We]1529-the unmarried ladies in that set also are [spinsters]3249-spinsters . ”[98-miss matty] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [Miss Pole]89-miss pole talked and thought more about bonnets , gowns , caps , and shawls , during the fortnight that succeeded this call , than [I]0-i had known [them]1529-the unmarried ladies in that set do for years before . But it might be the spring weather , for it was a warm and pleasant March ; and merinoes and beavers , and woollen materials of all sorts were but ungracious receptacles of the bright sun ’s glancing rays . It had not been [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire ’s dress that had won [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ’s heart , for [she]98-miss matty went about on [her]98-miss matty errands of kindness more shabby than ever . Although in the hurried glimpses [I]0-i caught of [her]98-miss matty at [church]309-church or [elsewhere]1531-elsewhere [she]98-miss matty appeared rather to shun meeting [any of [[her]98-miss matty friends]453-her friends]1532-any of her friends , [her]98-miss matty face seemed to have almost something of the flush of youth in it ; [her]98-miss matty lips looked redder and more trembling full than in their old compressed state , and [her]98-miss matty eyes dwelt on all things with a lingering light , as if [she]98-miss matty was learning to love [Cranford]1-cranford and its belongings . [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins looked broad and radiant , and creaked up the middle aisle at [church]309-church in a brand - new pair of top - boots — an audible , as well as visible , sign of [his]105-mr hoggins purposed change of state ; for the tradition went , that the boots [he]105-mr hoggins had worn till now were the identical pair in which [he]105-mr hoggins first set out on [his]105-mr hoggins rounds in [Cranford]1-cranford twenty - five years ago ; only they had been new - pieced , high and low , top and bottom , heel and sole , black leather and brown leather , more times than [any one]2107-any one could tell . [None of [the ladies in [Cranford]1-cranford]1537-the ladies in cranford]1536-none of the ladies in cranford chose to sanction the marriage by congratulating either of [the parties]1538-the parties . [We]1539-our wished to ignore the whole affair until [[our]1539-our liege lady]1540-our liege lady , [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson , returned . Till [she]1540-our liege lady came back to give [us]1539-our [our]1539-our cue , [we]1539-our felt that it would be better to consider the engagement in the same light as [the Queen of [Spain]46-spain]1541-the queen of spain ’s legs — facts which certainly existed , but the less said about the better . This restraint upon [our]1539-our tongues — for [you]1542-you see if [we]1539-our did not speak about it to any of [the parties concerned]1543-the parties concerned , how could [we]1539-our get answers to the questions that [we]1539-our longed to ask?—was beginning to be irksome , and [our]1539-our idea of the dignity of silence was paling before [our]1539-our curiosity , when another direction was given to [our]1539-our thoughts , by an announcement on the part of [the principal shopkeeper of [Cranford]1-cranford]1544-the principal shopkeeper of cranford , who ranged the trades from [grocer and cheesemonger]1545-grocer and cheesemonger to [man - milliner]1546-man - milliner , as occasion required , that the spring fashions were arrived , and would be exhibited on the following Tuesday at [[his]1544-the principal shopkeeper of cranford rooms in [High Street]17-high street]1547-his rooms in high street . Now [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had been only waiting for this before buying [herself]98-miss matty a new silk gown . [I]0-i had offered , it is true , to send to [Drumble]2-drumble for patterns , but [she]98-miss matty had rejected [my]0-i proposal , gently implying that [she]98-miss matty had not forgotten [her]98-miss matty disappointment about the sea - green turban . [I]0-i was thankful that [I]0-i was on the spot now , to counteract the dazzling fascination of any yellow or scarlet silk . [I]0-i must say a word or two here about [myself]0-i . [I]0-i have spoken of [[my]0-i father]2082-my father ’s old friendship for [the Jenkyns family]1549-the jenkyns family ; indeed , [I]0-i am not sure if there was not some distant relationship . [He]2082-my father had willingly allowed [me]0-i to remain all the winter at [Cranford]1-cranford , in consideration of a letter which [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had written to [him]2082-my father about the time of the panic , in which [I]0-i suspect [she]98-miss matty had exaggerated [my]0-i powers and [my]0-i bravery as [a defender of [the house]2059-the house]1550-a defender of the house . But now that the days were longer and more cheerful , [he]2082-my father was beginning to urge the necessity of [my]0-i return ; and [I]0-i only delayed in a sort of odd forlorn hope that if [I]0-i could obtain any clear information , [I]0-i might make the account given by [the signora of [the Aga Jenkyns]240-the aga jenkyns]1552-the signora of the aga jenkyns tally with that of “ poor [Peter]157-mr peter , ”[1552-the signora of the aga jenkyns] [his]2082-my father appearance and disappearance , which [I]0-i had winnowed out of the conversation of [Miss Pole]89-miss pole and [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester . CHAPTER XIII . STOPPED PAYMENT THE very Tuesday morning on which [Mr Johnson]247-mr johnson was going to show the fashions , [the post - woman]1553-the post - woman brought two letters to [the house]2059-the house . [I]0-i say [the post - woman]1553-the post - woman , but [I]0-i should say [[the postman]1556-the postman ’s wife]1557-the postman ’s wife . [He]2082-my father was [a lame shoemaker]1558-a lame shoemaker , [a very clean , honest man]1559-a very clean , honest man , much respected in [the town]281-the town ; but [he]2082-my father never brought the letters round except on unusual occasions , such as Christmas Day or Good Friday ; and on those days the letters , which should have been delivered at eight in the morning , did not make their appearance until two or three in the afternoon , for [every one]426-every one liked [poor Thomas]119-mr holbrook , and gave [him]119-mr holbrook a welcome on these festive occasions . [He]2082-my father used to say , “ [He]2082-my father was welly stawed wi ’ eating , for there were [three or four houses]3250-three or four houses where nowt would serve [’em]3251-’em but [he]2082-my father must share in [their]3250-three or four houses breakfast ; ”[2082-my father] and by the time [he]2082-my father had done [his]2082-my father last breakfast , [he]2082-my father came to [some other friend who was beginning dinner]1562-some other friend who was beginning dinner ; but come what might in the way of temptation , [Tom]119-mr holbrook was always sober , civil , and smiling ; and , as [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty used to say , it was a lesson in patience , that [she]98-miss matty doubted not would call out that precious quality in some minds , where , but for [Thomas]119-mr holbrook , it might have lain dormant and undiscovered . [Patience]248-patience was certainly very dormant in [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty ’s mind . [She]98-miss matty was always expecting letters , and always drumming on the table till [the post - woman]1553-the post - woman had called or gone past . On Christmas Day and Good Friday [she]98-miss matty drummed from breakfast till [church]309-church , from church - time till two o’clock — unless when the fire wanted stirring , when [she]98-miss matty invariably knocked down the fire - irons , and scolded [Miss Matty]98-miss matty for it . But equally certain was the hearty welcome and the good dinner for [Thomas]119-mr holbrook ; [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty standing over [him]119-mr holbrook like [a bold dragoon]1565-a bold dragoon , questioning [him]119-mr holbrook as to [[his]119-mr holbrook children]1566-his children — what [they]1566-his children were doing — what [school]1567-school [they]1566-his children went to ; upbraiding [him]119-mr holbrook if another was likely to make its appearance , but sending even [the little babies]1568-the little babies the shilling and the mince - pie which was [her]98-miss matty gift to all [the children]2581-the children , with half - a - crown in addition for both [father]894-father and [mother]2153-mother . The post was not half of so much consequence to dear [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ; but not for [the world]333-the world would [she]98-miss matty have diminished [Thomas]119-mr holbrook ’s welcome and [his]119-mr holbrook dole , though [I]0-i could see that [she]98-miss matty felt rather shy over the ceremony , which had been regarded by [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty as a glorious opportunity for giving advice and benefiting [her]98-miss matty fellow - creatures . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would steal the money all in a lump into [his]119-mr holbrook hand , as if [she]98-miss matty were ashamed of [herself]98-miss matty . [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty gave [him]119-mr holbrook each individual coin separate , with a “ There ! that ’s for [yourself]119-mr holbrook ; that ’s for [Jenny]104-jenny , ”[98-miss matty] etc . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would even beckon [Martha]98-miss matty out of [the kitchen]635-the kitchen while [he]119-mr holbrook ate [his]119-mr holbrook food : and once , to [my]0-i knowledge , winked at its rapid disappearance into a blue cotton pocket - handkerchief . [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty almost scolded [him]119-mr holbrook if [he]119-mr holbrook did not leave a clean plate , however heaped it might have been , and gave an injunction with every mouthful . [ Picture : Standing over [him]119-mr holbrook like [a bold dragoon]1565-a bold dragoon ] [I]0-i have wandered a long way from the two letters that awaited [us]1575-us on the breakfast - table that Tuesday morning . [Mine]0-i was from [[my]0-i father]2082-my father . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s was printed . [[My]0-i father]2082-my father ’s was just [a man]2058-a man ’s letter ; [I]0-i mean it was very dull , and gave no information beyond that [he]2082-my father was well , that [they]1579-they had had a good deal of rain , that trade was very stagnant , and there were many disagreeable rumours afloat . [He]2082-my father then asked [me]0-i if [I]0-i knew whether [Miss Matty]98-miss matty still retained [her]98-miss matty shares in [the Town]281-the town and County Bank , as there were very unpleasant reports about it ; though nothing more than [he]2082-my father had always foreseen , and had prophesied to [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty years ago , when [she]98-miss matty would invest [their]1579-they little property in it — the only unwise step that [clever woman]1581-clever woman had ever taken , to [his]2082-my father knowledge ( the only time [she]98-miss matty ever acted against [his]2082-my father advice , [I]0-i knew ) . However , if anything had gone wrong , of course [I]0-i was not to think of leaving [Miss Matty]98-miss matty while [I]0-i could be of any use , etc . “ Who is [your]98-miss matty letter from , [[my]0-i dear]2063-my dear ? [Mine]3253-mine is a very civil invitation , signed ‘ [Edwin Wilson]249-edwin wilson , ’ asking [me]0-i to attend an important meeting of [the shareholders of [the Town and County Bank]62-the town and county bank]3254-the shareholders of the town and county bank , to be held in [Drumble]2-drumble , on Thursday the twenty - first . [I]0-i am sure , it is very attentive of [them]3254-the shareholders of the town and county bank to remember [me]0-i . ”[0-i] [I]0-i did not like to hear of this “ important meeting , ”[0-i] for , though [I]0-i did not know much about business , [I]0-i feared it confirmed what [[my]0-i father]2082-my father said : however , [I]0-i thought , ill news always came fast enough , so [I]0-i resolved to say nothing about [my]0-i alarm , and merely told [her]1583-i that [[my]0-i father]2082-my father was well , and sent [his]2082-my father kind regards to [her]1583-i . [She]1583-i kept turning over and admiring [her]1583-i letter . At last [she]1583-i spoke — “ [I]1583-i remember [their]3254-the shareholders of the town and county bank sending one to [Deborah]99-deborah just like this ; but that [I]1583-i did not wonder at , for [everybody]296-everybody knew [she]99-deborah was so clear - headed . [I]1583-i am afraid [I]1583-i could not help [them]3254-the shareholders of the town and county bank much ; indeed , if [they]3254-the shareholders of the town and county bank came to accounts , [I]1583-i should be quite in the way , for [I]1583-i never could do sums in [my]1583-i head . [Deborah]99-deborah , [I]1583-i know , rather wished to go , and went so far as to order a new bonnet for the occasion : but when the time came [she]99-deborah had a bad cold ; so [they]3254-the shareholders of the town and county bank sent [her]99-deborah a very polite account of what [they]3254-the shareholders of the town and county bank had done . Chosen [a director]3256-a director , [I]1583-i think it was . Do [you]3257-you think [they]3254-the shareholders of the town and county bank want [me]1583-i to help [them]3254-the shareholders of the town and county bank to choose [a director]3256-a director ? [I]1583-i am sure [I]1583-i should choose [[your]3257-you father]2350-your father at once ! ”[1583-i] “ [[My]1585-i father]2082-my father has no shares in the bank , ”[1585-i] said [I.]1585-i “ Oh , no ! [I]1585-i remember . [He]2082-my father objected very much to [Deborah]99-deborah ’s buying any , [I]1585-i believe . But [she]99-deborah was quite [the woman of business]3261-the woman of business , and always judged for [herself]99-deborah ; and here , [you]0-i see , [they]3262-they have paid eight per cent . all these years . ”[1585-i] It was a very uncomfortable subject to [me]0-i , with [my]0-i half - knowledge ; so [I]0-i thought [I]0-i would change the conversation , and [I]0-i asked at what time [she]1586-she thought [we]1587-we had better go and see the fashions . “ Well , [[my]1586-she dear]2063-my dear , ”[1586-she] [she]1586-she said , “ the thing is this : it is not etiquette to go till after twelve ; but then , [you]0-i see , [all Cranford]3264-all cranford will be [there]289-there , and [one]2460-one does not like to be too curious about dress and trimmings and caps with all the world looking on . It is never genteel to be over - curious on these occasions . [Deborah]99-deborah had the knack of always looking as if the latest fashion was nothing new to [her]99-deborah ; a manner [she]99-deborah had caught from [Lady Arley]160-lady arley , who did see all the new modes in [London]4-london , [you]0-i know . So [I]1586-she thought [we]1588-we would just slip down this morning , soon after breakfast — for [I]1586-she do want half - a - pound of tea — and then [we]1588-we could go up and examine the things at [our]1588-we leisure , and see exactly how [my]1586-she new silk gown must be made ; and then , after twelve , [we]1588-we could go with [our]1588-we minds disengaged , and free from thoughts of dress . ”[1586-she] [We]1588-we began to talk of [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s new silk gown . [I]0-i discovered that it would be really the first time in [her]98-miss matty life that [she]98-miss matty had had to choose anything of consequence for [herself]98-miss matty : for [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty had always been the more decided character , whatever [her]98-miss matty taste might have been ; and it is astonishing how [such people]2998-such people carry [the world]333-the world before [them]2998-such people by the mere force of will . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty anticipated the sight of the glossy folds with as much delight as if [the five sovereigns]1591-the five sovereigns , set apart for the purchase , could buy all the silks in [the shop]716-the shop ; and ( remembering [my]0-i own loss of two hours in [a toyshop]1593-a toyshop before [I]0-i could tell on what wonder to spend a silver threepence ) [I]0-i was very glad that [we]1588-we were going early , that [dear Miss Matty]98-miss matty might have leisure for the delights of perplexity . If a happy sea - green could be met with , the gown was to be sea - green : if not , [she]98-miss matty inclined to maize , and [I]0-i to silver gray ; and [we]1588-we discussed the requisite number of breadths until [we]1588-we arrived at [the shop]716-the shop - door . [We]1588-we were to buy the tea , select the silk , and then clamber up the iron corkscrew stairs that led into what was once [a loft]1595-a loft , though now [a fashion show - room]1596-a fashion show - room . [The young men at [Mr Johnson]247-mr johnson ’s]1597-the young men at mr johnson ’s had on [their]1597-the young men at mr johnson ’s best looks ; and [their]1597-the young men at mr johnson ’s best cravats , and pivoted [themselves]1597-the young men at mr johnson ’s over the counter with surprising activity . [They]1597-the young men at mr johnson ’s wanted to show [us]1588-we [upstairs]340-upstairs at once ; but on the principle of business first and pleasure afterwards , [we]1588-we stayed to purchase the tea . Here [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s absence of mind betrayed itself . If [she]98-miss matty was made aware that [she]98-miss matty had been drinking green tea at any time , [she]98-miss matty always thought it [her]98-miss matty duty to lie awake half through the night afterward ( [I]0-i have known [her]98-miss matty take it in ignorance many a time without such effects ) , and consequently green tea was prohibited [the house]2059-the house ; yet to - day [she]98-miss matty [herself]98-miss matty asked for the obnoxious article , under the impression that [she]98-miss matty was talking about the silk . However , the mistake was soon rectified ; and then the silks were unrolled in good truth . By this time [the shop]716-the shop was pretty well filled , for it was [Cranford market]1601-cranford market - day , and [many of [the farmers]1603-the farmers and [country people from [the neighbourhood]2511-the neighbourhood]1604-country people from the neighbourhood round]1602-many of the farmers and country people from the neighbourhood round came in , sleeking down [their]1602-many of the farmers and country people from the neighbourhood round hair , and glancing shyly about , from under [their]1602-many of the farmers and country people from the neighbourhood round eyelids , as anxious to take back some notion of the unusual gaiety to [the mistress]1317-the mistress or [the lasses]1607-the lasses at [home]306-home , and yet feeling that [they]1609-they were out of place among [the smart shopmen]1610-the smart shopmen and gay shawls and summer prints . [One honest - looking man]1611-one honest - looking man , however , made [his]1611-one honest - looking man way up to the counter at which [we]1612-we stood , and boldly asked to look at a shawl or two . [The other country folk]1613-the other country folk confined [themselves]1613-the other country folk to the grocery side ; but [[our]1612-we neighbour]1614-our neighbour was evidently too full of some kind intention towards [mistress]694-mistress , [wife]1616-wife or [daughter]2517-daughter , to be shy ; and it soon became a question with [me]0-i , whether [he]1618-he or [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would keep [[their]1619-their shopmen]1620-their shopmen the longest time . [He]1611-one honest - looking man thought each shawl more beautiful than the last ; and , as for [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , [she]98-miss matty smiled and sighed over each fresh bale that was brought out ; one colour set off another , and the heap together would , as [she]98-miss matty said , make even the rainbow look poor . “ [I]98-miss matty am afraid , ”[98-miss matty] said [she]98-miss matty , hesitating , “ whichever [I]98-miss matty choose [I]98-miss matty shall wish [I]98-miss matty had taken another . Look at this lovely crimson ! it would be so warm in winter . But spring is coming on , [you]3267-you know . [I]98-miss matty wish [I]98-miss matty could have a gown for every season , ”[98-miss matty] said [she]98-miss matty , dropping [her]98-miss matty voice — as [we]1621-we all did in [Cranford]1-cranford whenever [we]1621-we talked of anything [we]1621-we wished for but could not afford . “ However , ”[98-miss matty] [she]98-miss matty continued in a louder and more cheerful tone , “ it would give [me]98-miss matty a great deal of trouble to take care of [them]3268-them if [I]98-miss matty had them ; so , [I]98-miss matty think , [I]98-miss matty ’ll only take one . But which must it be , [[my]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear ? ”[98-miss matty] And now [she]98-miss matty hovered over a lilac with yellow spots , while [I]0-i pulled out a quiet sage - green that had faded into insignificance under the more brilliant colours , but which was nevertheless a good silk in its humble way . [Our]1621-we attention was called off to [[our]1621-we neighbour]1614-our neighbour . [He]1614-our neighbour had chosen a shawl of about thirty shillings ’ value ; and [his]1614-our neighbour face looked broadly happy , under the anticipation , no doubt , of the pleasant surprise [he]1614-our neighbour would give to some [Molly]109-mary or [Jenny]104-jenny at [home]306-home ; [he]1614-our neighbour had tugged a leathern purse out of [his]1614-our neighbour breeches - pocket , and had offered a five - pound note in payment for the shawl , and for some parcels which had been brought round to [him]1614-our neighbour from [the grocery counter]1624-the grocery counter ; and it was just at this point that [he]1614-our neighbour attracted [our]1621-we notice . [The shopman]720-the shopman was examining the note with a puzzled , doubtful air . “ [Town]3270-town and [County Bank]63-county bank ! [I]720-the shopman am not sure , [sir]2208-sir , but [I]720-the shopman believe [we]1621-we have received a warning against notes issued by [this bank]3272-this bank only this morning . [I]720-the shopman will just step and ask [Mr Johnson]247-mr johnson , [sir]2208-sir ; but [I]720-the shopman ’m afraid [I]720-the shopman must trouble [you]2208-sir for payment in cash , or in a note of a different bank . ”[720-the shopman] [I]0-i never saw [a man]2058-a man ’s countenance fall so suddenly into dismay and bewilderment . It was almost piteous to see the rapid change . “ Dang it ! ”[1614-our neighbour] said [he]1614-our neighbour , striking [his]1614-our neighbour fist down on the table , as if to try which was the harder , “ [the chap]3274-the chap talks as if notes and gold were to be had for the picking up . ”[1614-our neighbour] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had forgotten [her]98-miss matty silk gown in [her]98-miss matty interest for [the man]424-the man . [I]0-i do n’t think [she]98-miss matty had caught the name of [the bank]1628-the bank , and in [my]0-i nervous cowardice [I]0-i was anxious that [she]98-miss matty should not ; and so [I]0-i began admiring the yellow - spotted lilac gown that [I]0-i had been utterly condemning only a minute before . But it was of no use . “ [What bank]3275-what bank was it ? [I]98-miss matty mean , what bank did [your]424-the man note belong to ? ”[98-miss matty] “ [Town]3270-town and [County Bank]63-county bank . ”[98-miss matty] “ Let [me]98-miss matty see it , ”[98-miss matty] said [she]98-miss matty quietly to [the shopman]720-the shopman , gently taking it out of [his]720-the shopman hand , as [he]720-the shopman brought it back to return it to [the farmer]1630-the farmer . [Mr Johnson]247-mr johnson was very sorry , but , from information [he]247-mr johnson had received , the notes issued by [that bank]1631-that bank were little better than waste paper . “ [I]98-miss matty do n’t understand it , ”[98-miss matty] said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty to [me]0-i in a low voice . “ That is [[our]3277-our bank]3278-our bank , is it [not?—the Town and [County Bank]3280-county bank]3279-not?—the town and county bank ? ”[98-miss matty] “ Yes , ”[0-i] said [I.]0-i “ This lilac silk will just match the ribbons in [your]98-miss matty new cap , [I]0-i believe , ”[0-i] [I]0-i continued , holding up the folds so as to catch the light , and wishing that [the man]424-the man would make haste and be gone , and yet having a new wonder , that had only just sprung up , how far it was wise or right in [me]0-i to allow [Miss Matty]98-miss matty to make this expensive purchase , if the affairs of [the bank]1628-the bank were really so bad as the refusal of the note implied . But [Miss Matty]98-miss matty put on the soft dignified manner , peculiar to [her]98-miss matty , rarely used , and yet which became [her]98-miss matty so well , and laying [her]98-miss matty hand gently on [mine]0-i , [she]98-miss matty said — “ Never mind the silks for a few minutes , [dear]2179-dear . [I]98-miss matty do n’t understand [you]2179-dear , [sir]2208-sir , ”[98-miss matty] turning now to [the shopman]720-the shopman , who had been attending to [the farmer]1630-the farmer . “ Is this a forged note ? ”[98-miss matty] “ Oh , no , [ma’am]2067-ma’am . [Mr Johnson]247-mr johnson is only doing [his]247-mr johnson duty , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , as [I]98-miss matty am sure [Mr Dobson]250-mr dobson knows . ”[98-miss matty] But [Mr Dobson]250-mr dobson could not respond to the appealing bow by any answering smile . [He]250-mr dobson was turning the note absently over in [his]250-mr dobson fingers , looking gloomily enough at the parcel containing the lately - chosen shawl . “ It ’s hard upon [a poor man]3287-a poor man , ”[250-mr dobson] said [he]250-mr dobson , “ as earns every farthing with the sweat of [his]3287-a poor man brow . [She]98-miss matty looked at [him]720-the shopman with a dubious air . “ Perhaps so , ”[98-miss matty] said [she]98-miss matty . “ But [I]98-miss matty do n’t pretend to understand business ; [I]98-miss matty only know that if it is going to fail , and if [honest people]3296-honest people are to lose [their]3296-honest people money because [they]3296-honest people have taken [our]3297-our notes — [I]98-miss matty ca n’t explain [myself]98-miss matty , ”[98-miss matty] said [she]98-miss matty , suddenly becoming aware that [she]98-miss matty had got into a long sentence with [four people]1637-four people for [audience]1638-audience ; “ only [I]98-miss matty would rather exchange [my]98-miss matty gold for the note , if [you]1630-the farmer please , ”[98-miss matty] turning to [the farmer]1630-the farmer , “ and then [you]1630-the farmer can take [[your]1630-the farmer wife]3298-your wife the shawl . [[My]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear , will [you]250-mr dobson come [upstairs]340-upstairs ? ”[98-miss matty] [We]1643-we inspected the fashions with as minute and curious an interest as if the gown to be made after them had been bought . [I]0-i could not see that the little event in [the shop below]1644-the shop below had in the least damped [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s curiosity as to the make of sleeves or the sit of skirts . [She]98-miss matty once or twice exchanged congratulations with [me]0-i on [our]1643-we private and leisurely view of the bonnets and shawls ; but [I]0-i was , all the time , not so sure that [our]1643-we examination was so utterly private , for [I]0-i caught glimpses of [a figure dodging behind the cloaks and mantles]1645-a figure dodging behind the cloaks and mantles ; and , by a dexterous move , [I]0-i came face to face with [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , also in morning costume ( the principal feature of which was [her]98-miss matty being without teeth , and wearing a veil to conceal the deficiency ) , come on the same errand as [ourselves]1643-we . But [she]98-miss matty quickly took [her]98-miss matty departure , because , as [she]98-miss matty said , [she]98-miss matty had a bad headache , and did not feel [herself]98-miss matty up to conversation . As [we]1643-we came down through [the shop]716-the shop , [the civil Mr Johnson]247-mr johnson was awaiting [us]1643-we ; [he]247-mr johnson had been informed of the exchange of the note for gold , and with much good feeling and real kindness , but with a little want of tact , [he]247-mr johnson wished to condole with [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , and impress upon [her]98-miss matty the true state of the case . [I]0-i could only hope that [he]247-mr johnson had heard an exaggerated rumour for [he]247-mr johnson said that [her]98-miss matty shares were worse than nothing , and that [the bank]1628-the bank could not pay a shilling in the pound . [I]0-i was glad that [Miss Matty]98-miss matty seemed still a little incredulous ; but [I]0-i could not tell how much of this was real or assumed , with that self - control which seemed habitual to [ladies of [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s standing in [Cranford]1-cranford , who would have thought [their]1648-ladies of miss matty ’s standing in cranford , who would have thought their dignity compromised by the slightest expression of surprise , dismay , or any similar feeling to an inferior in station , or in a public shop dignity compromised by the slightest expression of surprise , dismay , or any similar feeling to [an inferior in station]1649-an inferior in station , or in [a public shop]1493-a public shop]1648-ladies of miss matty ’s standing in cranford , who would have thought their dignity compromised by the slightest expression of surprise , dismay , or any similar feeling to an inferior in station , or in a public shop . However , [we]1643-we walked [home]306-home very silently . [I]0-i am ashamed to say , [I]0-i believe [I]0-i was rather vexed and annoyed at [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s conduct in taking the note to [herself]98-miss matty so decidedly . [I]0-i had so set [my]0-i heart upon [her]98-miss matty having a new silk gown , which [she]98-miss matty wanted sadly ; in general [she]98-miss matty was so undecided [anybody]2833-anybody might turn [her]98-miss matty round ; in this case [I]0-i had felt that it was no use attempting it , but [I]0-i was not the less put out at the result . Somehow , after twelve o’clock , [we]1643-we both acknowledged to a sated curiosity about the fashions , and to a certain fatigue of body ( which was , in fact , depression of mind ) that indisposed [us]1643-we to go out again . But still [we]1643-we never spoke of the note ; till , all at once , something possessed [me]0-i to ask [Miss Matty]98-miss matty if [she]98-miss matty would think it [her]98-miss matty duty to offer sovereigns for all the notes of [the Town]281-the town and [County Bank]63-county bank [she]98-miss matty met with ? [I]0-i could have bitten [my]0-i tongue out the minute [I]0-i had said it . [She]98-miss matty looked up rather sadly , and as if [I]0-i had thrown a new perplexity into [her]98-miss matty already distressed mind ; and for a minute or two [she]98-miss matty did not speak . Then [she]98-miss matty said — [my]0-i own dear [Miss Matty]98-miss matty — without a shade of reproach in [her]98-miss matty voice — “ [[My]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear , [I]98-miss matty never feel as if [my]98-miss matty mind was what [people]359-people call very strong ; and it ’s often hard enough work for [me]98-miss matty to settle what [I]98-miss matty ought to do with the case right before [me]98-miss matty . [I]98-miss matty was very thankful to — [I]98-miss matty was very thankful , that [I]98-miss matty saw [my]98-miss matty duty this morning , with [the poor man]3310-the poor man standing by [me]98-miss matty ; but it ’s rather a strain upon [me]98-miss matty to keep thinking and thinking what [I]98-miss matty should do if such and such a thing happened ; and , [I]98-miss matty believe , [I]98-miss matty had rather wait and see what really does come ; and [I]98-miss matty do n’t doubt [I]98-miss matty shall be helped then if [I]98-miss matty do n’t fidget [myself]98-miss matty , and get too anxious beforehand . [You]3311-you know , love , [I]98-miss matty ’m not like [Deborah]99-deborah . If [Deborah]99-deborah had lived , [I]98-miss matty ’ve no doubt [she]99-deborah would have seen after [them]3312-them , before [they]3312-them had got [themselves]3312-them into this state . ”[98-miss matty] [We]1654-we had neither of [us]1654-we much appetite for dinner , though [we]1654-we tried to talk cheerfully about indifferent things . When [we]1654-we returned into [the drawing - room]503-the drawing - room , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty unlocked [her]98-miss matty desk and began to look over [her]98-miss matty account - books . [I]0-i was so penitent for what [I]0-i had said in the morning , that [I]0-i did not choose to take upon [myself]0-i the presumption to suppose that [I]0-i could assist [her]98-miss matty ; [I]0-i rather left [her]98-miss matty alone , as , with puzzled brow , [her]98-miss matty eye followed [her]98-miss matty pen up and down the ruled page . By - and - by [she]98-miss matty shut the book , locked the desk , and came and drew a chair to [mine]0-i , where [I]0-i sat in moody sorrow over the fire . [I]0-i stole [my]0-i hand into [hers]98-miss matty ; [she]98-miss matty clasped it , but did not speak a word . At last [she]98-miss matty said , with forced composure in [her]98-miss matty voice , “ If that bank goes wrong , [I]98-miss matty shall lose one hundred and forty - nine pounds thirteen shillings and fourpence a year ; [I]98-miss matty shall only have thirteen pounds a year left . ”[98-miss matty] [I]0-i squeezed [her]98-miss matty hand hard and tight . [I]0-i did not know what to say . Presently ( it was too dark to see [her]98-miss matty face ) [I]0-i felt [her]98-miss matty fingers work convulsively in [my]0-i grasp ; and [I]0-i knew [she]98-miss matty was going to speak again . [I]0-i heard the sobs in [her]98-miss matty voice as [she]98-miss matty said , “ [I]98-miss matty hope it ’s not wrong — not wicked — but , oh ! [I]98-miss matty am so glad poor [Deborah]99-deborah is spared this . [She]99-deborah could not have borne to come down in [the world]333-the world — [she]99-deborah had such a noble , lofty spirit . ”[98-miss matty] This was all [she]98-miss matty said about [the sister who had insisted upon investing [[their]1657-their little property in [that unlucky bank]1659-that unlucky bank]1658-their little property in that unlucky bank]1656-the sister who had insisted upon investing their little property in that unlucky bank . [We]1660-we were later in lighting the candle than usual that night , and until that light shamed [us]1660-we into speaking , [we]1660-we sat together very silently and sadly . However , [we]1660-we took to [our]1660-we work after tea with a kind of forced cheerfulness ( which soon became real as far as it went ) , talking of that never - ending wonder , [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire ’s engagement . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was almost coming round to think it a good thing . “ [I]1661-i do n’t mean to deny that [men]491-men are troublesome in [a house]2155-a house . [I]1661-i do n’t judge from [my]1661-i own experience , for [[my]1661-i father]2082-my father was neatness itself , and wiped [his]2082-my father shoes on coming in as carefully as [any woman]3317-any woman ; but still [a man]2058-a man has a sort of knowledge of what should be done in difficulties , that it is very pleasant to have one at hand ready to lean upon . Now , [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire , instead of being tossed about , and wondering where [she]182-lady glenmire is to settle , will be certain of [a home among [pleasant and kind people]3320-pleasant and kind people , such as [[our]1660-we good Miss [Pole]89-miss pole]3321-our good miss pole and [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester]3319-a home among pleasant and kind people , such as our good miss pole and mrs forrester . And [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins is really [a very personable man]3322-a very personable man ; and as for [his]105-mr hoggins manners , why , if [they]3323-they are not very polished , [I]1661-i have known [people with very good hearts and very clever minds]3324-people with very good hearts and very clever minds too , who were not what [some people reckoned refined , but who were both true and tender]3325-some people reckoned refined , but who were both true and tender . ”[1661-i] [She]1661-i fell off into a soft reverie about [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook , and [I]0-i did not interrupt [her]1661-i , [I]0-i was so busy maturing a plan [I]0-i had had in [my]0-i mind for some days , but which this threatened failure of [the bank]1628-the bank had brought to a crisis . That night , after [Miss Matty]98-miss matty went to bed , [I]0-i treacherously lighted the candle again , and sat down in [the drawing - room]503-the drawing - room to compose a letter to [the Aga Jenkyns]240-the aga jenkyns , a letter which should affect [him]119-mr holbrook if [he]119-mr holbrook were [Peter]157-mr peter , and yet seem a mere statement of dry facts if [he]119-mr holbrook were [a stranger]2879-a stranger . The church clock pealed out two before [I]0-i had done . The next morning news came , both official and otherwise , that [the Town]281-the town and [County]64-county Bank had stopped payment . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was ruined . [She]98-miss matty tried to speak quietly to [me]0-i ; but when [she]98-miss matty came to the actual fact that [she]98-miss matty would have but about five shillings a week to live upon , [she]98-miss matty could not restrain a few tears . “ [I]98-miss matty am not crying for [myself]98-miss matty , [dear]2179-dear , ”[98-miss matty] said [she]98-miss matty , wiping them away ; “ [I]98-miss matty believe [I]98-miss matty am crying for the very silly thought of how [[my]98-miss matty mother]2400-my mother would grieve if [she]2400-my mother could know ; [she]2400-my mother always cared for [us]3328-us so much more than for [herself]2400-my mother . But many [a poor person]2526-a poor person has less , and [I]98-miss matty am not very extravagant , and , thank [God]103-god , when the neck of mutton , and [Martha]98-miss matty ’s wages , and the rent are paid , [I]98-miss matty have not a farthing owing . [Poor Martha]98-miss matty ! [I]98-miss matty think [she]98-miss matty ’ll be sorry to leave [me]98-miss matty . ”[98-miss matty] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty smiled at [me]0-i through [her]98-miss matty tears , and [she]98-miss matty would fain have had [me]0-i see only the smile , not the tears . CHAPTER XIV . FRIENDS IN NEED IT was an example to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i fancy it might be to [many others]531-many others , to see how immediately [Miss Matty]98-miss matty set about the retrenchment which [she]98-miss matty knew to be right under [her]98-miss matty altered circumstances . While [she]98-miss matty went down to speak to [Martha]98-miss matty , and break the intelligence to [her]98-miss matty , [I]0-i stole out with [my]0-i letter to [the Aga Jenkyns]240-the aga jenkyns , and went to [[the signor]3128-the signor ’s lodgings]1668-the signor ’s lodgings to obtain the exact address . [I]0-i bound [the signora]3196-the signora to secrecy ; and indeed [her]3196-the signora military manners had a degree of shortness and reserve in them which made [her]3196-the signora always say as little as possible , except when under the pressure of strong excitement . Moreover ( which made [my]0-i secret doubly sure ) , [the signor]3128-the signor was now so far recovered as to be looking forward to travelling and conjuring again in the space of a few days , when [he]3128-the signor , [[his]3128-the signor wife]593-his wife , and [little Phœbe]235-phœbe would leave [Cranford]1-cranford . Indeed , [I]0-i found [him]3128-the signor looking over a great black and red placard , in which [the Signor Brunoni]96-signor brunoni ’s accomplishments were set forth , and to which only the name of [the town where [he]3128-the signor would next display them]1672-the town where he would next display them was wanting . [He]3128-the signor and [[his]3128-the signor wife]593-his wife were so much absorbed in deciding where the red letters would come in with most effect ( it might have been the Rubric for that matter ) , that it was some time before [I]0-i could get [my]0-i question asked privately , and not before [I]0-i had given several decisions , the wisdom of which [I]0-i questioned afterwards with equal sincerity as soon as [the signor]3128-the signor threw in [his]3128-the signor doubts and reasons on the important subject . At last [I]0-i got the address , spelt by sound , and very queer it looked . [I]0-i dropped it in the post on [my]0-i way [home]306-home , and then for a minute [I]0-i stood looking at the wooden pane with a gaping slit which divided [me]0-i from the letter but a moment ago in [my]0-i hand . It was gone from [me]0-i like life , never to be recalled . It would get tossed about on [the sea]1676-the sea , and stained with sea - waves perhaps , and be carried among palm - trees , and scented with all tropical fragrance ; the little piece of paper , but an hour ago so familiar and commonplace , had set out on its race to [the strange wild countries beyond [the Ganges]65-the ganges]1677-the strange wild countries beyond the ganges ! But [I]0-i could not afford to lose much time on this speculation . [I]0-i hastened [home]306-home , that [Miss Matty]98-miss matty might not miss [me]0-i . [Martha]98-miss matty opened the door to [me]0-i , [her]98-miss matty face swollen with crying . As soon as [she]98-miss matty saw [me]0-i [she]98-miss matty burst out afresh , and taking hold of [my]0-i arm [she]98-miss matty pulled [me]0-i in , and banged the door to , in order to ask [me]0-i if indeed it was all true that [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had been saying . “ [I]98-miss matty ’ll never leave [her]98-miss matty ! No ; [I]98-miss matty wo n’t . [I]98-miss matty telled [her]98-miss matty so , and said [I]98-miss matty could not think how [she]98-miss matty could find in [her]98-miss matty heart to give [me]98-miss matty warning . [I]98-miss matty could not have had the face to do it , if [I]98-miss matty ’d been [her]98-miss matty . [I]98-miss matty might ha ’ been just as good for nothing as [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam ’s Rosy , who struck for wages after living seven years and a half in [one place]3330-one place . [I]98-miss matty said [I]98-miss matty was not one to go and serve [Mammon]252-mammon at that rate ; that [I]98-miss matty knew when [I]98-miss matty ’d got [a good missus]3331-a good missus , if [she]98-miss matty did n’t know when [she]98-miss matty ’d got [a good servant]3332-a good servant ”[98-miss matty] — “ But , [Martha]98-miss matty , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , cutting in while [she]1679-you wiped [her]1679-you eyes . “ Do n’t , ‘ but [Martha]98-miss matty ’ [me]1679-you , ”[1679-you] [she]1679-you replied to [my]0-i deprecatory tone . “ Listen to reason ”[1679-you] — “ [I]1679-you ’ll not listen to reason , ”[1679-you] [she]1679-you said , now in full possession of [her]1679-you voice , which had been rather choked with sobbing . “ Reason always means what [someone else]3333-someone else has got to say . Now [I]1679-you think what [I]1679-you ’ve got to say is good enough reason ; but reason or not , [I]1679-you ’ll say it , and [I]1679-you ’ll stick to it . [I]1679-you ’ve money in [the Savings Bank]3334-the savings bank , and [I]1679-you ’ve a good stock of clothes , and [I]1679-you ’m not going to leave [Miss Matty]98-miss matty . No , not if [she]98-miss matty gives [me]1679-you warning every hour in the day ! ”[1679-you] [She]1679-you put [her]1679-you arms akimbo , as much as to say [she]1679-you defied [me]0-i ; and , indeed , [I]0-i could hardly tell how to begin to remonstrate with [her]1679-you , so much did [I]0-i feel that [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , in [her]98-miss matty increasing infirmity , needed the attendance of [this kind and faithful woman]1680-this kind and faithful woman . “ Well”—said[0-i] [I]0-i at last . “ [I]0-i ’m thankful [you]1679-you begin with ‘ well ! ’ If [you]1679-you ’d have begun with ‘ but , ’ as [you]1679-you did afore , [I]0-i ’d not ha ’ listened to [you]1679-you . Now [you]1679-you may go on . ”[0-i] “ [I]98-miss matty know [you]1679-you would be a great loss to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , [Martha]98-miss matty ”[98-miss matty] — “ [I]98-miss matty telled [her]98-miss matty so . A loss [she]98-miss matty ’d never cease to be sorry for , ”[98-miss matty] broke in [Martha]98-miss matty triumphantly . “ Still , [she]98-miss matty will have so little — so very little — to live upon , that [I]98-miss matty do n’t see just now how [she]98-miss matty could find [you]1679-you food — [she]98-miss matty will even be pressed for [her]98-miss matty own . [I]98-miss matty tell [you]1679-you this , [Martha]98-miss matty , because [I]98-miss matty feel [you]1679-you are like [a friend to dear [Miss Matty]98-miss matty]3335-a friend to dear miss matty , but [you]1679-you know [she]98-miss matty might not like to have it spoken about . ”[98-miss matty] Apparently this was even a blacker view of the subject than [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had presented to [her]98-miss matty , for [Martha]98-miss matty just sat down on the first chair that came to hand , and cried out loud ( [we]1681-we had been standing in [the kitchen]635-the kitchen ) . At last [she]98-miss matty put [her]98-miss matty apron down , and looking [me]0-i earnestly in the face , asked , “ Was that the reason [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would n’t order a pudding to - day ? [She]98-miss matty said [she]98-miss matty had no great fancy for sweet things , and [you]1679-you and [she]98-miss matty would just have a mutton chop . But [I]98-miss matty ’ll be up to [her]98-miss matty . Never [you]1679-you tell , but [I]98-miss matty ’ll make [her]98-miss matty a pudding , and a pudding [she]98-miss matty ’ll like , too , and [I]98-miss matty ’ll pay for it [myself]98-miss matty ; so mind [you]1679-you see [she]98-miss matty eats it . [Many a one]2265-many a one has been comforted in [their]2265-many a one sorrow by seeing a good dish come upon the table . ”[98-miss matty] [I]0-i was rather glad that [Martha]98-miss matty ’s energy had taken the immediate and practical direction of pudding - making , for it staved off the quarrelsome discussion as to whether [she]98-miss matty should or should not leave [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s service . [She]98-miss matty began to tie on a clean apron , and otherwise prepare [herself]98-miss matty for going to [the shop]716-the shop for the butter , eggs , and what else [she]98-miss matty might require . [She]98-miss matty would not use a scrap of the articles already in [the house]2059-the house for [her]98-miss matty cookery , but went to an old tea - pot in which [her]98-miss matty private store of money was deposited , and took out what [she]98-miss matty wanted . [I]0-i found [Miss Matty]98-miss matty very quiet , and not a little sad ; but by - and - by [she]98-miss matty tried to smile for [my]0-i sake . It was settled that [I]0-i was to write to [[my]0-i father]2082-my father , and ask [him]2082-my father to come over and hold a consultation , and as soon as this letter was despatched [we]1686-we began to talk over future plans . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s idea was to take [a single room]1687-a single room , and retain as much of [her]98-miss matty furniture as would be necessary to fit up this , and sell the rest , and there to quietly exist upon what would remain after paying the rent . For [my]0-i part , [I]0-i was more ambitious and less contented . [I]0-i thought of all the things by which [a woman , past middle age]1688-a woman , past middle age , and with the education common to [ladies]2218-ladies fifty years ago , could earn or add to a living without materially losing caste ; but at length [I]0-i put even this last clause on one side , and wondered what in [the world]333-the world [Miss Matty]98-miss matty could do . Teaching was , of course , the first thing that suggested itself . If [Miss Matty]98-miss matty could teach [children]1116-children anything , it would throw [her]98-miss matty among the little elves in whom [her]98-miss matty soul delighted . [I]0-i ran over [her]98-miss matty accomplishments .
