Once upon a time [I]0-i had heard [her]98-miss matty say [she]98-miss matty could play “ Ah ! vous dirai - je , [maman]3337-maman ? ”[98-miss matty] on the piano , but that was long , long ago ; that faint shadow of musical acquirement had died out years before . [She]98-miss matty had also once been able to trace out patterns very nicely for muslin embroidery , by dint of placing a piece of silver paper over the design to be copied , and holding both against the window - pane while [she]98-miss matty marked the scollop and eyelet - holes . But that was [her]98-miss matty nearest approach to the accomplishment of drawing , and [I]0-i did not think it would go very far . Then again , as to the branches of a solid English education — fancy work and the use of the globes — such as the mistress of [the Ladies ’ Seminary]1692-the ladies ’ seminary , to which [all the tradespeople in [Cranford]1-cranford]1693-all the tradespeople in cranford sent [[their]1693-all the tradespeople in cranford daughters]1694-their daughters , professed to teach . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s eyes were failing [her]98-miss matty , and [I]0-i doubted if [she]98-miss matty could discover the number of threads in a worsted - work pattern , or rightly appreciate the different shades required for [Queen Adelaide]164-queen adelaide ’s face in the loyal wool - work now fashionable in [Cranford]1-cranford . As for the use of the globes , [I]0-i had never been able to find it out [myself]0-i , so perhaps [I]0-i was not a good judge of [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s capability of instructing in this branch of education ; but it struck [me]0-i that equators and tropics , and such mystical circles , were very imaginary lines indeed to [her]98-miss matty , and that [she]98-miss matty looked upon the signs of the Zodiac as so many remnants of the Black Art . What [she]98-miss matty piqued [herself]98-miss matty upon , as arts in which [she]98-miss matty excelled , was making candle - lighters , or “ spills ”[98-miss matty] ( as [she]98-miss matty preferred calling them ) , of coloured paper , cut so as to resemble feathers , and knitting garters in a variety of dainty stitches . [I]0-i had once said , on receiving a present of an elaborate pair , that [I]0-i should feel quite tempted to drop one of them in [the street]467-the street , in order to have it admired ; but [I]0-i found this little joke ( and it was a very little one ) was such a distress to [her]98-miss matty sense of propriety , and was taken with such anxious , earnest alarm , lest the temptation might some day prove too strong for [me]0-i , that [I]0-i quite regretted having ventured upon it . A present of these delicately - wrought garters , a bunch of gay “ spills , ”[98-miss matty] or a set of cards on which sewing - silk was wound in a mystical manner , were the well - known tokens of [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s favour . But would [any one]2107-any one pay to have [[their]2107-any one children]1697-their children taught these arts ? or , indeed , would [Miss Matty]98-miss matty sell , for filthy lucre , the knack and the skill with which [she]98-miss matty made trifles of value to those who loved [her]98-miss matty ? [I]0-i had to come down to reading , writing , and arithmetic ; and , in reading the chapter every morning , [she]98-miss matty always coughed before coming to long words . [I]0-i doubted [her]98-miss matty power of getting through a genealogical chapter , with any number of coughs . Writing [she]98-miss matty did well and delicately — but spelling ! [She]98-miss matty seemed to think that the more out - of - the - way this was , and the more trouble it cost [her]98-miss matty , the greater the compliment [she]98-miss matty paid to [[her]98-miss matty correspondent]1698-her correspondent ; and words that [she]98-miss matty would spell quite correctly in [her]98-miss matty letters to [me]0-i became perfect enigmas when [she]98-miss matty wrote to [[my]0-i father]2082-my father . No ! there was nothing [she]98-miss matty could teach to [the rising generation of [Cranford]1-cranford]1700-the rising generation of cranford , unless [they]1700-the rising generation of cranford had been [quick learners]1701-quick learners and ready imitators of [her]98-miss matty patience , [her]98-miss matty humility , [her]98-miss matty sweetness , [her]98-miss matty quiet contentment with all that [she]98-miss matty could not do . [I]0-i pondered and pondered until dinner was announced by [Martha]98-miss matty , with a face all blubbered and swollen with crying . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had a few little peculiarities which [Martha]98-miss matty was apt to regard as whims below [her]98-miss matty attention , and appeared to consider as childish fancies of which [an old lady of fifty - eight]1702-an old lady of fifty - eight should try and cure [herself]1702-an old lady of fifty - eight . But to - day everything was attended to with the most careful regard . The bread was cut to the imaginary pattern of excellence that existed in [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s mind , as being the way which [[her]98-miss matty mother]439-her mother had preferred , the curtain was drawn so as to exclude the dead brick wall of [[a neighbour]1704-a neighbour ’s stable]1705-a neighbour ’s stable , and yet left so as to show every tender leaf of the poplar which was bursting into spring beauty . [Martha]98-miss matty ’s tone to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was just such as [that good , rough - spoken servant usually kept sacred for [little children]1384-little children]1706-that good , rough - spoken servant usually kept sacred for little children , and which [I]0-i had never heard [her]98-miss matty use to [any grown - up person]1708-any grown - up person . [I]0-i had forgotten to tell [Miss Matty]98-miss matty about the pudding , and [I]0-i was afraid [she]98-miss matty might not do justice to it , for [she]98-miss matty had evidently very little appetite this day ; so [I]0-i seized the opportunity of letting [her]98-miss matty into the secret while [Martha]98-miss matty took away the meat . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s eyes filled with tears , and [she]98-miss matty could not speak , either to express surprise or delight , when [Martha]98-miss matty returned bearing it aloft , made in the most wonderful representation of a lion _ couchant _ that ever was moulded . [Martha]98-miss matty ’s face gleamed with triumph as [she]98-miss matty set it down before [Miss Matty]98-miss matty with an exultant “ There ! ”[98-miss matty] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty wanted to speak [her]98-miss matty thanks , but could not ; so [she]98-miss matty took [Martha]98-miss matty ’s hand and shook it warmly , which set [Martha]98-miss matty off crying , and [I]0-i [myself]0-i could hardly keep up the necessary composure . [Martha]98-miss matty burst out of [the room]370-the room , and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had to clear [her]98-miss matty voice once or twice before [she]98-miss matty could speak . At last [she]98-miss matty said , “ [I]98-miss matty should like to keep this pudding under a glass shade , [[my]98-miss matty dear]2063-my dear ! ”[98-miss matty] and the notion of [the lion _ couchant _]1710-the lion _ couchant _ , with [his]1710-the lion _ couchant _ currant eyes , being hoisted up to the place of honour on a mantelpiece , tickled [my]0-i hysterical fancy , and [I]0-i began to laugh , which rather surprised [Miss Matty]98-miss matty . “ [I]98-miss matty am sure , [dear]2179-dear , [I]98-miss matty have seen uglier things under a glass shade before now , ”[98-miss matty] said [she]98-miss matty . So had [I]0-i , many a time and oft , and [I]0-i accordingly composed [my]0-i countenance ( and now [I]0-i could hardly keep from crying ) , and [we]1711-we both fell to upon the pudding , which was indeed excellent — only every morsel seemed to choke [us]1711-we , [our]1711-we hearts were so full . [We]1711-we had too much to think about to talk much that afternoon . It passed over very tranquilly . But when the tea - urn was brought in a new thought came into [my]0-i head . Why should not [Miss Matty]98-miss matty sell tea — be [an agent to [the East India Tea Company which then existed]1713-the east india tea company which then existed]1712-an agent to the east india tea company which then existed ? [I]0-i could see no objections to this plan , while the advantages were many — always supposing that [Miss Matty]98-miss matty could get over the degradation of condescending to anything like trade . Tea was neither greasy nor sticky — grease and stickiness being two of the qualities which [Miss Matty]98-miss matty could not endure . [No shop]1714-no shop - window would be required . A small , genteel notification of [her]98-miss matty being licensed to sell tea would , it is true , be necessary , but [I]0-i hoped that it could be placed where [no one]477-no one would see it . Neither was tea a heavy article , so as to tax [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s fragile strength . The only thing against [my]0-i plan was the buying and selling involved . While [I]0-i was giving but absent answers to the questions [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was putting — almost as absently — [we]1711-we heard a clumping sound on the stairs , and a whispering outside the door , which indeed once opened and shut as if by some invisible agency . After a little while [Martha]98-miss matty came in , dragging after [her]98-miss matty [a great tall young man]1716-a great tall young man , all crimson with shyness , and finding [his]1716-a great tall young man only relief in perpetually sleeking down [his]1716-a great tall young man hair . “ Please , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , [he]1716-a great tall young man ’s only [Jem Hearn]133-jem , ”[98-miss matty] said [Martha]98-miss matty , by way of an introduction ; and so out of breath was [she]98-miss matty that [I]0-i imagine [she]98-miss matty had had some bodily struggle before [she]98-miss matty could overcome [his]1716-a great tall young man reluctance to be presented on the courtly scene of [[Miss Matilda Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns ’s drawing - room]1717-miss matilda jenkyns ’s drawing - room . “ And please , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , [he]1716-a great tall young man wants to marry [me]86-miss jenkyns off - hand . And please , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , [we]3343-we want to take [a lodger]3344-a lodger — just [one quiet lodger]3345-one quiet lodger , to make [our]3343-we two ends meet ; and [we]3343-we ’d take any house conformable ; and , oh dear [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , if [I]86-miss jenkyns may be so bold , would [you]98-miss matty have any objections to lodging with [us]3343-we ? [Jem]133-jem wants it as much as [I]86-miss jenkyns do . ”[86-miss jenkyns] [ To [Jem]133-jem ] — “ [[You]2067-ma’am great oaf]3346-you great oaf ! why ca n’t [you]2067-ma’am back me!—But [he]133-jem does want it all the same , very bad — don’t [you]2067-ma’am , [Jem?—only]253-jem?—only , [you]2067-ma’am see , [he]133-jem ’s dazed at being called on to speak before quality . ”[86-miss jenkyns] [ Picture : Please , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , [he]133-jem wants to marry [me]0-i off - hand ] “ It ’s not that , ”[133-jem] broke in [Jem]133-jem . “ It ’s that [you]98-miss matty ’ve taken [me]133-jem all on a sudden , and [I]133-jem did n’t think for to get married so soon — and such quick words does flabbergast [a man]2058-a man . It ’s not that [I]133-jem ’m against it , [ma’am]2067-ma’am ”[133-jem] ( addressing [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ) , “ only [Martha]98-miss matty has such quick ways with [her]98-miss matty when once [she]98-miss matty takes a thing into [her]98-miss matty head ; and marriage , [ma’am]2067-ma’am — marriage nails [a man]2058-a man , as [one]2460-one may say . [I]133-jem dare say [I]133-jem sha n’t mind it after it ’s once over . ”[133-jem] “ Please , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , ”[98-miss matty] said [Martha]98-miss matty — who had plucked at [his]133-jem sleeve , and nudged [him]133-jem with [her]98-miss matty elbow , and otherwise tried to interrupt [him]133-jem all the time [he]133-jem had been speaking—“don’t mind [him]133-jem , [he]133-jem ’ll come to ; ’ twas only last night [he]133-jem was an - axing [me]98-miss matty , and an - axing [me]98-miss matty , and all the more because [I]98-miss matty said [I]98-miss matty could not think of it for years to come , and now [he]133-jem ’s only taken aback with the suddenness of the joy ; but [you]2067-ma’am know , [Jem]133-jem , [you]2067-ma’am are just as full as [me]98-miss matty about wanting [a lodger]3344-a lodger . ”[98-miss matty] ( Another great nudge . ) “ [Ay]254-ay ! if [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would lodge with [us]1720-their — otherwise [I]133-jem ’ve no mind to be cumbered with [strange folk in [the house]2059-the house]3354-strange folk in the house , ”[133-jem] said [Jem]133-jem , with a want of tact which [I]0-i could see enraged [Martha]98-miss matty , who was trying to represent [a lodger]3344-a lodger as the great object [they]1720-their wished to obtain , and that , in fact , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would be smoothing [their]1720-their path and conferring a favour , if [she]98-miss matty would only come and live with [them]1720-their . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty [herself]98-miss matty was bewildered by [the pair]1721-the pair ; [their]1720-their , or rather [Martha]98-miss matty ’s sudden resolution in favour of matrimony staggered [her]98-miss matty , and stood between [her]98-miss matty and the contemplation of the plan which [Martha]98-miss matty had at heart . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty began — “ Marriage is a very solemn thing , [Martha]98-miss matty . ”[98-miss matty] “ It is indeed , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , ”[98-miss matty] quoth [Jem]133-jem . “ Not that [I]98-miss matty ’ve no objections to [Martha]98-miss matty . ”[98-miss matty] “ [You]98-miss matty ’ve never let [me]98-miss matty a - be for asking [me]98-miss matty for to fix when [I]98-miss matty would be married , ”[98-miss matty] said [Martha]98-miss matty — [her]98-miss matty face all a - fire , and ready to cry with vexation—“and now [you]98-miss matty ’re shaming [me]98-miss matty before [my]98-miss matty missus and all . ”[98-miss matty] “ Nay , now ! [Martha]98-miss matty do n’t ee ! do n’t ee ! only [a man]2058-a man likes to have breathing - time , ”[133-jem] said [Jem]133-jem , trying to possess [himself]133-jem of [her]98-miss matty hand , but in vain . Then seeing that [she]98-miss matty was more seriously hurt than [he]133-jem had imagined , [he]133-jem seemed to try to rally [his]133-jem scattered faculties , and with more straightforward dignity than , ten minutes before , [I]0-i should have thought it possible for [him]133-jem to assume , [he]133-jem turned to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , and said , “ [I]133-jem hope , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , [you]2067-ma’am know that [I]133-jem am bound to respect [every one who has been kind to [Martha]98-miss matty]3359-every one who has been kind to martha . [I]133-jem always looked on [her]98-miss matty as to be [[my]133-jem wife]3360-my wife — some time ; and [she]98-miss matty has often and often spoken of [you]2067-ma’am as [the kindest lady that ever was]3361-the kindest lady that ever was ; and though the plain truth is , [I]133-jem would not like to be troubled with [lodgers of the common run]3362-lodgers of the common run , yet if , [ma’am]2067-ma’am , [you]2067-ma’am ’d honour [us]3364-us by living with [us]3364-us , [I]133-jem ’m sure [Martha]98-miss matty would do [her]98-miss matty best to make [you]2067-ma’am comfortable ; and [I]133-jem ’d keep out of [your]2067-ma’am way as much as [I]133-jem could , which [I]133-jem reckon would be the best kindness such an awkward chap as [me]133-jem could do . ”[133-jem] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had been very busy with taking off [her]98-miss matty spectacles , wiping them , and replacing them ; but all [she]98-miss matty could say was , “ Do n’t let any thought of [me]98-miss matty hurry [you]2067-ma’am into marriage : pray do n’t . Marriage is such a very solemn thing ! ”[98-miss matty] “ But [Miss Matilda]86-miss jenkyns will think of [your]2067-ma’am plan , [Martha]98-miss matty , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , struck with the advantages that it offered , and unwilling to lose the opportunity of considering about it . “ And [I]0-i ’m sure neither [she]98-miss matty nor [I]0-i can ever forget [your]2067-ma’am kindness ; nor [yours]2067-ma’am either , [Jem]133-jem . ”[0-i] “ Why , yes , [ma’am]2067-ma’am ! [I]98-miss matty ’m sure [I]98-miss matty mean kindly , though [I]98-miss matty ’m a bit fluttered by being pushed straight ahead into matrimony , as it were , and may n’t express [myself]98-miss matty conformable . But [I]98-miss matty ’m sure [I]98-miss matty ’m willing enough , and give [me]98-miss matty time to get accustomed ; so , [Martha]98-miss matty , [wench]3366-wench , what ’s the use of crying so , and slapping [me]98-miss matty if [I]98-miss matty come near ? ”[98-miss matty] This last was _ sotto voce _ , and had the effect of making [Martha]98-miss matty bounce out of [the room]370-the room , to be followed and soothed by [[her]98-miss matty lover]861-her lover . Whereupon [Miss Matty]98-miss matty sat down and cried very heartily , and accounted for it by saying that the thought of [Martha]98-miss matty being married so soon gave [her]98-miss matty quite a shock , and that [she]98-miss matty should never forgive [herself]98-miss matty if [she]98-miss matty thought [she]98-miss matty was hurrying [the poor creature]2068-the poor creature . [I]0-i think [my]0-i pity was more for [Jem]133-jem , of [the two]2648-the two ; but both [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [I]0-i appreciated to the full the kindness of [the honest couple]1726-the honest couple , although [we]1727-we said little about this , and a good deal about the chances and dangers of matrimony . The next morning , very early , [I]0-i received a note from [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , so mysteriously wrapped up , and with so many seals on it to secure secrecy , that [I]0-i had to tear the paper before [I]0-i could unfold it . And when [I]0-i came to the writing [I]0-i could hardly understand the meaning , it was so involved and oracular . [I]0-i made out , however , that [I]0-i was to go to [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s at eleven o’clock ; the number _ eleven _ being written in full length as well as in numerals , and _ A.M. _ twice dashed under , as if [I]0-i were very likely to come at eleven at night , when all [Cranford]96-signor brunoni was usually abed and asleep by ten . There was no signature except [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s initials reversed , P.E. ; but as [Martha]98-miss matty had given [me]0-i the note , “ with [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s kind regards , ”[98-miss matty] it needed [no wizard]1728-no wizard to find out who sent it ; and if [the writer]1729-the writer ’s name was to be kept secret , it was very well that [I]0-i was alone when [Martha]98-miss matty delivered it . [I]0-i went as requested to [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s . The door was opened to [me]0-i by [[her]89-miss pole little maid]1730-her little maid [Lizzy]81-miss barker in Sunday trim , as if some grand event was impending over this work - day . And [the drawing - room]503-the drawing - room [upstairs]340-upstairs was arranged in accordance with this idea . The table was set out with the best green card - cloth , and writing materials upon it . On the little chiffonier was a tray with a newly - decanted bottle of cowslip wine , and some ladies’-finger biscuits . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole [herself]89-miss pole was in solemn array , as if to receive [visitors]1733-visitors , although it was only eleven o’clock . [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester was there , crying quietly and sadly , and [my]0-i arrival seemed only to call forth fresh tears . Before [we]1734-we had finished [our]1734-we greetings , performed with lugubrious mystery of demeanour , there was another rat - tat - tat , and [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam appeared , crimson with walking and excitement . It seemed as if this was all [the company]2074-the company expected ; for now [Miss Pole]89-miss pole made several demonstrations of being about to open the business of the meeting , by stirring the fire , opening and shutting the door , and coughing and blowing [her]89-miss pole nose . Then [she]89-miss pole arranged [us]1734-we all round the table , taking care to place [me]0-i opposite to [her]89-miss pole ; and last of all , [she]89-miss pole inquired of [me]0-i if the sad report was true , as [she]89-miss pole feared it was , that [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had lost all [her]98-miss matty fortune ? Of course , [I]0-i had but one answer to make ; and [I]0-i never saw more unaffected sorrow depicted on any countenances than [I]0-i did there on the three before [me]0-i . “ [I]77-mrs forrester wish [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson was here ! ”[77-mrs forrester] said [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester at last ; but to judge from [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam ’s face , [she]77-mrs forrester could not second the wish . “ But without [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson , ”[89-miss pole] said [Miss Pole]89-miss pole , with just a sound of offended merit in [her]89-miss pole voice , “ [we]3367-we , [the ladies of [Cranford]1-cranford]300-the ladies of cranford , in [[my]89-miss pole drawing - room]3369-my drawing - room assembled , can resolve upon something . [I]89-miss pole imagine [we]3367-we are none of [us]3367-we what may be called rich , though [we]3367-we all possess a genteel competency , sufficient for tastes that are elegant and refined , and would not , if [they]3370-they could , be vulgarly ostentatious . ”[89-miss pole] ( Here [I]0-i observed [Miss Pole]89-miss pole refer to a small card concealed in [her]89-miss pole hand , on which [I]0-i imagine [she]89-miss pole had put down a few notes . ) “ [Miss Smith]255-miss smith , ”[89-miss pole] [she]89-miss pole continued , addressing [me]0-i ( familiarly known as “ [Mary]109-mary ”[89-miss pole] to [all the company assembled]1736-all the company assembled , but this was a state occasion ) , “ [I]89-miss pole have conversed in private — [I]89-miss pole made it [my]89-miss pole business to do so yesterday afternoon — with [these ladies]3371-these ladies on the misfortune which has happened to [[our]3367-we friend]493-our friend , and one and all of [us]3367-we have agreed that while [we]3367-we have a superfluity , it is not only a duty , but a pleasure — a true pleasure , [Mary!”—her]256-mary!”—her[89-miss pole] voice was rather choked just here , and [she]89-miss pole had to wipe [her]89-miss pole spectacles before [she]89-miss pole could go on—“to give what [we]3367-we can to assist [her]89-miss pole — [Miss Matilda Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns . Only in consideration of the feelings of delicate independence existing in the mind of every refined [female”—I]3373-female”—i[89-miss pole] was sure [she]89-miss pole had got back to the card now—“we wish to contribute [our]3367-we mites in a secret and concealed manner , so as not to hurt the feelings [I]89-miss pole have referred to . And [our]3367-we object in requesting [you]3374-you to meet [us]3367-we this morning is that , believing [you]3374-you are [the daughter]3375-the daughter — that [[your]3374-you father]2350-your father is , in fact , [[her]89-miss pole confidential adviser]3377-her confidential adviser , in all pecuniary matters , [we]3367-we imagined that , by consulting with [him]2350-your father , [you]3374-you might devise some mode in which [our]3367-we contribution could be made to appear the legal due which [Miss Matilda Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns ought to receive from — — Probably [[your]3374-you father]2350-your father , knowing [her]89-miss pole investments , can fill up the blank . ”[89-miss pole] [Miss Pole]89-miss pole concluded [her]89-miss pole address , and looked round for approval and agreement . “ [I]89-miss pole have expressed [your]3374-you meaning , [ladies]2218-ladies , have [I]89-miss pole not ? And while [Miss Smith]255-miss smith considers what reply to make , allow [me]89-miss pole to offer [you]3374-you some little refreshment . ”[89-miss pole] [I]0-i had no great reply to make : [I]0-i had more thankfulness at [my]0-i heart for [their]1737-their kind thoughts than [I]0-i cared to put into words ; and so [I]0-i only mumbled out something to the effect “ that [I]0-i would name what [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had said to [[my]0-i father]2082-my father , and that if anything could be arranged for [dear Miss Matty,”—and]257-dear miss matty,”—and[0-i] [here]2357-here [I]0-i broke down utterly , and had to be refreshed with a glass of cowslip wine before [I]0-i could check the crying which had been repressed for the last two or three days . The worst was , [all the ladies]461-all the ladies cried in concert . Even [Miss Pole]89-miss pole cried , who had said a hundred times that to betray emotion before any one was a sign of weakness and want of self - control . [She]89-miss pole recovered [herself]89-miss pole into a slight degree of impatient anger , directed against [me]0-i , as having set them all off ; and , moreover , [I]0-i think [she]89-miss pole was vexed that [I]0-i could not make a speech back in return for [hers]89-miss pole ; and if [I]0-i had known beforehand what was to be said , and had a card on which to express the probable feelings that would rise in [my]0-i heart , [I]0-i would have tried to gratify [her]89-miss pole . As it was , [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester was [the person to speak]1740-the person to speak when [we]1741-we had recovered [our]1741-we composure . “ [I]1740-the person to speak do n’t mind , among [friends]3381-friends , stating that [I]1740-the person to speak — no ! [I]1740-the person to speak ’m not poor exactly , but [I]1740-the person to speak do n’t think [I]1740-the person to speak ’m what [you]3381-friends may call rich ; [I]1740-the person to speak wish [I]1740-the person to speak were , for dear [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s sake — but , if [you]3381-friends please , [I]1740-the person to speak ’ll write down in a sealed paper what [I]1740-the person to speak can give . [I]1740-the person to speak only wish it was more ; [[my]1740-the person to speak dear]2063-my dear [Mary]109-mary , [I]1740-the person to speak do indeed . ”[1740-the person to speak] Now [I]0-i saw why paper , pens , and ink were provided . [Every lady]3217-every lady wrote down the sum [she]3217-every lady could give annually , signed the paper , and sealed it mysteriously . If [their]3217-every lady proposal was acceded to , [[my]0-i father]2082-my father was to be allowed to open the papers , under pledge of secrecy . If not , they were to be returned to [[their]3217-every lady writers]1744-their writers . When the ceremony had been gone through , [I]0-i rose to depart ; but [each lady]3222-each lady seemed to wish to have a private conference with [me]0-i . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole kept [me]0-i in [the drawing - room]503-the drawing - room to explain why , in [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s absence , [she]89-miss pole had taken the lead in this “ movement , ”[89-miss pole] as [she]89-miss pole was pleased to call it , and also to inform [me]0-i that [she]89-miss pole had heard from good sources that [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson was coming [home]306-home directly in a state of high displeasure against [[[her]78-mrs jamieson sister]394-her sister - in - law , who was forthwith to leave [[her]78-mrs jamieson house]600-her house , and was , [she]89-miss pole believed , to return to [Edinburgh]9-edinburgh that very afternoon]1749-her sister - in - law , who was forthwith to leave her house , and was , she believed , to return to edinburgh that very afternoon . Of course this piece of intelligence could not be communicated before [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam , more especially as [Miss Pole]89-miss pole was inclined to think that [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire ’s engagement to [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins could not possibly hold against the blaze of [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s displeasure . A few hearty inquiries after [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s health concluded [my]0-i interview with [Miss Pole]89-miss pole . On coming [downstairs]1135-downstairs [I]0-i found [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester waiting for [me]0-i at the entrance to [the dining - parlour]858-the dining - parlour ; [she]89-miss pole drew [me]0-i in , and when the door was shut , [she]89-miss pole tried two or three times to begin on some subject , which was so unapproachable apparently , that [I]0-i began to despair of [our]1753-our ever getting to a clear understanding . At last out it came ; [the poor old lady]1754-the poor old lady trembling all the time as if it were a great crime which [she]1754-the poor old lady was exposing to daylight , in telling [me]0-i how very , very little [she]1754-the poor old lady had to live upon ; a confession which [she]1754-the poor old lady was brought to make from a dread lest [we]1753-our should think that the small contribution named in [her]1754-the poor old lady paper bore any proportion to [her]1754-the poor old lady love and regard for [Miss Matty]98-miss matty . And yet that sum which [she]1754-the poor old lady so eagerly relinquished was , in truth , more than a twentieth part of what [she]1754-the poor old lady had to live upon , and keep [house]2425-house , and [a little serving - maid]1756-a little serving - maid , all as became one born a [Tyrrell]258-tyrrell . And when the whole income does not nearly amount to a hundred pounds , to give up a twentieth of it will necessitate many careful economies , and many pieces of self - denial , small and insignificant in [the world]333-the world ’s account , but bearing a different value in another account - book that [I]0-i have heard of . [She]1754-the poor old lady did so wish [she]1754-the poor old lady was rich , [she]1754-the poor old lady said , and this wish [she]1754-the poor old lady kept repeating , with no thought of [herself]1754-the poor old lady in it , only with a longing , yearning desire to be able to heap up [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s measure of comforts . It was some time before [I]0-i could console [her]1754-the poor old lady enough to leave [her]1754-the poor old lady ; and then , on quitting [the house]2059-the house , [I]0-i was waylaid by [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam , who had also [her]1754-the poor old lady confidence to make of pretty nearly the opposite description . [She]1754-the poor old lady had not liked to put down all that [she]1754-the poor old lady could afford and was ready to give . [She]1754-the poor old lady told [me]0-i [she]1754-the poor old lady thought [she]1754-the poor old lady never could look [Miss Matty]98-miss matty in the face again if [she]1754-the poor old lady presumed to be giving [her]98-miss matty so much as [she]1754-the poor old lady should like to do . “ [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ! ”[1754-the poor old lady] continued [she]1754-the poor old lady , “ that [I]1754-the poor old lady thought was such [a fine young lady]3383-a fine young lady when [I]1754-the poor old lady was nothing but [a country girl]3384-a country girl , coming to market with eggs and butter and such like things . For [[my]1754-the poor old lady father]2082-my father , though well - to - do , would always make [me]1754-the poor old lady go on as [[my]1754-the poor old lady mother]2400-my mother had done before [me]1754-the poor old lady , and [I]1754-the poor old lady had to come into [Cranford]1-cranford every Saturday , and see after sales , and prices , and what not . And one day , [I]1754-the poor old lady remember , [I]1754-the poor old lady met [Miss Matty]98-miss matty in [the lane that leads to [Combehurst]66-combehurst]3387-the lane that leads to combehurst ; [she]98-miss matty was walking on the footpath , which , [you]3388-you know , is raised a good way above [the road]3389-the road , and [a gentleman]321-a gentleman rode beside [her]98-miss matty , and was talking to [her]98-miss matty , and [she]98-miss matty was looking down at some primroses [she]98-miss matty had gathered , and pulling them all to pieces , and [I]1754-the poor old lady do believe [she]98-miss matty was crying . But after [she]98-miss matty had passed , [she]98-miss matty turned round and ran after [me]1754-the poor old lady to ask — oh , so kindly — about [[my]1754-the poor old lady poor mother]2342-my poor mother , who lay on [her]2342-my poor mother death - bed ; and when [I]1754-the poor old lady cried [she]98-miss matty took hold of [my]1754-the poor old lady hand to comfort [me]1754-the poor old lady — and the gentleman waiting for [her]98-miss matty all the time — and [her]98-miss matty poor heart very full of something , [I]1754-the poor old lady am sure ; and [I]1754-the poor old lady thought it such an honour to be spoken to in that pretty way by [[the rector]2120-the rector ’s daughter , who visited at [Arley Hall]23-arley hall]3393-the rector ’s daughter , who visited at arley hall . [I]1754-the poor old lady have loved [her]98-miss matty ever since , though perhaps [I]1754-the poor old lady ’d no right to do it ; but if [you]3394-you can think of any way in which [I]1754-the poor old lady might be allowed to give a little more without [any one]2107-any one knowing it , [I]1754-the poor old lady should be so much obliged to [you]3394-you , [[my]1754-the poor old lady dear]2063-my dear . And [[my]1754-the poor old lady brother]3397-my brother would be delighted to doctor [her]98-miss matty for nothing — medicines , leeches , and all . [I]1754-the poor old lady know that [he]3397-my brother and [[her]98-miss matty ladyship]1362-her ladyship ( [[my]1754-the poor old lady dear]2063-my dear , [I]1754-the poor old lady little thought in the days [I]1754-the poor old lady was telling [you]3394-you of that [I]1754-the poor old lady should ever come to be [sister - in - law]3400-sister - in - law to [a ladyship]3401-a ladyship ! ) would do anything for [her]98-miss matty . [We]3402-we all would . ”[1754-the poor old lady] [I]0-i told [her]1759-her [I]0-i was quite sure of it , and promised all sorts of things in [my]0-i anxiety to get [home]306-home to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , who might well be wondering what had become of [me]0-i — absent from [her]98-miss matty two hours without being able to account for it . [She]1759-her had taken very little note of time , however , as [she]1759-her had been occupied in numberless little arrangements preparatory to the great step of giving up [[her]1759-her house]600-her house . It was evidently a relief to [her]1759-her to be doing something in the way of retrenchment , for , as [she]1759-her said , whenever [she]1759-her paused to think , the recollection of [the poor fellow with [his]1762-the poor fellow with his bad five - pound note bad five - pound note]1762-the poor fellow with his bad five - pound note came over [her]1759-her , and [she]1759-her felt quite dishonest ; only if it made [her]1759-her so uncomfortable , what must it not be doing to [the directors of [the bank]1628-the bank]1763-the directors of the bank , who must know so much more of the misery consequent upon this failure ? [She]1759-her almost made [me]0-i angry by dividing [her]1759-her sympathy between [these directors]1765-these directors ( whom [she]1759-her imagined overwhelmed by self - reproach for the mismanagement of [other people]1766-other people ’s affairs ) and [those who were suffering like [her]1759-her]1767-those who were suffering like her . Indeed , of [the two]2648-the two , [she]1759-her seemed to think poverty a lighter burden than self - reproach ; but [I]0-i privately doubted if [the directors]1769-the directors would agree with [her]1759-her . Old hoards were taken out and examined as to [their]1770-their money value which luckily was small , or else [I]0-i do n’t know how [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would have prevailed upon [herself]98-miss matty to part with such things as [[her]98-miss matty mother]439-her mother ’s wedding - ring , the strange , uncouth brooch with which [[her]98-miss matty father]397-her father had disfigured [his]397-her father shirt - frill , & amp;c . However , [we]1773-we arranged things a little in order as to [their]1774-their pecuniary estimation , and were all ready for [[my]0-i father]2082-my father when [he]2082-my father came the next morning . [I]0-i am not going to weary [you]1776-you with the details of all the business [we]1773-we went through ; and one reason for not telling about them is , that [I]0-i did not understand what [we]1773-we were doing at the time , and can not recollect it now . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [I]0-i sat assenting to accounts , and schemes , and reports , and documents , of which [I]0-i do not believe [we]1773-we either of [us]1773-we understood a word ; for [[my]0-i father]2082-my father was clear - headed and decisive , and [a capital man of business]1778-a capital man of business , and if [we]1773-we made the slightest inquiry , or expressed the slightest want of comprehension , [he]2082-my father had a sharp way of saying , “ Eh ? eh ? it ’s as clear as daylight . What ’s [your]98-miss matty objection ? ”[2082-my father] And as [we]1773-we had not comprehended anything of what [he]2082-my father had proposed , [we]1773-we found it rather difficult to shape [our]1773-we objections ; in fact , [we]1773-we never were sure if [we]1773-we had any . So presently [Miss Matty]98-miss matty got into a nervously acquiescent state , and said “ Yes , ”[98-miss matty] and “ Certainly , ”[98-miss matty] at every pause , whether required or not ; but when [I]0-i once joined in as chorus to a “ Decidedly , ”[98-miss matty] pronounced by [Miss Matty]98-miss matty in a tremblingly dubious tone , [[my]0-i father]2082-my father fired round at [me]0-i and asked [me]0-i “ What there was to decide ? ”[0-i] And [I]0-i am sure to this day [I]0-i have never known . But , in justice to [him]2082-my father , [I]0-i must say [he]2082-my father had come over from [Drumble]2-drumble to help [Miss Matty]98-miss matty when [he]2082-my father could ill spare the time , and when [his]2082-my father own affairs were in a very anxious state . [ Picture : [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [I]0-i sat assenting to accounts ] While [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was out of [the room]370-the room giving orders for luncheon — and sadly perplexed between [her]98-miss matty desire of honouring [[my]0-i father]2082-my father by a delicate , dainty meal , and [her]98-miss matty conviction that [she]98-miss matty had no right , now that all [her]98-miss matty money was gone , to indulge this desire — [I]0-i told [him]2082-my father of the meeting of [the Cranford ladies]305-the cranford ladies at [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s the day before . [He]2082-my father kept brushing [his]2082-my father hand before [his]2082-my father eyes as [I]0-i spoke — and when [I]0-i went back to [Martha]98-miss matty ’s offer the evening before , of receiving [Miss Matty]98-miss matty as [a lodger]3344-a lodger , [he]2082-my father fairly walked away from [me]0-i to the window , and began drumming with [his]2082-my father fingers upon it . Then [he]2082-my father turned abruptly round , and said , “ See , [Mary]109-mary , how a good , innocent life makes [friends all around]3403-friends all around . Confound it ! [I]2082-my father could make a good lesson out of it if [I]2082-my father were [a parson]3404-a parson ; but , as it is , [I]2082-my father ca n’t get a tail to [my]2082-my father sentences — only [I]2082-my father ’m sure [you]109-mary feel what [I]2082-my father want to say . [You]109-mary and [I]2082-my father will have a walk after lunch and talk a bit more about these plans . ”[2082-my father] The lunch — a hot savoury mutton - chop , and a little of the cold loin sliced and fried — was now brought in . Every morsel of this last dish was finished , to [Martha]98-miss matty ’s great gratification . Then [[my]0-i father]2082-my father bluntly told [Miss Matty]98-miss matty [he]2082-my father wanted to talk to [me]0-i alone , and that [he]2082-my father would stroll out and see some of [the old places]1785-the old places , and then [I]0-i could tell [her]98-miss matty what plan [we]1786-we thought desirable . Just before [we]1786-we went out , [she]98-miss matty called [me]0-i back and said , “ Remember , [dear]2179-dear , [I]98-miss matty ’m [the only one left]3406-the only one left — [I]98-miss matty mean , there ’s [no one]477-no one to be hurt by what [I]98-miss matty do . [I]98-miss matty ’m willing to do anything that ’s right and honest ; and [I]98-miss matty do n’t think , if [Deborah]99-deborah knows where [she]99-deborah is , [she]99-deborah ’ll care so very much if [I]98-miss matty ’m not genteel ; because , [you]2179-dear see , [she]99-deborah ’ll know all , [dear]2179-dear . Only let [me]98-miss matty see what [I]98-miss matty can do , and pay [the poor people]2109-the poor people as far as [I]98-miss matty ’m able . ”[98-miss matty] [I]0-i gave [her]1787-her a hearty kiss , and ran after [[my]0-i father]2082-my father . The result of [our]1789-our conversation was this . If all parties were agreeable , [Martha]98-miss matty and [Jem]133-jem were to be married with as little delay as possible , and [they]1790-they were to live on in [[Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s present abode]1791-miss matty ’s present abode ; the sum which [the Cranford ladies]305-the cranford ladies had agreed to contribute annually being sufficient to meet the greater part of the rent , and leaving [Martha]98-miss matty free to appropriate what [Miss Matty]98-miss matty should pay for [her]98-miss matty lodgings to any little extra comforts required . About the sale , [[my]0-i father]2082-my father was dubious at first . [He]2082-my father said the old rectory furniture , however carefully used and reverently treated , would fetch very little ; and that little would be but as a drop in the sea of the debts of [the Town]281-the town and [County Bank]63-county bank . But when [I]0-i represented how [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s tender conscience would be soothed by feeling that [she]98-miss matty had done what [she]98-miss matty could , [he]2082-my father gave way ; especially after [I]0-i had told [him]2082-my father the five - pound note adventure , and [he]2082-my father had scolded [me]0-i well for allowing it . [I]0-i then alluded to [my]0-i idea that [she]98-miss matty might add to [her]98-miss matty small income by selling tea ; and , to [my]0-i surprise ( for [I]0-i had nearly given up the plan ) , [[my]0-i father]2082-my father grasped at it with all the energy of [a tradesman]1796-a tradesman . [I]0-i think [he]2082-my father reckoned [his]2082-my father chickens before they were hatched , for [he]2082-my father immediately ran up the profits of the sales that [she]98-miss matty could effect in [Cranford]1-cranford to more than twenty pounds a year . [The small dining - parlour]1797-the small dining - parlour was to be converted into [a shop]2158-a shop , without any of [its]1797-the small dining - parlour degrading characteristics ; a table was to be the counter ; one window was to be retained unaltered , and the other changed into a glass door . [I]0-i evidently rose in [his]2082-my father estimation for having made this bright suggestion . [I]0-i only hoped [we]1799-we should not both fall in [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s . But [she]98-miss matty was patient and content with all [our]1799-we arrangements . [She]98-miss matty knew , [she]98-miss matty said , that [we]1799-we should do the best [we]1799-we could for [her]98-miss matty ; and [she]98-miss matty only hoped , only stipulated , that [she]98-miss matty should pay every farthing that [she]98-miss matty could be said to owe , for [[her]98-miss matty father]397-her father ’s sake , who had been so respected in [Cranford]1-cranford . [[My]0-i father]2082-my father and [I]0-i had agreed to say as little as possible about [the bank]1628-the bank , indeed never to mention it again , if it could be helped . Some of the plans were evidently a little perplexing to [her]98-miss matty ; but [she]98-miss matty had seen [me]0-i sufficiently snubbed in the morning for want of comprehension to venture on too many inquiries now ; and all passed over well with a hope on [her]98-miss matty part that [no one]477-no one would be hurried into marriage on [her]98-miss matty account . When [we]1799-we came to the proposal that [she]98-miss matty should sell tea , [I]0-i could see it was rather a shock to [her]98-miss matty ; not on account of any personal loss of gentility involved , but only because [she]98-miss matty distrusted [her]98-miss matty own powers of action in a new line of life , and would timidly have preferred a little more privation to any exertion for which [she]98-miss matty feared [she]98-miss matty was unfitted . However , when [she]98-miss matty saw [[my]0-i father]2082-my father was bent upon it , [she]98-miss matty sighed , and said [she]98-miss matty would try ; and if [she]98-miss matty did not do well , of course [she]98-miss matty might give it up . One good thing about it was , [she]98-miss matty did not think [men]491-men ever bought tea ; and it was of [men]491-men particularly [she]98-miss matty was afraid . [They]491-men had such sharp loud ways with [them]491-men ; and did up accounts , and counted [their]491-men change so quickly ! Now , if [she]98-miss matty might only sell comfits to [children]1116-children , [she]98-miss matty was sure [she]98-miss matty could please [them]1116-children ! CHAPTER XV . A HAPPY RETURN BEFORE [I]0-i left [Miss Matty]98-miss matty at [Cranford]1-cranford everything had been comfortably arranged for [her]98-miss matty . Even [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s approval of [her]98-miss matty selling tea had been gained . That oracle had taken a few days to consider whether by so doing [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would forfeit [her]98-miss matty right to the privileges of society in [Cranford]1-cranford . [I]0-i think [she]98-miss matty had some little idea of mortifying [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire by the decision [she]98-miss matty gave at last ; which was to this effect : that whereas [a married woman]1808-a married woman takes [[her]1808-a married woman husband]601-her husband ’s rank by the strict laws of precedence , [an unmarried woman]1810-an unmarried woman retains [the station [[her]1810-an unmarried woman father]397-her father occupied]1811-the station her father occupied . So [Cranford]96-signor brunoni was allowed to visit [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ; and , whether allowed or not , it intended to visit [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire . But what was [our]1813-our surprise — [our]1813-our dismay — when [we]1813-our learnt that [Mr]1814-mr and [_ Mrs Hoggins]105-mr hoggins _ were returning on the following Tuesday ! [Mrs Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ! Had [she]98-miss matty absolutely dropped [her]98-miss matty title , and so , in a spirit of bravado , cut [the aristocracy]3152-the aristocracy to become [a Hoggins]1816-a hoggins ! [She]98-miss matty , who might have been called [Lady Glenmire]182-lady glenmire to [her]98-miss matty dying day ! [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson was pleased . [She]78-mrs jamieson said it only convinced [her]78-mrs jamieson of what [she]78-mrs jamieson had known from the first , that the creature had a low taste . But “ the creature ”[78-mrs jamieson] looked very happy on Sunday at [church]309-church ; nor did [we]1813-our see it necessary to keep [our]1813-our veils down on that side of [our]1813-our bonnets on which [Mr]1818-mr and [Mrs Hoggins]105-mr hoggins sat , as [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson did ; thereby missing all the smiling glory of [his]1818-mr face , and all the becoming blushes of [hers]78-mrs jamieson . [I]0-i am not sure if [Martha]98-miss matty and [Jem]133-jem looked more radiant in the afternoon , when [they]1819-they , too , made [their]1819-they first appearance . [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson soothed the turbulence of [her]78-mrs jamieson soul by having the blinds of [her]78-mrs jamieson windows drawn down , as if for a funeral , on the day when [Mr and Mrs Hoggins]105-mr hoggins received callers ; and it was with some difficulty that [she]78-mrs jamieson was prevailed upon to continue the _ [St James]194-st james ’s Chronicle _ , so indignant was [she]78-mrs jamieson with [its]1820-its having inserted the announcement of the marriage . [ Picture : Smiling glory ... and becoming blushes ] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s sale went off famously . [She]98-miss matty retained the furniture of [[her]98-miss matty sitting - room]1821-her sitting - room and [bedroom]1822-bedroom ; the former of which [she]98-miss matty was to occupy till [Martha]98-miss matty could meet with [a lodger who might wish to take it]1823-a lodger who might wish to take it ; and into [this sitting - room]1824-this sitting - room and [bedroom]1822-bedroom [she]98-miss matty had to cram all sorts of things , which were ( [the auctioneer]1826-the auctioneer assured [her]98-miss matty ) bought in for [her]98-miss matty at the sale by [an unknown friend]1827-an unknown friend . [I]0-i always suspected [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam of this ; but [she]98-miss matty must have had an accessory , who knew what articles were particularly regarded by [Miss Matty]98-miss matty on account of [their]1828-their associations with [her]98-miss matty early days . The rest of [the house]2059-the house looked rather bare , to be sure ; all except [one tiny bedroom , of which [[my]0-i father]2082-my father]1830-one tiny bedroom , of which my father allowed [me]0-i to purchase the furniture for [my]0-i occasional use in case of [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s illness . [I]0-i had expended [[my]0-i own small store]1832-my own small store in buying all manner of comfits and lozenges , in order to tempt [the little people whom [Miss Matty]98-miss matty loved so much to come about [her]98-miss matty]1833-the little people whom miss matty loved so much to come about her . Tea in bright green canisters , and comfits in tumblers — [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [I]0-i felt quite proud as [we]1834-we looked round [us]1834-we on the evening before [the shop]716-the shop was to be opened . [Martha]98-miss matty had scoured the boarded floor to a white cleanness , and [it]1836-it was adorned with a brilliant piece of oil - cloth , on which [customers]1837-customers were to stand before the table - counter . The wholesome smell of plaster and whitewash pervaded [the apartment]2799-the apartment . A very small “ [Matilda Jenkyns]86-miss jenkyns , licensed to sell tea , ”[98-miss matty] was hidden under the lintel of the new door , and two boxes of tea , with cabalistic inscriptions all over them , stood ready to disgorge their contents into the canisters . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , as [I]0-i ought to have mentioned before , had had some scruples of conscience at selling tea when there was already [Mr Johnson]247-mr johnson in [the town]281-the town , who included it among [his]247-mr johnson numerous commodities ; and , before [she]98-miss matty could quite reconcile [herself]98-miss matty to the adoption of [[her]98-miss matty new business]1840-her new business , [she]98-miss matty had trotted down to [[his]247-mr johnson shop]1841-his shop , unknown to [me]0-i , to tell [him]247-mr johnson of the project that was entertained , and to inquire if it was likely to injure [his]247-mr johnson business . [[My]0-i father]2082-my father called this idea of [hers]98-miss matty “ great nonsense , ”[98-miss matty] and “ wondered how [tradespeople]3410-tradespeople were to get on if there was to be a continual consulting of [each other]302-each other ’s interests , which would put a stop to all competition directly . ”[98-miss matty] And , perhaps , it would not have done in [Drumble]2-drumble , but in [Cranford]1-cranford it answered very well ; for not only did [Mr Johnson]247-mr johnson kindly put at rest all [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s scruples and fear of injuring [his]247-mr johnson business , but [I]0-i have reason to know [he]247-mr johnson repeatedly sent [customers]1837-customers to [her]98-miss matty , saying that the teas [he]247-mr johnson kept were of a common kind , but that [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty had all the choice sorts . And expensive tea is a very favourite luxury with [well - to - do tradespeople and [[rich farmers]1845-rich farmers ’ wives , who turn up [their]1846-rich farmers ’ wives , who turn up their noses at the congou and souchong prevalent at many tables of gentility , and will have nothing else than gunpowder and pekoe for themselves noses at the Congou and [Souchong]67-souchong prevalent at many tables of gentility , and will have nothing else than [Gunpowder]259-gunpowder and [Pekoe]68-pekoe for [themselves]1846-rich farmers ’ wives , who turn up their noses at the congou and souchong prevalent at many tables of gentility , and will have nothing else than gunpowder and pekoe for themselves]1846-rich farmers ’ wives , who turn up their noses at the congou and souchong prevalent at many tables of gentility , and will have nothing else than gunpowder and pekoe for themselves . But to return to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty]1844-well - to - do tradespeople and rich farmers ’ wives , who turn up their noses at the congou and souchong prevalent at many tables of gentility , and will have nothing else than gunpowder and pekoe for themselves . but to return to miss matty . It was really very pleasant to see how [her]98-miss matty unselfishness and simple sense of justice called out the same good qualities in [others]838-others . [She]98-miss matty never seemed to think [any one]2107-any one would impose upon [her]98-miss matty , because [she]98-miss matty should be so grieved to do it to [them]2107-any one . [I]0-i have heard [her]98-miss matty put a stop to the asseverations of [the man who brought [her]98-miss matty coals]1849-the man who brought her coals by quietly saying , “ [I]98-miss matty am sure [you]1849-the man who brought her coals would be sorry to bring [me]98-miss matty wrong weight ; ”[98-miss matty] and if the coals were short measure that time , [I]0-i do n’t believe they ever were again . [People]359-people would have felt as much ashamed of presuming on [her]98-miss matty good faith as [they]359-people would have done on that of [a child]2069-a child . But [[my]0-i father]2082-my father says “ such simplicity might be very well in [Cranford]1-cranford , but would never do in [the world]333-the world . ”[2082-my father] And [I]0-i fancy [the world]333-the world must be very bad , for with all [[my]0-i father]2082-my father ’s suspicion of [every one with whom [he]2082-my father has dealings]1855-every one with whom he has dealings , and in spite of all [his]2082-my father many precautions , [he]2082-my father lost upwards of a thousand pounds by roguery only last year . [I]0-i just stayed long enough to establish [Miss Matty]98-miss matty in [her]98-miss matty new mode of life , and to pack up [the library]1856-the library , which [the rector]2120-the rector had purchased . [He]2120-the rector had written a very kind letter to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , saying “ how glad [he]2120-the rector should be to take [a library]3413-a library , so well selected as [he]2120-the rector knew that [the late Mr Jenkyns]159-mr jenkyns ’s must have been , at any valuation put upon [them]1858-them . ”[2120-the rector] And when [she]98-miss matty agreed to this , with a touch of sorrowful gladness that [they]1858-them would go back to [the rectory]2418-the rectory and be arranged on the accustomed walls once more , [he]2120-the rector sent word that [he]2120-the rector feared that [he]2120-the rector had not room for them all , and perhaps [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would kindly allow [him]2120-the rector to leave some volumes on [her]98-miss matty shelves . But [Miss Matty]98-miss matty said that [she]98-miss matty had [her]98-miss matty Bible and “ [Johnson]247-mr johnson ’s Dictionary , ”[98-miss matty] and should not have much time for reading , [she]98-miss matty was afraid ; still , [I]0-i retained a few books out of consideration for [the rector]2120-the rector ’s kindness . The money which [he]2120-the rector had paid , and that produced by the sale , was partly expended in the stock of tea , and part of it was invested against a rainy day—_i.e . _ old age or illness . It was but a small sum , it is true ; and it occasioned a few evasions of truth and white lies ( all of which [I]0-i think very wrong indeed — in theory — and would rather not put them in practice ) , for [we]1861-we knew [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would be perplexed as to [her]98-miss matty duty if [she]98-miss matty were aware of any little reserve - fund being made for [her]98-miss matty while the debts of [the bank]1628-the bank remained unpaid . Moreover , [she]98-miss matty had never been told of the way in which [[her]98-miss matty friends]453-her friends were contributing to pay the rent . [I]0-i should have liked to tell [her]98-miss matty this , but the mystery of the affair gave a piquancy to [their]1864-their deed of kindness which [the ladies]417-the ladies were unwilling to give up ; and at first [Martha]98-miss matty had to shirk many a perplexed question as to [her]98-miss matty ways and means of living in [such a house]1866-such a house , but by - and - by [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s prudent uneasiness sank down into acquiescence with the existing arrangement . [I]0-i left [Miss Matty]98-miss matty with a good heart . [Her]98-miss matty sales of tea during the first two days had surpassed [my]0-i most sanguine expectations . [The whole country round]1867-the whole country round seemed to be all out of tea at once . The only alteration [I]0-i could have desired in [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s way of doing business was , that [she]98-miss matty should not have so plaintively entreated [some of [[her]98-miss matty customers]1869-her customers]1868-some of her customers not to buy green tea — running it down as a slow poison , sure to destroy the nerves , and produce all manner of evil . [Their]1868-some of her customers pertinacity in taking it , in spite of all [her]98-miss matty warnings , distressed [her]98-miss matty so much that [I]0-i really thought [she]98-miss matty would relinquish the sale of it , and so lose half [her]98-miss matty custom ; and [I]0-i was driven to [my]0-i wits ’ end for instances of longevity entirely attributable to a persevering use of green tea . But the final argument , which settled the question , was a happy reference of mine to the train - oil and tallow candles which [the Esquimaux]260-the esquimaux not only enjoy but digest . After that [she]98-miss matty acknowledged that “ [one man]3414-one man ’s meat might be [another man]3415-another man ’s poison , ”[98-miss matty] and contented [herself]98-miss matty thence - forward with an occasional remonstrance when [she]98-miss matty thought [the purchaser]1870-the purchaser was too young and innocent to be acquainted with the evil effects green tea produced on some constitutions , and an habitual sigh when [people old enough to choose more wisely]1871-people old enough to choose more wisely would prefer it . [I]0-i went over from [Drumble]2-drumble once a quarter at least to settle the accounts , and see after the necessary business letters . And , speaking of letters , [I]0-i began to be very much ashamed of remembering [my]0-i letter to [the Aga Jenkyns]240-the aga jenkyns , and very glad [I]0-i had never named [my]0-i writing to [any one]2107-any one . [I]0-i only hoped the letter was lost . No answer came . No sign was made . About a year after [Miss Matty]98-miss matty set up [shop]2527-shop , [I]0-i received one of [Martha]98-miss matty ’s hieroglyphics , begging [me]0-i to come to [Cranford]1-cranford very soon . [I]0-i was afraid that [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was ill , and went off that very afternoon , and took [Martha]98-miss matty by surprise when [she]98-miss matty saw [me]0-i on opening the door . [We]1874-we went into [the kitchen]635-the kitchen as usual , to have [our]1874-we confidential conference , and then [Martha]98-miss matty told [me]0-i [she]98-miss matty was expecting [her]98-miss matty confinement very soon — in a week or two ; and [she]98-miss matty did not think [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was aware of it , and [she]98-miss matty wanted [me]0-i to break the news to [her]98-miss matty , “ for indeed , [miss]2185-miss , ”[98-miss matty] continued [Martha]98-miss matty , crying hysterically , “ [I]98-miss matty ’m afraid [she]98-miss matty wo n’t approve of it , and [I]98-miss matty ’m sure [I]98-miss matty do n’t know who is to take care of [her]98-miss matty as [she]98-miss matty should be taken care of when [I]98-miss matty am laid up . ”[98-miss matty] [I]0-i comforted [Martha]98-miss matty by telling [her]98-miss matty [I]0-i would remain till [she]98-miss matty was about again , and only wished [she]98-miss matty had told [me]0-i [her]98-miss matty reason for this sudden summons , as then [I]0-i would have brought the requisite stock of clothes . But [Martha]98-miss matty was so tearful and tender - spirited , and unlike [her]98-miss matty usual self , that [I]0-i said as little as possible about [myself]0-i , and endeavoured rather to comfort [Martha]98-miss matty under all the probable and possible misfortunes which came crowding upon [her]98-miss matty imagination . [I]0-i then stole out of [the house]2059-the house - door , and made [my]0-i appearance as if [I]0-i were [a customer in [the shop]716-the shop]1877-a customer in the shop , just to take [Miss Matty]98-miss matty by surprise , and gain an idea of how [she]98-miss matty looked in [her]98-miss matty new situation . It was warm May weather , so only the little half - door was closed ; and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty sat behind the counter , knitting an elaborate pair of garters ; elaborate they seemed to [me]0-i , but the difficult stitch was no weight upon [her]98-miss matty mind , for [she]98-miss matty was singing in a low voice to [herself]98-miss matty as [her]98-miss matty needles went rapidly in and out . [I]0-i call it singing , but [I]0-i dare say [a musician]1879-a musician would not use that word to the tuneless yet sweet humming of the low worn voice . [I]0-i found out from the words , far more than from the attempt at the tune , that it was the Old Hundredth [she]98-miss matty was crooning to [herself]98-miss matty ; but the quiet continuous sound told of content , and gave [me]0-i a pleasant feeling , as [I]0-i stood in [the street]467-the street just outside the door , quite in harmony with that soft May morning . [I]0-i went in . At first [she]98-miss matty did not catch who it was , and stood up as if to serve [me]0-i ; but in another minute watchful pussy had clutched [her]98-miss matty knitting , which was dropped in eager joy at seeing [me]0-i . [I]0-i found , after [we]1881-we had had a little conversation , that it was as [Martha]98-miss matty said , and that [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had no idea of the approaching household event . So [I]0-i thought [I]0-i would let things take [their]1882-their course , secure that when [I]0-i went to [her]98-miss matty with [the baby]879-the baby in [my]0-i arms , [I]0-i should obtain that forgiveness for [Martha]98-miss matty which [she]98-miss matty was needlessly frightening [herself]98-miss matty into believing that [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would withhold , under some notion that [the new claimant]1884-the new claimant would require attentions from [[its]1884-the new claimant mother]1885-its mother that it would be faithless treason to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty to render . But [I]0-i was right . [I]0-i think that must be an hereditary quality , for [[my]0-i father]2082-my father says [he]2082-my father is scarcely ever wrong . One morning , within a week after [I]0-i arrived , [I]0-i went to call [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , with a little bundle of flannel in [my]0-i arms . [She]98-miss matty was very much awestruck when [I]0-i showed [her]98-miss matty what it was , and asked for [her]98-miss matty spectacles off the dressing - table , and looked at it curiously , with a sort of tender wonder at its small perfection of parts . [She]98-miss matty could not banish the thought of the surprise all day , but went about on tiptoe , and was very silent . But [she]98-miss matty stole up to see [Martha]98-miss matty and [they]1887-they both cried with joy , and [she]98-miss matty got into a complimentary speech to [Jem]194-st james , and did not know how to get out of it again , and was only extricated from [her]98-miss matty dilemma by the sound of the shop - bell , which was an equal relief to [the shy , proud , honest [Jem]194-st james]1888-the shy , proud , honest jem , who shook [my]0-i hand so vigorously when [I]0-i congratulated [him]194-st james , that [I]0-i think [I]0-i feel the pain of it yet . [ Picture : [I]0-i went to call [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ] [I]0-i had a busy life while [Martha]98-miss matty was laid up . [I]0-i attended on [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , and prepared [her]98-miss matty meals ; [I]0-i cast up [her]98-miss matty accounts , and examined into the state of [her]98-miss matty canisters and tumblers . [I]0-i helped [her]98-miss matty , too , occasionally , in [the shop]716-the shop ; and it gave [me]0-i no small amusement , and sometimes a little uneasiness , to watch [her]98-miss matty ways there . If [a little child]2752-a little child came in to ask for an ounce of almond - comfits ( and four of the large kind which [Miss Matty]98-miss matty sold weighed that much ) , [she]2752-a little child always added one more by “ way of make - weight , ”[2752-a little child] as [she]2752-a little child called it , although the scale was handsomely turned before ; and when [I]0-i remonstrated against this , [her]2752-a little child reply was , “ The little things like it so much ! ”[2752-a little child] There was no use in telling [her]2752-a little child that the fifth comfit weighed a quarter of an ounce , and made every sale into a loss to [her]2752-a little child pocket . So [I]0-i remembered the green tea , and winged [my]0-i shaft with a feather out of [her]2752-a little child own plumage . [I]0-i told [her]2752-a little child how unwholesome almond - comfits were , and how ill excess in them might make [the little children]1891-the little children . This argument produced some effect ; for , henceforward , instead of [the fifth comfit]1892-the fifth comfit , [she]2752-a little child always told [them]1891-the little children to hold out [their]1891-the little children tiny palms , into which [she]2752-a little child shook either peppermint or ginger lozenges , as a preventive to the dangers that might arise from the previous sale . Altogether the lozenge trade , conducted on these principles , did not promise to be remunerative ; but [I]0-i was happy to find [she]2752-a little child had made more than twenty pounds during the last year by [her]2752-a little child sales of tea ; and , moreover , that now [she]2752-a little child was accustomed to it , [she]2752-a little child did not dislike the employment , which brought [her]2752-a little child into kindly intercourse with [many of [the people round about]1894-the people round about]1893-many of the people round about . If [she]2752-a little child gave [them]1891-the little children good weight , [they]1891-the little children , in [their]1891-the little children turn , brought many a little country present to [[the “ old rector]3417-the “ old rector ’s daughter]3418-the “ old rector ’s daughter ”[2752-a little child] ; a cream cheese , a few new - laid eggs , a little fresh ripe fruit , a bunch of flowers . The counter was quite loaded with these offerings sometimes , as [she]2752-a little child told [me]0-i . As for [Cranford]96-signor brunoni in general , it was going on much as usual . The [Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson and [Hoggins]105-mr hoggins feud still raged , if a feud it could be called , when only one side cared much about it . [Mr]1895-mr and [Mrs Hoggins]105-mr hoggins were very happy together , and , like [most very happy people]1896-most very happy people , quite ready to be friendly ; indeed , [Mrs Hoggins]105-mr hoggins was really desirous to be restored to [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s good graces , because of the former intimacy . But [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson considered [their]1897-their very happiness an insult to [the Glenmire family]1898-the glenmire family , to which [she]78-mrs jamieson had still the honour to belong , and [she]78-mrs jamieson doggedly refused and rejected every advance . [Mr Mulliner]193-mr mulliner , like [a faithful clansman]1899-a faithful clansman , espoused [[his]193-mr mulliner mistress]2616-his mistress ’s side with ardour . If [he]193-mr mulliner saw either [Mr]1901-mr or [Mrs Hoggins]105-mr hoggins , [he]193-mr mulliner would cross [the street]467-the street , and appear absorbed in the contemplation of life in general , and [his]193-mr mulliner own path in particular , until [he]193-mr mulliner had passed [them]1903-them by . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole used to amuse [herself]89-miss pole with wondering what in [the world]333-the world [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson would do , if either [she]78-mrs jamieson , or [Mr Mulliner]193-mr mulliner , or [any other member of [her]78-mrs jamieson household]1905-any other member of her household was taken ill ; [she]89-miss pole could hardly have the face to call in [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins after the way [she]89-miss pole had behaved to [them]1903-them . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole grew quite impatient for some indisposition or accident to befall [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson or [[her]78-mrs jamieson dependents]1906-her dependents , in order that [Cranford]96-signor brunoni might see how [she]89-miss pole would act under the perplexing circumstances . [Martha]98-miss matty was beginning to go about again , and [I]0-i had already fixed a limit , not very far distant , to [my]0-i visit , when one afternoon , as [I]0-i was sitting in [the shop - parlour]1907-the shop - parlour with [Miss Matty]98-miss matty — [I]0-i remember the weather was colder now than it had been in May , three weeks before , and [we]1908-we had a fire and kept the door fully closed — [we]1908-we saw [a gentleman]321-a gentleman go slowly past the window , and then stand opposite to the door , as if looking out for the name which [we]1908-we had so carefully hidden . [He]321-a gentleman took out a double eyeglass and peered about for some time before [he]321-a gentleman could discover it . Then [he]321-a gentleman came in . And , all on a sudden , it flashed across [me]0-i that it was [the Aga]1910-the aga [himself]321-a gentleman ! For [his]321-a gentleman clothes had an out - of - the - way foreign cut about them , and [his]321-a gentleman face was deep brown , as if tanned and re - tanned by the sun . [His]321-a gentleman complexion contrasted oddly with [his]321-a gentleman plentiful snow - white hair , [his]321-a gentleman eyes were dark and piercing , and [he]321-a gentleman had an odd way of contracting them and puckering up [his]321-a gentleman cheeks into innumerable wrinkles when [he]321-a gentleman looked earnestly at objects . [He]321-a gentleman did so to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty when [he]321-a gentleman first came in . [His]321-a gentleman glance had first caught and lingered a little upon [me]0-i , but then turned , with the peculiar searching look [I]0-i have described , to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty . [She]98-miss matty was a little fluttered and nervous , but no more so than [she]98-miss matty always was when [any man]912-any man came into [[her]98-miss matty shop]1912-her shop . [She]98-miss matty thought that [he]321-a gentleman would probably have a note , or a sovereign at least , for which [she]98-miss matty would have to give change , which was an operation [she]98-miss matty very much disliked to perform . But [the present customer]1913-the present customer stood opposite to [her]98-miss matty , without asking for anything , only looking fixedly at [her]98-miss matty as [he]321-a gentleman drummed upon the table with [his]321-a gentleman fingers , just for all [the world]333-the world as [Miss Jenkyns]98-miss matty used to do . [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was on the point of asking [him]321-a gentleman what [he]321-a gentleman wanted ( as [she]98-miss matty told [me]0-i afterwards ) , when [he]321-a gentleman turned sharp to [me]0-i : “ Is [your]98-miss matty name [Mary Smith]261-mary ? ”[321-a gentleman] “ Yes ! ”[0-i] said [I.]0-i All [my]0-i doubts as to [his]321-a gentleman identity were set at rest , and [I]0-i only wondered what [he]321-a gentleman would say or do next , and how [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would stand the joyful shock of what [he]321-a gentleman had to reveal . Apparently [he]321-a gentleman was at a loss how to announce [himself]321-a gentleman , for [he]321-a gentleman looked round at last in search of something to buy , so as to gain time , and , as it happened , [his]321-a gentleman eye caught on the almond - comfits , and [he]321-a gentleman boldly asked for a pound of “ those things . ”[98-miss matty] [I]0-i doubt if [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had a whole pound in [the shop]716-the shop , and , besides the unusual magnitude of the order , [she]98-miss matty was distressed with the idea of the indigestion [they]1916-they would produce , taken in such unlimited quantities . [She]98-miss matty looked up to remonstrate . Something of tender relaxation in [his]321-a gentleman face struck home to [her]98-miss matty heart . [She]98-miss matty said , “ It is — oh , [sir]2208-sir ! can [you]321-a gentleman be [Peter]157-mr peter ? ”[98-miss matty] and trembled from head to foot . In a moment [he]321-a gentleman was round the table and had [her]98-miss matty in [his]321-a gentleman arms , sobbing the tearless cries of old age . [I]0-i brought [her]98-miss matty a glass of wine , for indeed [her]98-miss matty colour had changed so as to alarm [me]0-i and [Mr Peter]157-mr peter too . [He]321-a gentleman kept saying , “ [I]321-a gentleman have been too sudden for [you]98-miss matty , [Matty]98-miss matty — [I]321-a gentleman have , [[my]321-a gentleman little girl]3420-my little girl . ”[321-a gentleman] [I]0-i proposed that [she]98-miss matty should go at once up into [the drawing - room]503-the drawing - room and lie down on the sofa there . [She]98-miss matty looked wistfully at [[her]98-miss matty brother]1500-her brother , whose hand [she]98-miss matty had held tight , even when nearly fainting ; but on [his]321-a gentleman assuring [her]98-miss matty that [he]321-a gentleman would not leave [her]98-miss matty , [she]98-miss matty allowed [him]321-a gentleman to carry [her]98-miss matty [upstairs]340-upstairs . [I]0-i thought that the best [I]0-i could do was to run and put the kettle on the fire for early tea , and then to attend to [the shop]716-the shop , leaving [the brother]1921-the brother and [sister]472-sister to exchange some of the many thousand things [they]1923-they must have to say . [I]0-i had also to break the news to [Martha]98-miss matty , who received it with a burst of tears which nearly infected [me]0-i . [She]98-miss matty kept recovering [herself]98-miss matty to ask if [I]0-i was sure it was indeed [[Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s brother]1924-miss matty ’s brother , for [I]0-i had mentioned that [he]1924-miss matty ’s brother had grey hair , and [she]98-miss matty had always heard that [he]1924-miss matty ’s brother was [a very handsome young man]1925-a very handsome young man . Something of the same kind perplexed [Miss Matty]98-miss matty at tea - time , when [she]98-miss matty was installed in the great easy - chair opposite to [Mr Jenkyns]159-mr jenkyns in order to gaze [her]98-miss matty fill . [She]98-miss matty could hardly drink for looking at [him]1924-miss matty ’s brother , and as for eating , that was out of the question . “ [I]98-miss matty suppose [hot climates age people]3421-hot climates age people very quickly , ”[98-miss matty] said [she]98-miss matty , almost to [herself]98-miss matty . “ When [you]1924-miss matty ’s brother left [Cranford]1-cranford [you]1924-miss matty ’s brother had not a grey hair in [your]1924-miss matty ’s brother head . ”[98-miss matty] “ But how many years ago is that ? ”[157-mr peter] said [Mr Peter]157-mr peter , smiling . “ Ah , true ! yes , [I]98-miss matty suppose [you]1924-miss matty ’s brother and [I]98-miss matty are getting old . But still [I]98-miss matty did not think [we]3422-we were so very old ! But white hair is very becoming to [you]157-mr peter , [Peter]157-mr peter , ”[98-miss matty] [she]98-miss matty continued — a little afraid lest [she]98-miss matty had hurt [him]157-mr peter by revealing how [his]157-mr peter appearance had impressed [her]98-miss matty . “ [I]98-miss matty suppose [I]98-miss matty forgot dates too , [Matty]98-miss matty , for what do [you]98-miss matty think [I]98-miss matty have brought for [you]98-miss matty from [India]15-india ? [I]98-miss matty have an Indian muslin gown and a pearl necklace for [you]98-miss matty somewhere in [my]98-miss matty chest at [Portsmouth]69-portsmouth . ”[98-miss matty] [He]157-mr peter smiled as if amused at the idea of the incongruity of [his]157-mr peter presents with the appearance of [[his]157-mr peter sister]1926-his sister ; but this did not strike [her]98-miss matty all at once , while the elegance of the articles did . [I]0-i could see that for a moment [her]98-miss matty imagination dwelt complacently on the idea of [herself]98-miss matty thus attired ; and instinctively [she]98-miss matty put [her]98-miss matty hand up to [her]98-miss matty throat — that little delicate throat which ( as [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had told [me]0-i ) had been one of [her]98-miss matty youthful charms ; but the hand met the touch of folds of soft muslin in which [she]98-miss matty was always swathed up to [her]98-miss matty chin , and the sensation recalled a sense of the unsuitableness of a pearl necklace to [her]98-miss matty age . [She]98-miss matty said , “ [I]98-miss matty ’m afraid [I]98-miss matty ’m too old ; but it was very kind of [you]157-mr peter to think of it . They are just what [I]98-miss matty should have liked years ago — when [I]98-miss matty was young . ”[98-miss matty] “ So [I]98-miss matty thought , [[my]98-miss matty little [Matty]98-miss matty]3423-my little matty . [I]98-miss matty remembered [your]98-miss matty tastes ; they were so like [[my]98-miss matty dear mother]1368-my dear mother ’s . ”[98-miss matty] At the mention of that name [the brother]1921-the brother and [sister]472-sister clasped [each other]302-each other ’s hands yet more fondly , and , although [they]1930-they were perfectly silent , [I]0-i fancied [they]1930-they might have something to say if [they]1930-they were unchecked by [my]0-i presence , and [I]0-i got up to arrange [[my]0-i room]2916-my room for [[Mr Peter]157-mr peter ’s occupation]1932-mr peter ’s occupation that night , intending [myself]0-i to share [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s bed .
