But at [my]0-i movement , [he]157-mr peter started up . “ [I]157-mr peter must go and settle about [a room at [the ‘ George]1307-the ‘ george]3425-a room at the ‘ george . ’ [My]157-mr peter carpet - bag is there too . ”[157-mr peter] “ No ! ”[98-miss matty] said [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , in great distress—“you must not go ; please , [dear Peter]157-mr peter — pray , [Mary]261-mary — oh ! [you]157-mr peter must not go ! ”[98-miss matty] [She]98-miss matty was so much agitated that [we]1933-we both promised everything [she]98-miss matty wished . [Peter]157-mr peter sat down again and gave [her]98-miss matty [his]157-mr peter hand , which for better security [she]98-miss matty held in both of [hers]98-miss matty , and [I]0-i left [the room]370-the room to accomplish [my]0-i arrangements . Long , long into the night , far , far into the morning , did [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [I]0-i talk . [She]98-miss matty had much to tell [me]0-i of [[her]98-miss matty brother]1500-her brother ’s life and adventures , which [he]157-mr peter had communicated to [her]98-miss matty as [they]1936-they had sat alone . [She]98-miss matty said all was thoroughly clear to [her]98-miss matty ; but [I]0-i never quite understood the whole story ; and when in after days [I]0-i lost [my]0-i awe of [Mr Peter]157-mr peter enough to question [him]157-mr peter [myself]0-i , [he]157-mr peter laughed at [my]0-i curiosity , and told [me]0-i stories that sounded so very much like [Baron Munchausen]262-baron munchausen ’s , that [I]0-i was sure [he]157-mr peter was making fun of [me]0-i . What [I]0-i heard from [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was that [he]157-mr peter had been [a volunteer at the siege of [Rangoon]70-rangoon]1937-a volunteer at the siege of rangoon ; had been taken prisoner by [the Burmese]263-the burmese ; and somehow obtained favour and eventual freedom from knowing how to bleed [the chief of [the small tribe]1939-the small tribe]1938-the chief of the small tribe in some case of dangerous illness ; that on [his]157-mr peter release from years of captivity [he]157-mr peter had had [his]157-mr peter letters returned from [England]3-england with the ominous word “ Dead ”[157-mr peter] marked upon them ; and , believing [himself]157-mr peter to be the last of [[his]157-mr peter race]1940-his race , [he]157-mr peter had settled down as [an indigo planter]1941-an indigo planter , and had proposed to spend the remainder of [his]157-mr peter life in [the country]710-the country to whose inhabitants and modes of life [he]157-mr peter had become habituated , when [my]0-i letter had reached [him]157-mr peter ; and , with the odd vehemence which characterised [him]157-mr peter in age as it had done in youth , [he]157-mr peter had sold [[his]157-mr peter land]1943-his land and all [his]157-mr peter possessions to [the first purchaser]1944-the first purchaser , and come [home]306-home to [the poor old sister]1946-the poor old sister , who was more glad and rich than [any princess]1947-any princess when [she]1946-the poor old sister looked at [him]157-mr peter . [She]1946-the poor old sister talked [me]0-i to sleep at last , and then [I]0-i was awakened by a slight sound at the door , for which [she]1946-the poor old sister begged [my]0-i pardon as [she]1946-the poor old sister crept penitently into bed ; but it seems that when [I]0-i could no longer confirm [her]1946-the poor old sister belief that [the long - lost]1948-the long - lost was really [here]2357-here — under the same roof — [she]1946-the poor old sister had begun to fear lest it was only a waking dream of [hers]1946-the poor old sister ; that there never had been a [Peter]157-mr peter sitting by [her]1946-the poor old sister all that blessed evening — but that [the real Peter]1950-the real peter lay dead far away beneath [some wild sea - wave]1951-some wild sea - wave , or under [some strange eastern tree]1952-some strange eastern tree . And so strong had this nervous feeling of [hers]1946-the poor old sister become , that [she]1946-the poor old sister was fain to get up and go and convince [herself]1946-the poor old sister that [he]157-mr peter was really there by listening through the door to [his]157-mr peter even , regular breathing — [I]0-i do n’t like to call it snoring , but [I]0-i heard it [myself]0-i through two closed doors — and by - and - by it soothed [Miss Matty]98-miss matty to sleep . [I]0-i do n’t believe [Mr Peter]157-mr peter came [home]306-home from [India]15-india as rich as [a nabob]1954-a nabob ; [he]157-mr peter even considered [himself]157-mr peter poor , but neither [he]157-mr peter nor [Miss Matty]98-miss matty cared much about that . At any rate , [he]157-mr peter had enough to live upon “ very genteelly ”[98-miss matty] at [Cranford]1-cranford ; [he]157-mr peter and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty together . And a day or two after [his]157-mr peter arrival , [the shop]716-the shop was closed , while [troops of little urchins]1956-troops of little urchins gleefully awaited the shower of [comfits]1957-comfits and lozenges that came from time to time down upon [their]1956-troops of little urchins faces as [they]1956-troops of little urchins stood up - gazing at [[Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s drawing - room windows]1958-miss matty ’s drawing - room windows . [Occasionally Miss Matty]98-miss matty would say to [them]1956-troops of little urchins ( half - hidden behind the curtains ) , “ [[My]98-miss matty dear children]3427-my dear children , do n’t make [yourselves]3427-my dear children ill ; ”[98-miss matty] but a strong arm pulled [her]98-miss matty back , and a more rattling shower than ever succeeded . A part of the tea was sent in presents to [the Cranford ladies]305-the cranford ladies ; and some of it was distributed among [the old people who remembered [Mr Peter]157-mr peter in the days of [his]157-mr peter frolicsome youth]1960-the old people who remembered mr peter in the days of his frolicsome youth . The Indian muslin gown was reserved for [darling Flora Gordon]111-flora ( [[Miss Jessie Brown]85-miss jessie ’s daughter]1961-miss jessie brown ’s daughter ) . [The Gordons]264-the gordons had been on [the Continent]71-the continent for the last few years , but were now expected to return very soon ; and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , in [her]98-miss matty sisterly pride , anticipated great delight in the joy of showing [them]264-the gordons [Mr Peter]157-mr peter . The pearl necklace disappeared ; and about that time many handsome and useful presents made [their]264-the gordons appearance in [the households of [Miss Pole]89-miss pole and [Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester]1962-the households of miss pole and mrs forrester ; and some rare and delicate Indian ornaments graced [the drawing - rooms of [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson and [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam]1963-the drawing - rooms of mrs jamieson and mrs fitz - adam . [I]0-i [myself]0-i was not forgotten . Among other things , [I]0-i had the handsomest - bound and best edition of [Dr Johnson]91-dr johnson ’s works that could be procured ; and dear [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , with tears in [her]98-miss matty eyes , begged [me]0-i to consider it as a present from [[her]98-miss matty sister]394-her sister as well as [herself]98-miss matty . In short , [no one]477-no one was forgotten ; and , what was more , [every one]426-every one , however insignificant , who had shown kindness to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty at any time , was sure of [Mr Peter]157-mr peter ’s cordial regard . [CHAPTER XVI . PEACE TO CRANFORD]265-chapter xvi . peace to cranford IT was not surprising that [Mr Peter]157-mr peter became such a favourite at [Cranford]1-cranford . [The ladies]417-the ladies vied with each other who should admire [him]157-mr peter most ; and no wonder , for [their]417-the ladies quiet lives were astonishingly stirred up by the arrival from [India]15-india — especially as [the person]1968-the person arrived told more wonderful stories than [Sindbad the Sailor]266-sindbad the sailor ; and , as [Miss Pole]89-miss pole said , was quite as good as an Arabian Night any evening . For [my]0-i own part , [I]0-i had vibrated all [my]0-i life between [Drumble]2-drumble and [Cranford]1-cranford , and [I]0-i thought it was quite possible that all [Mr Peter]157-mr peter ’s stories might be true , although wonderful ; but when [I]0-i found that , if [we]1969-we swallowed an anecdote of tolerable magnitude one week , [we]1969-we had the dose considerably increased the next , [I]0-i began to have [my]0-i doubts ; especially as [I]0-i noticed that when [[his]157-mr peter sister]1926-his sister was present the accounts of Indian life were comparatively tame ; not that [she]1926-his sister knew more than [we]1969-we did , perhaps less . [I]0-i noticed also that when [the rector]2120-the rector came to call , [Mr Peter]157-mr peter talked in a different way about [the countries [he]157-mr peter had been in]1972-the countries he had been in . But [I]0-i do n’t think [the ladies in]1973-the ladies in [Cranford]1-cranford would have considered [him]157-mr peter such [a wonderful traveller]1974-a wonderful traveller if [they]1973-the ladies in had only heard [him]157-mr peter talk in the quiet way [he]157-mr peter did to [him]157-mr peter . [They]1973-the ladies in liked [him]157-mr peter the better , indeed , for being what [they]1973-the ladies in called “ [[so very Oriental . ”]3428-so very oriental . ”]3428-so very oriental . ”[1973-the ladies in] One day , at a select party in [his]157-mr peter honour , which [Miss Pole]89-miss pole gave , and from which , as [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson honoured [it]1975-it with [her]78-mrs jamieson presence , and had even offered to send [Mr Mulliner]193-mr mulliner to wait , [Mr]1976-mr and [Mrs Hoggins]105-mr hoggins and [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam were necessarily excluded — one day at [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s , [Mr Peter]157-mr peter said [he]157-mr peter was tired of sitting upright against the hard - backed uneasy chairs , and asked if [he]157-mr peter might not indulge [himself]157-mr peter in sitting cross - legged . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole ’s consent was eagerly given , and down [he]157-mr peter went with the utmost gravity . But when [Miss Pole]89-miss pole asked [me]0-i , in an audible whisper , “ if [he]157-mr peter did not remind [me]89-miss pole of [the Father of [the Faithful]3431-the faithful]3430-the father of the faithful ? ”[89-miss pole] [I]0-i could not help thinking of poor [Simon Jones]267-simon jones , [the lame tailor]1977-the lame tailor , and while [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson slowly commented on the elegance and convenience of the attitude , [I]0-i remembered how [we]1978-we had all followed [that lady]603-that lady ’s lead in condemning [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins for vulgarity because [he]105-mr hoggins simply crossed [his]105-mr hoggins legs as [he]105-mr hoggins sat still on [his]105-mr hoggins chair . Many of [Mr Peter]157-mr peter ’s ways of eating were a little strange amongst [such ladies as [Miss Pole]89-miss pole]1980-such ladies as miss pole , and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , and [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson , especially when [I]0-i recollected the untasted green peas and two - pronged forks at poor [Mr Holbrook]119-mr holbrook ’s dinner . The mention of [that gentleman]1981-that gentleman ’s name recalls to [my]0-i mind a conversation between [Mr Peter]157-mr peter and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty one evening in the summer after [he]1981-that gentleman returned to [Cranford]1-cranford . The day had been very hot , and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had been much oppressed by the weather , in the heat of which [[her]98-miss matty brother]1500-her brother revelled . [I]0-i remember that [she]98-miss matty had been unable to nurse [[Martha]98-miss matty ’s baby]1983-martha ’s baby , which had become [her]98-miss matty favourite employment of late , and which was as much at [home]306-home in [her]98-miss matty arms as in [[its]98-miss matty mother]1885-its mother ’s , as long as it remained a light - weight , portable by one so fragile as [Miss Matty]98-miss matty . This day to which [I]0-i refer , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had seemed more than usually feeble and languid , and only revived when the sun went down , and [her]98-miss matty sofa was wheeled to the open window , through which , although [it]1986-it looked into [the principal street of Cranford]1987-the principal street of cranford , the fragrant smell of the neighbouring hayfields came in every now and then , borne by the soft breezes that stirred the dull air of the summer twilight , and then died away . The silence of the sultry atmosphere was lost in the murmuring noises which came in from many an open window and door ; even [the children]2581-the children were abroad in [the street]467-the street , late as it was ( between ten and eleven ) , enjoying the game of play for which [they]2581-the children had not had spirits during the heat of the day . It was a source of satisfaction to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty to see how few candles were lighted , even in [the apartments of [those houses from which issued the greatest signs of life]1991-those houses from which issued the greatest signs of life]1990-the apartments of those houses from which issued the greatest signs of life . [Mr Peter]157-mr peter , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , and [I]0-i had all been quiet , each with a separate reverie , for some little time , when [Mr Peter]157-mr peter broke in — “ Do [you]98-miss matty know , [little Matty]98-miss matty , [I]157-mr peter could have sworn [you]98-miss matty were on the high road to matrimony when [I]157-mr peter left [England]3-england that last time ! If [anybody]2833-anybody had told [me]157-mr peter [you]98-miss matty would have lived and died [an old maid]3433-an old maid then , [I]157-mr peter should have laughed in [their]2833-anybody faces . ”[157-mr peter] [Miss Matty]98-miss matty made no reply , and [I]0-i tried in vain to think of some subject which should effectually turn the conversation ; but [I]0-i was very stupid ; and before [I]0-i spoke [he]157-mr peter went on — “ It was [Holbrook]119-mr holbrook , [that fine manly fellow who lived at [Woodley]19-woodley , that [I]1992-i used to think would carry off [my]1992-i little [Matty]98-miss matty]3434-that fine manly fellow who lived at woodley , that i used to think would carry off my little matty . [You]98-miss matty would not think it now , [I]1992-i dare say , [Mary]261-mary ; but [this sister of mine]3435-this sister of mine was once [a very pretty girl]3436-a very pretty girl — at least , [I]1992-i thought so , and so [I]1992-i ’ve a notion did [poor Holbrook]119-mr holbrook . What business had [he]119-mr holbrook to die before [I]1992-i came [home]306-home to thank [him]119-mr holbrook for all [his]119-mr holbrook kindness to [a good - for - nothing cub as [I]1992-i was]3438-a good - for - nothing cub as i was ? It was that that made [me]1992-i first think [he]119-mr holbrook cared for [you]98-miss matty ; for in all [our]3439-our fishing expeditions it was [Matty]98-miss matty , [Matty]98-miss matty , [we]3439-our talked about . Poor [Deborah]99-deborah ! What a lecture [she]99-deborah read [me]1992-i on having asked [him]119-mr holbrook [home]306-home to lunch one day , when [she]99-deborah had seen [[the Arley]160-lady arley carriage in [the town]281-the town]3441-the arley carriage in the town , and thought that [[my]1992-i lady]1151-my lady might call . Well , that ’s long years ago ; more than half a life - time , and yet it seems like yesterday ! [I]1992-i do n’t know [a fellow [I]1992-i should have liked better as [a brother - in - law]3445-a brother - in - law]3444-a fellow i should have liked better as a brother - in - law . [You]98-miss matty must have played [your]98-miss matty cards badly , [[my]1992-i little]3446-my little [Matty]98-miss matty , somehow or another — wanted [[your]98-miss matty brother]3447-your brother to be [a good go - between]3448-a good go - between , eh , [little one]3449-little one ? ”[1992-i] said [he]1992-i , putting out [his]1992-i hand to take hold of [hers]1993-hers as [she]1993-hers lay on the sofa . “ Why , what ’s this ? [you]98-miss matty ’re shivering and shaking , [Matty]98-miss matty , with that confounded open window . Shut it , [Mary]261-mary , this minute ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i did so , and then stooped down to kiss [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , and see if [she]98-miss matty really were chilled . [She]98-miss matty caught at [my]0-i hand , and gave it a hard squeeze — but unconsciously , [I]0-i think — for in a minute or two [she]98-miss matty spoke to [us]1994-us quite in [her]98-miss matty usual voice , and smiled [our]1994-us uneasiness away , although [she]98-miss matty patiently submitted to the prescriptions [we]1994-us enforced of a warm bed and a glass of weak negus . [I]0-i was to leave [Cranford]1-cranford the next day , and before [I]0-i went [I]0-i saw that all the effects of the open window had quite vanished . [I]0-i had superintended most of the alterations necessary in [the house]2059-the house and [household]1996-household during the latter weeks of [my]0-i stay . [The shop]716-the shop was once more [a parlour]1998-a parlour : [the empty resounding rooms]1999-the empty resounding rooms again furnished up to [the very garrets]2000-the very garrets . There had been some talk of establishing [Martha]98-miss matty and [Jem]194-st james in [another house]2001-another house , but [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would not hear of this . Indeed , [I]0-i never saw [her]98-miss matty so much roused as when [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had assumed it to be the most desirable arrangement . As long as [Martha]98-miss matty would remain with [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was only too thankful to have [her]98-miss matty about [her]98-miss matty ; yes , and [Jem]194-st james too , who was [a very pleasant man]2002-a very pleasant man to have in [the house]2059-the house , for [she]98-miss matty never saw [him]194-st james from week ’s end to week ’s end . And as for [the probable children]2004-the probable children , if [they]2004-the probable children would all turn out [such little darlings as [[her]98-miss matty god - daughter]2006-her god - daughter]2005-such little darlings as her god - daughter , [Matilda]86-miss jenkyns , [she]98-miss matty should not mind the number , if [Martha]98-miss matty did n’t . Besides , the next was to be called [Deborah]99-deborah — a point which [Miss Matty]98-miss matty had reluctantly yielded to [Martha]98-miss matty ’s stubborn determination that [her]98-miss matty first - born was to be [Matilda]86-miss jenkyns . So [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had to lower [her]89-miss pole colours , and even [her]89-miss pole voice , as [she]89-miss pole said to [me]0-i that , as [Mr]2007-mr and [Mrs Hearn]268-mrs hearn were still to go on living in [the same house]502-the same house with [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , [we]2009-we had certainly done a wise thing in hiring [[Martha]98-miss matty ’s niece]2010-martha ’s niece as [an auxiliary]2011-an auxiliary . [I]0-i left [Miss Matty]98-miss matty and [Mr Peter]157-mr peter most comfortable and contented ; the only subject for regret to the tender heart of [the one]2012-the one , and the social friendly nature of the other , being the unfortunate quarrel between [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson and [the plebeian Hogginses]269-the plebeian hogginses and [their]269-the plebeian hogginses following . In joke , [I]0-i prophesied one day that this would only last until [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson or [Mr Mulliner]193-mr mulliner were ill , in which case [they]269-the plebeian hogginses would only be too glad to be friends with [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ; but [Miss Matty]98-miss matty did not like [my]0-i looking forward to anything like illness in so light a manner , and before the year was out all had come round in a far more satisfactory way . [I]0-i received two [Cranford]265-chapter xvi . peace to cranford letters on one auspicious October morning . Both [Miss Pole]89-miss pole and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty wrote to ask [me]0-i to come over and meet [the Gordons]264-the gordons , who had returned to [England]3-england alive and well with [[their]264-the gordons two children]2013-their two children , now almost grown up . [Dear Jessie Brown]270-dear jessie brown had kept [her]270-dear jessie brown old kind nature , although [she]270-dear jessie brown had changed [her]270-dear jessie brown name and station ; and [she]270-dear jessie brown wrote to say that [she]270-dear jessie brown and [Major Gordon]108-major gordon expected to be in [Cranford]1-cranford on the fourteenth , and [she]270-dear jessie brown hoped and begged to be remembered to [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ( named first , as became [her]270-dear jessie brown honourable station ) , [Miss Pole]89-miss pole and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty — could [she]270-dear jessie brown ever forget [their]264-the gordons kindness to [[her]270-dear jessie brown poor father]2014-her poor father and [sister?—Mrs Forrester]77-mrs forrester , [Mr Hoggins]105-mr hoggins ( and here again came in an allusion to kindness shown to the dead long ago ) , [[his]105-mr hoggins new wife]2015-his new wife , who as such must allow [Mrs Gordon]110-mrs gordon to desire to make [her]110-mrs gordon acquaintance , and who was , moreover , [an old Scotch friend of [[her]270-dear jessie brown husband]601-her husband ’s]2016-an old scotch friend of her husband ’s . In short , [every one]426-every one was named , from [the rector]2120-the rector — who had been appointed to [Cranford]1-cranford in the interim between [Captain Brown]80-captain brown ’s death and [Miss Jessie]85-miss jessie ’s marriage , and was now associated with the latter event — down to [Miss Betty Barker]81-miss barker . [All]2020-all were asked to the luncheon ; all except [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam , who had come to live in [Cranford]1-cranford since [Miss Jessie Brown]85-miss jessie ’s days , and whom [I]0-i found rather moping on account of the omission . [People]359-people wondered at [Miss Betty Barker]81-miss barker ’s being included in the honourable list ; but , then , as [Miss Pole]89-miss pole said , [we]2022-we must remember the disregard of the genteel proprieties of life in which [the poor captain]532-the poor captain had educated [[his]532-the poor captain girls]2024-his girls , and for [his]532-the poor captain sake [we]2022-we swallowed [our]2022-we pride . Indeed , [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson rather took it as a compliment , as putting [Miss Betty]81-miss barker ( formerly _ [[her]78-mrs jamieson _ maid]2025-her _ maid ) on a level with “ [those Hogginses]3450-those hogginses . ”[78-mrs jamieson] But when [I]0-i arrived in [Cranford]1-cranford , nothing was as yet ascertained of [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson ’s own intentions ; would [the honourable lady]2646-the honourable lady go , or would [she]2646-the honourable lady not ? [Mr Peter]157-mr peter declared that [she]2646-the honourable lady should and [she]2646-the honourable lady would ; [Miss Pole]89-miss pole shook [her]89-miss pole head and desponded . But [Mr Peter]157-mr peter was [a man of resources]2027-a man of resources . In the first place , [he]157-mr peter persuaded [Miss Matty]98-miss matty to write to [Mrs Gordon]110-mrs gordon , and to tell [her]110-mrs gordon of [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam ’s existence , and to beg that [one so kind , and cordial , and generous]2028-one so kind , and cordial , and generous , might be included in the pleasant invitation . An answer came back by return of post , with a pretty little note for [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam , and a request that [Miss Matty]98-miss matty would deliver it [herself]98-miss matty and explain the previous omission . [Mrs Fitz - Adam]168-mrs fitz - adam was as pleased as could be , and thanked [Miss Matty]98-miss matty over and over again . [Mr Peter]157-mr peter had said , “ Leave [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson to [me]157-mr peter ; ”[157-mr peter] so [we]2029-we did ; especially as [we]2029-we knew nothing that [we]2029-we could do to alter [her]110-mrs gordon determination if once formed . [I]0-i did not know , nor did [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , how things were going on , until [Miss Pole]89-miss pole asked [me]0-i , just the day before [Mrs Gordon]110-mrs gordon came , if [I]0-i thought there was anything between [Mr Peter]157-mr peter and [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson in the matrimonial line , for that [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson was really going to the lunch at [the “ George]72-the “ george . ”[110-mrs gordon] [She]110-mrs gordon had sent [Mr Mulliner]193-mr mulliner down to desire that there might be a footstool put to the warmest seat in [the room]370-the room , as [she]110-mrs gordon meant to come , and knew that [their]2031-their chairs were very high . [Miss Pole]89-miss pole had picked this piece of news up , and from it [she]89-miss pole conjectured all sorts of things , and bemoaned yet more . “ If [Peter]157-mr peter should marry , what would become of [poor dear Miss Matty]98-miss matty ? And [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson , of [all people]3451-all people ! ”[89-miss pole] [Miss Pole]89-miss pole seemed to think there were [other ladies in [Cranford]1-cranford]2032-other ladies in cranford who would have done more credit to [his]193-mr mulliner choice , and [I]0-i think [she]110-mrs gordon must have had [someone who was unmarried in [her]110-mrs gordon head]2033-someone who was unmarried in her head , for [she]110-mrs gordon kept saying , “ It was so wanting in delicacy in [a widow to think of such a thing]3452-a widow to think of such a thing . ”[110-mrs gordon] When [I]0-i got back to [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s [I]0-i really did begin to think that [Mr Peter]157-mr peter might be thinking of [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson for [a wife]2034-a wife , and [I]0-i was as unhappy as [Miss Pole]89-miss pole about it . [He]157-mr peter had the proof sheet of a great placard in [his]157-mr peter hand . “ [Signor Brunoni]96-signor brunoni , Magician to [the King of [Delhi]73-delhi]3453-the king of delhi , [the Rajah of Oude]271-the rajah of oude , and [the great Lama of [Thibet]241-great lama of thibet]3454-the great lama of thibet , ”[157-mr peter] & amp;c . & amp;c . , was going to “ perform in [Cranford]1-cranford for one night only , ”[98-miss matty] the very next night ; and [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , exultant , showed [me]0-i a letter from [the Gordons]264-the gordons , promising to remain over this gaiety , which [Miss Matty]98-miss matty said was entirely [Peter]157-mr peter ’s doing . [He]157-mr peter had written to ask [the signor]3128-the signor to come , and was to be at all the expenses of the affair . Tickets were to be sent gratis to as many as [the room]370-the room would hold . In short , [Miss Matty]98-miss matty was charmed with the plan , and said that to - morrow [Cranford]1-cranford would remind [her]98-miss matty of the Preston Guild , to which [she]98-miss matty had been in [her]98-miss matty youth — a luncheon at [the “ George]2788-the “ george , ”[98-miss matty] with [the dear Gordons]264-the gordons , and [the signor]3128-the signor in [the Assembly Room]1261-the assembly room in the evening . But [I]0-i — [I]0-i looked only at the fatal words : — “ _ Under the Patronage of [the _ HONOURABLE MRS JAMIESON]78-mrs jamieson . ”[0-i] [She]98-miss matty , then , was chosen to preside over this entertainment of [Mr Peter]157-mr peter ’s ; [she]98-miss matty was perhaps going to displace [[my]0-i dear]2063-my dear [Miss Matty]98-miss matty in [his]157-mr peter heart , and make [her]98-miss matty life lonely once more ! [I]0-i could not look forward to the morrow with any pleasure ; and every innocent anticipation of [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s only served to add to [my]0-i annoyance . So , angry and irritated , and exaggerating every little incident which could add to [my]0-i irritation , [I]0-i went on till [we]2040-we were all assembled in [the great parlour at [the “ George]2788-the “ george]3456-the great parlour at the “ george . ”[108-major gordon] [Major]108-major gordon and [Mrs Gordon]110-mrs gordon and [pretty Flora]111-flora and [Mr Ludovic]272-mr ludovic were all as bright and handsome and friendly as could be ; but [I]0-i could hardly attend to [them]2041-them for watching [Mr Peter]157-mr peter , and [I]0-i saw that [Miss Pole]89-miss pole was equally busy . [I]0-i had never seen [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson so roused and animated before ; [her]78-mrs jamieson face looked full of interest in what [Mr Peter]157-mr peter was saying . [I]0-i drew near to listen . [My]0-i relief was great when [I]0-i caught that [his]157-mr peter words were not words of love , but that , for all [his]157-mr peter grave face , [he]157-mr peter was at [his]157-mr peter old tricks . [He]157-mr peter was telling [her]78-mrs jamieson of [his]157-mr peter travels in [India]15-india , and describing [the wonderful height of [the Himalaya mountains]2043-the himalaya mountains]2042-the wonderful height of the himalaya mountains : one touch after another added to their size , and each exceeded the former in absurdity ; but [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson really enjoyed all in perfect good faith . [I]0-i suppose [she]78-mrs jamieson required strong stimulants to excite [her]78-mrs jamieson to come out of [her]78-mrs jamieson apathy . [Mr Peter]157-mr peter wound up [his]157-mr peter account by saying that , of course , at that altitude there were none of the animals to be found that existed in [the lower regions]2044-the lower regions ; the game,—everything was different . Firing one day at [some flying creature]2045-some flying creature , [he]157-mr peter was very much dismayed when it fell , to find that [he]157-mr peter had shot [a cherubim]2046-a cherubim ! [Mr Peter]157-mr peter caught [my]0-i eye at this moment , and gave [me]0-i such a funny twinkle , that [I]0-i felt sure [he]157-mr peter had no thoughts of [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson as [a wife]2034-a wife from that time . [She]78-mrs jamieson looked uncomfortably amazed — “ But , [Mr Peter]157-mr peter , shooting [a cherubim]2046-a cherubim — don’t [you]157-mr peter think — [I]78-mrs jamieson am afraid that was sacrilege ! ”[78-mrs jamieson] [Mr Peter]157-mr peter composed [his]157-mr peter countenance in a moment , and appeared shocked at the idea , which , as [he]157-mr peter said truly enough , was now presented to [him]157-mr peter for the first time ; but then [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson must remember that [he]157-mr peter had been living for a long time among [savages]2048-savages — [all of [whom]2048-savages were [heathens]2050-heathens]2049-all of whom were heathens — some of [them]2048-savages , [he]157-mr peter was afraid , were [downright Dissenters]2051-downright dissenters . Then , seeing [Miss Matty]98-miss matty draw near , [he]157-mr peter hastily changed the conversation , and after a little while , turning to [me]0-i , [he]157-mr peter said , “ Do n’t be shocked , [prim little Mary]261-mary , at all [my]157-mr peter wonderful stories . [I]157-mr peter consider [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson fair game , and besides [I]157-mr peter am bent on propitiating [her]98-miss matty , and the first step towards it is keeping [her]98-miss matty well awake . [I]157-mr peter bribed [her]98-miss matty here by asking [her]98-miss matty to let [me]157-mr peter have [her]98-miss matty name as [patroness]3459-patroness for [[my]157-mr peter poor conjuror]3460-my poor conjuror this evening ; and [I]157-mr peter do n’t want to give [her]98-miss matty time enough to get up [her]98-miss matty rancour against [the Hogginses , who are just coming in]3461-the hogginses , who are just coming in . [I]157-mr peter want [everybody]296-everybody to be [friends]3381-friends , for it harasses [Matty]98-miss matty so much to hear of these quarrels . [I]157-mr peter shall go at it again by - and - by , so [you]3464-you need not look shocked . [I]157-mr peter intend to enter [the Assembly Room]1261-the assembly room to - night with [Mrs Jamieson]78-mrs jamieson on one side , and [[my]157-mr peter lady]1151-my lady , [Mrs Hoggins]105-mr hoggins , on the other . [You]3464-you see if [I]157-mr peter do n’t . ”[157-mr peter] Somehow or another [he]2052-he did ; and fairly got [them]2053-them into conversation together . [Major]108-major gordon and [Mrs Gordon]110-mrs gordon helped at the good work with [their]2053-them perfect ignorance of any existing coolness between [any of [the inhabitants of [Cranford]1-cranford]343-the inhabitants of cranford]2054-any of the inhabitants of cranford . Ever since that day there has been the old friendly sociability in [Cranford]1-cranford society ; which [I]0-i am thankful for , because of [[my]0-i dear]2063-my dear [Miss Matty]98-miss matty ’s love of peace and kindliness . [We]2057-we all love [Miss Matty]98-miss matty , and [I]0-i somehow think [we]2057-we are all of [us]2057-we better when [she]98-miss matty is near [us]2057-we . * * * * * PRINTED BY [TURNBULL]273-turnbull AND [SPEARS]274-spears , EDINBURGH * * *
